loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José es un hombre, emprendedor con mucho deseo de superación en la vida.  Desde hace dieciséis años trabaja en la reparación de zapato, luego comenzó a elaborar zapatos nuevos cuando logro ir comprando las maquinarias necesarias para la elaboración a si como material para hacer los zapatos. El aprendió todo esto en la ciudad de camuapa el cual ha sido su medio de trabajo y sustento para su familia que junto con su esposa luchan para poder ofrecer a sus tres hijos  los estudio como la alimentación. Ella palmea tortilla en su casa para poder saldar los gastos básicos del agua, luz, entre otros. El desea invertir con este financiamiento en la compra de cuero variado para hacer diferentes estilos de zapato para vender en esta navidad el cual espera vender ya que han estado bajas las ventas. Sus planes es poder hacer su propia casa ya que aun vive en un cuarto donde su mama, para el, ha sido difícil pero no ha logrado construir por que no ha tenido los recursos lo que se le hace incomodo por que no tiene la privacidad que desea. Oh el bien para sus hijos. Muy contento por la aprobación del crédito que hará posible la inversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco José is an enterprising man determined to overcome life’s obstacles. After almost 16 years of working in shoe repair, he started making shoes once he was able to buy the necessary tools and materials. He learned this trade, which has been his work and means of supporting his family, in the city of Camuapa. He and his wife strive to educate and provide for their children. She makes homemade tortillas to cover their basic expenses like water and electricity, among others.
Lately sales have been low so he plans to use the loan to buy a variety of leathers to make different styles of shoe to sell this Christmas. His plans are to buy his own house since he still lives in a room in his mother’s home; it has been difficult for him but he has not had the means to build one. He does not have the privacy he would like and wants to provide a better life for his children. He is very happy for the loan, which has allowed him to invest in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of leather to make different styles of shoe

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis A. S. A. tiene 18 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos. El vive en China Kicha con su familia. El crédito lo quiere para reparar el moto de trabajo. El trabaja como un agricultor en fincas alejadas de su casa y en algunas epocas del año, trabaja en construccion. Este prestamo le ayudaría para transportarse al trabajo .  Es la primera vez don Luis  se financia con FUDECOSUR. El desea que pueda llegar mas rapido al trabajo y su objetivo es ayudar a sus padres. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Luis A. S. A. is 18 years old and single. He has no children. He lives in China Kicha with his family. The loan which he seeks is for the repair of his motorbike, which he uses to get to work. He works as a farm worker on farms far away from his house and, in some seasons, as a construction worker. This loan would help him transport himself to his job. This is the first time that Don Luis has sought financing from FUDECOSUR. He wants to be able to arrive at work faster. His goal is to help his parents.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a motorbike

loans.name: Sorbeh Traders Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Sorbeh Traders' group from the northern City of Makeni. They are petty traders who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses. With the help of this loan, these petty traders will be able to add more goods to their businesses so that sales and profit-to-sales-margin will increase. In this way, they can easily repay the loan and better look after themselves and their children. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu M. on the left in the photo. The 32-year-old sells market food – margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, rice, groundnuts/peanuts, onions, etc.  She has been in this business for 9 years now. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above items wholesale and selling retail.

loans.use: Buy margi, pepper, rice, groundnuts/peanuts, onions, etc.

loans.name: Ines' Group

texts.en: Ines D. is from the village of Dadda, Tuguegarao City. She is 56 years old. Ines is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Ines is married and has eight children. To make a living, Ines provides laundry services in the local community. Ines has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Ines joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ines has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Ines is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Monica Mariela

texts.es:
Mónica es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Mónica es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Mónica vende golosinas en la puerta de una escuela, además Mónica vende salchipapas de manera ambulatoria en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza por las noches.
Mónica necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y platos descartables.
El sueño de Mónica son comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the Florecer communal bank. Mónica lives with her life partner, is 24 years old, and has one son. She sells sweets at the entrance gate of a school. In addition, Mónica wanders along a very busy avenue selling salchipapas (fried potatoes with sausage); this latter activity is at night. Mónica needs a 1400 sol loan to buy sweets and disposable plates. Mónica's dream is to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets and disposable plates.

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en: Gregory is an entrepreneur who operates a furniture business. He has been in the business for five years and employs one person. He was previously running a welding shop. His wife is a hairdresser and they are blessed with eight children, who are in school. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him increase his business income. He looks forward to expanding his business in the future. To do this, he has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy timber and nails for making more furniture. He describes himself as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy timber and nails

loans.name: Noorya Waisy Group

texts.en:
Noorya is a woman who is the leader of Noorya Waisy Group. She is 35 years old, is married, and is the mother of three children. She lives in a household of five members, including her husband.

Noorya has been involved in tailoring for more than three years. She sews male and female clothing and now she wants to buy more cloth for her business.

Noorya is happy with this loan process and with her family. He wants to say that without this loan, it would be impossible to help her family improve their living conditions. She would like to thank all lenders and especially those who will help her obtain a loan.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Ruqaiya Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya parveen is from Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: two boys and two girls.  Besides her youngest son who is just two years old, the other kids are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. 

Her husband's name is M. I. and he is a trained cook.  He sells Punjabi foods such as (Dahi Bhalay and Daal Chawal) in the main market. He began selling these products in 2005. 

Ruqaiya is asking for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to purchase cooking oil, spices, lentils and rice. This loan will help grow her husband’s food business and keep his customers satisfied.

loans.use: Buy food items to cook and sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús M. de 36 años de edad, reside en Nahuizalco, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como carpintero, su suegra quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a sus tres hijos de 6, 4 y 1 años de edad, de los cuales los dos mayores estudian. Teresa se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 10 años, negocio el cual está ubicado en el mercado de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, por lo que cada mañana debe viajar una larga distancia para poder llegar a su lugar de trabajo. Teresa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con la capacidad económica para surtir su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de verduras, sobre todo aquellas que se venden más, esto con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean de gran beneficio para su familia y hogar. Ella es una mujer muy alegre que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús M. is 36 years old and resides in Nahuizalco, which is located in the Department of Sonsonate. She lives with her husband who works as a carpenter. Her mother-in-law takes care of the household chores and looks after her three children (ages 6, 4, and 1). The two older children are in school.

Teresa has been selling vegetables for 10 years. Her business is in the Santa Tecla Market, located in the Department of La Libertad. Each morning she has to travel a great distance in order to get to work. Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can have the financial capability to restock her business. She will buy a large quantity of vegetables, especially the ones that she sells the most. Teresa hopes to improve her sales and obtain more earnings that will be of great benefit to her household. She is a cheerful woman who has many good references from her neighbors. They consider her to be a hardworking woman who has great desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Bèbikoun Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Bèbikoun sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants.  Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché de Bagadadji. 
Elles font le commerce de riz, de haricot, de pagnes wax, de bois de chauffe etc. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les marchandises à vendre, elles ont adhéré au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aminata D. qui est la présidente du groupe compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter du haricot. Elle a une grande réputation à Bagadadji pour sa vente de haricot de bonne qualité d’où son pseudonyme sho-Ami (haricot Ami). 
Elle se ravitaille dans les villages environnants de Ségou (Zogofina, Sirakoro et Togo), et effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché de Bagadadji, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame  Aminata D. espère avoir un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 38 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner et prendre en charge les petits besoins de la famille en condiments et savon. 
Elle a pour ambition de devenir grossiste dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso / Kiva.
texts.en:
The members of the Bèbikon group are all married and living in monogamous families. They are on the average 31 years old and have two children. They all live in the Bagadadji district of Ségou (the fourt administrative district of Mali). They know each other as neighbors, relatives, or as vendors working at the Bagadadji market. They sell rice, beans, wax “pagnes” [traditional fabric for wrap clothing], heating wood etc. With the goal of increasing their business capital and diversify their merchandise, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso credit program; they are now on their third group loan. Mrs. Aminata D., who is the leader of the group, plans to use her loan to purchase beans. She is well-known in Bagadadji as she sells high-quality beans, and is nicknamed “sho-Ami” [“Ami the bean lady”]. She purchases her stock in the villages close to Ségou (in Zogofina, Sirakoro and Togo) and sells for cash and in credit, from home and at the Bagadadji market, to a customer base composed of both women and men. Mrs. Aminata D. hopes to achieve a monthly income of 38,000 West African Francs, which will be used for savings and for taking care of various needs of her family, such as buying condiments and soap. Her goal is to become a wholesaler thanks to this partnership with Soro Yriwaso/Kiva.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beans [for resale]

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Loise Nyaguthii

texts.en:
Loise has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town for the last 11 years. She sells basic household items like plastic basins and dry foodstuffs such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt. She is a widow aged 43 years old and has four school-going children. 

Loise was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan proceeds to increase her shop's stock of maize and wheat flour, rice and sugar.

Apart from retail, Loise is also hoping to move into wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock of dry foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is from the village of Gaston, Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old. Erlinda is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Husna's Group

texts.en:
Husna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s bed sheet selling business. 

Husna is 40 years-old and a married woman from the city of Borewala in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms which she keeps clean all the time. Husna is a very caring and talented lady. She not only manages her family needs but also operates a clothes embroidery business. She does this work to earn extra income. 

Her husband, S., is involved in a bed sheet selling business. He buys bed-sheets from the city of Multan because it is the specialty of Multan for people to make handmade bed-sheets. He has been in this business for over ten years. 

Husna hopes that buying the bed-sheets in bulk will cut down the cost of his travelling and enable him to have a good bulk stock to help him fulfill the orders of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her salon

loans.name: Theoun's Group

texts.en:
Four people are making up a group loan. Mrs. Theoun C. is a 23 years old married woman and is the group leader of the loan, having been selected by its four members. They are located in Pou Ta Pang village, Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.   

Mrs. Theoun C. and her husband, Mrs. Soveit Chamroeun, are farming laborers in the local village who are able to receive a small salary to support their family. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. Now their house is in disrepair, so, Mrs. Theoun C. has decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy timber to fix up her house.

loans.use: To buy timbers to fix up her house.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Esmeralda es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, hace varios años se divorcio y ella sola mantiene  su hijo y a su mama, la señora Esmeralda quiere lo mejor para su familia y quiere darles una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que requiere de este crédito ya que quiere terminar un cuarto que ya tiene empezado. Poco a poco le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su vivienda, pero quiere terminar el cuarto ya que lo habitara su hijo adolescente.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a mother and a very hard working person. Many years ago she divorced and she supports her son and her mother. Esmeralda wants the best for her family and she want to provide them with a better quality of life. She requires a loan to finish building a partially completed room in their house. Slowly she has been improving their home but she wants to have this room completed for her adolescent son.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building a room in her house.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia J.  is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste  and is requesting a loan to stock more goods like 'simsim' and maize to sell.  Lucia is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more goods like 'simsim' (sesame seeds) and maize to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Felix vive en casa de sus suegros en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene un hijo; es propietario de un vehiculo con el cual trabaja en transporte libre con cuyos  ingresos mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar motor, llantas y reparar algunas fallas de su movilidad y esta manera ponerla en buenas condiciones para no perder estos ingresos ya que es su única fuente de ingresos

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro pero por el carácter social puede acceder al mismo.
texts.en:
Félix lives in his in-laws’ house in La Paz’s Alto San Pedro area.  He is married and has a son.  He owns a vehicle with which he provides taxi services.  Income from this activity supports his family.

The loan is needed to buy a motor and tires and to repair some mechanical problems the car is having so that it can be in good condition and not lose income because this is his only source of income.

This is his first loan request from Impro and due to the social nature he qualifies for same.

loans.use: To buy a motor and tires and for repair of his passenger transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
The produce sale business is very active with many small entities here in Uganda. This is where one S. Jackson has banked his savings to earn more profit. The married father of 4 children started up a grocery and produce store dealing in fresh foods like, sweet potatoes, beans,maize and other agro produce 15 years ago in Myeri, Kyenjojo. Due to his hard work and determination, he has been able to run this business and it earns him 720,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. 

With this loan he is looking forward to restocking the business with more maize and beans which will make him in the market. He envisions expanding his business into whole sale and this will attract many more customers to his shop. Earning more revenue and making the business expand is his main motive. He looks forward to educating his children.

loans.use: purchase more stock for resale

loans.name: Lawny

texts.en:
Lawny V. is from the village of Naga.Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old. Lawny is single. To make a living, Lawny owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Lawny is just starting this business.

In 2010, Lawny joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lawny is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used additional capital for his business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lawny from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for his business

loans.name: Kikas Group

texts.es:
El grupo que a continuación presento se llama "Kikas", es un grupo pequeño pero muy unido y los integrantes se conocen desde hace varios años, decidieron ponerle al grupo Kikas por que  es como en el pueblo conocen a las hijas de la señora Jazmín, que es la representante del grupo, Kikas está integrado por seis personas que son las siguientes:

1.- Jazmín A. G. de 29 años 
2.- Gelacio G. S. de 35 años
3.-Ambrocio G. S. de 38 años
4.-Ana Luisa M. N.  de 35 años
5.-Marcelina T. C.    de 29 años
6.-Cecilia García T.        de 21 años

Las 6 personas mencionadas son vecinos y amigos de la comunidad, integraron este grupo por que cada persona da buenas referencias del otro integrante, la comunidad en la que viven es una comunidad muy humilde donde por lo regular la actividad economica de la gente la tiene en el campo y criando animales como: vacas, pollos y borregos, es la unica actividad que la gente conoce y con la que se relaciona, las señoras son en general amas de casa y no es la exepción con las mujeres de este grupo, pero son mujers que quieren salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo con el gasto y los hijos, como es el caso de Doña Jazmín.

Doña Jazmín, aparece en la foto a mano derecha vestiendo una sudadera roja con un numero 53 en el pecho, es una señora muy trabajadora, está casada tiene 10 años viviendo con su esposo y es madre de 4 hijos:

La mayor es mujer y tiene 11 años estudia la primaria, y nos cuenta que es muy inteligente y es una niña aplicada, despues viene otra niña que tiene 9 años de edad, tambien estudia la primaria y va en la misma esceula que su hermana mayor, de ella nos platica que se le dificulta las matematicas, de la niña sigue un hijo que es varon y tiene solo 2 años de edad y una ultima que es niña con un año.

Doña Jazmín tiene casa propia lo que la tranquiliza mucho por que no paga renta y como sea sería un gasto más en su familia, su esposo trabaja como ayudante de mecanico nos cuenta que no gana mucho y quisiera salirse de trabajar para ganar un poco más de dinero, no se ha salido de trabajar por que sería dificil que el señor encuentre un trabajo ya que no tiene la secundaria terminada y en estos tiempos como minimo piden la preparatoria, es una situación dificil como vive la familia de doña Jazmín pero ella quiere echarle muchas ganas, no darse por vencida por que están sus hijas y por ellas quiere hacer la lucha.

Por este  motivo tan grande ella inicio un negocio que es pequeño pero de igual manera hay ganancias, Doña Jazmín vende Jarceria, que es el negocio de plastico, todo lo que este echo con plastico es la jarceria, por ejemplo, botes para la basura, tinacos, vandejas, cucharas, sillas, mesas etc. Lo que doña Jazmin hace es comprar estos productos por docenas y llegar a su comunidad a venderlos casa por casa, está realizando una actividad dificil por que caminar cargando varios productos y encima un bebe de un año no cualquier mujer se animaria hacerlo.

Pero es el pan de cada dia de doña Jazmín, no se desanima si no alcontrario quiere salir adelante lo hace pensando en sus hijos y en un mejor futuro para ellos. Doña Jazmín junto su grupo, son integrantes de confianza , vecinos y gente trabajadora que al igual que doña Jazmín buscan salir adelante y apoyar en su casa, para eso solicitaron su credito, doña Jazmín lo piensa invertir y comprar mercancia en docena, por que sale más barato comprar por docena ó por juegos, al momento que compra por docena lleva ya una ganancia de por medio. 

Los demas integrantes de Kikas, se dedican a lo siguiente: Don Gelacio y don Ambrocio tienen la actividad de ganaderia ellos dos solicitaron el prestamo para comprar un par de vacas y puedan dar crias en un futuro, la Sr. Ana Luisa vende prodcutos por catalogo en este caso es la ropa, pero no tenia para estar invirtiendo y se animo a pedir el apoyo, La Sr. Marcelina y Cecilia se dedican al comercio tienen en un mercado un local de comida corrida que habren diario. 

Este es el grupo de doña Jazmín son seis integrantes con actividades economicas un poco diferentes y con ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group presented in the following description is called “Kikas”.  It is a small group, but a very united one, and the members have known each other for several years.  They decided to call themselves Kikas because, in their town, it is how Jazmín’s daughters are known.  She is the group’s representative, and there are six members in the group:  

1.- Jazmín A. G., 29 years old 
2.- Gelacio G. S., 35 years old
 3.-Ambrocio G. S., 38 years old
 4.-Ana Luisa M. N., 35 years old 
5.-Marcelina T. C., 29 years old 
6.-Cecilia García T., 21 years old

The 6 people mentioned are neighbors and friends in the community.  They formed the group because each person had good references from another member.  The community where they live is very humble and a place where, in general, people earn a living farming or raising animals such as:  cows, chickens and sheep.  These are the activities the people know and can relate to.  Most women are homemakers, and the women in this group are no exception.  However, they are women that want to get ahead and support their husbands with the household and children expenses.  This is also the case with Jazmín.

Jazmín appears on the right side of the photograph, wearing a red sweatshirt with the number 53.  She is a very hard-working woman, married for 10 years, who lives with her husband and 4 children:

The oldest is an 11-year old daughter who is in primary school.  She tells us she is very smart, and a young girl who applies herself.  After her, is a 9-year old daughter who is also in primary school and attends the same school as her older sister.  She tells us she has difficulty with math.  After this daughter comes a son who is only 2, and another daughter, who is 1.

Jazmín owns her house, a fact that gives her some peace because she doesn’t have to pay rent, which would be one more household expense.  Her husband works as a mechanic’s assistant, but she tells us he doesn’t earn much.  He hasn’t left this work because it would be difficult for him to find a job earning more money since he didn’t finish secondary school.  These days, employers are requiring at least having completed preparatory school.  Jazmín’s family lives in a difficult situation, but she wants to put forth great effort and not see herself defeated.  She wants to forge ahead for her daughters.  For this reason, she started with a small business, which, all the same, generates income.  Jazmín sells “jarceria”, which is the business of selling plastic goods.  Jarceria is everything that has to do with plastics.  For example, trash bins, water tanks, buckets, spoons, chairs, tables, etc.  What Jazmín does is buy these products by the dozen, and returns to her community to sell them door-to-door.  This is a tough job, because she has to carry her products, along with her 1-year old baby, and no ordinary woman would be motivated to do this.

However, this is Jazmín’s daily bread, and she doesn’t get discouraged; rather, to the contrary, she wants to get ahead and thinks only of her children and of providing them with a brighter future.  

Jazmín, along with her group, are trustworthy members, neighbors, and hard-working people who, like Jazmín, seek to get ahead and support their households.  This is why they’ve requested a loan.  Jazmín is thinking about investing her loan into buying merchandise by the dozen, because it is cheaper to buy by the dozen or in sets.  From the moment she buys in bulk, she is making a profit via this means.

The other members of Kikas devote themselves to the following:  Mr. Gelacio and Mr. Ambrocio raise livestock, and these two have requested the loan to buy cows who might yield calves in the future.  Ms. Ana Luisa sells catalog items, in this case clothing, but she didn’t have the funds to continue investing in her business, which motivated her to seek support.  Ms. Marcelina and Ms. Cecilia dedicate themselves to commerce at a food stand they open on a daily basis at a local market.

This is Jazmín’s group.  They are six members with slightly different activities, but who all yearn to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy plastic goods by the dozen, such as:  bins, tanks, buckets, chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Byambasuren D. is a 32-year-old single parent who lives with her two children in a rented apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both her children attend secondary school. Byambasuren operates a stationary selling business and photo-taking service at a local market in the city. She has been engaged this business since 2007 and has since built a stable operation. Today, her working capital exceeds between 500,000 and 800,000 MNT, and her daily business income has reached 30,000 to 50,000 MNT, with a net profit of 30 to 40 percent. After years of successful operation, Byambasuren has gained a lot of experience and her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family. For the future, she hopes to continue managing her business with sustainable operations. She says, "my goals are to provide higher education for both my children and purchase a fence and house for my family." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to expand her stationary trading business.

loans.use: To expand her stationary trading business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que se pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo y que se encuentra situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El suele criar sus animales en algunos corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside y al público en general. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia por lo que trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Alexander desea adquirir animales menores y alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 25-year-old single man who lives with his family in the Muy Finca sector of the Mochumi district, an agricultural zone in the Chiclayo province, located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

He works in agriculture, especially in raising and selling small animals. He usually raises his animals in pens located in his back yard. When they have reached the optimum stage of development, he sells them to both the general public and to resellers in his zone of residence. This business is an important source of income for supporting his household, which is why he always tries to maintain it as best as he can.

Alexander would like to expand his business by obtaining more small animals and feed in order to earn greater profits for his sales. In order to reach his goal, he sees fit to request a 1,500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase small animals and feed

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos dependientes. Reside junto a su esposo en el caserío Huaca Rivera, una de las localidades que conforman el distrito de Pacora, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Ella cría los animales en unos corrales instalados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un correcto desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad le permita ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado con la finalidad de ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Para realizar esta acción y lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is 58 years old, married and doesn't have any dependent children.  She lives with her husband in the Huaca Rivera settlement, one of the localities that makes up the district of Pacora.  This is an agricultural zone that is located in the Lambayeque province more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.  

She has been raising and selling small animals for ten years.  She raises the animals in a pen that is set up in the rear of her house.  She feeds them natural grains and grasses and  when they are fully developed, she sells them to the businessmen that usually visit the area where she lives.  This activity allows her to help her husband with the family's expenses.  

María wants to purchase more animals and balanced feed so that she can expand her business, increase her income and thereby, improve her family's quality of life.  To do this she is requesting a loan of 1500 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase more small animals and feed

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea V., 47, is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. V. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 65 on other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the farming business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland to improve farming business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La Sra. Trinidad pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de  San Martin. Es Viuda, tiene 64 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes. 

Trinidad es una mujer firme y luchadora que desde muy joven le gusta el negocio y le gusta trabajar. Se dedica a la venta de Mazamorras, arroz con leche y flan (dulces, postres). Lleva varios años dedicándose a la venta de dulces  y nos cuenta que le esta  yendo muy bien, ya que le genera buenos ingresos diarios. Sus ventas las realiza por las tardes  en las afueras de su casa a partir de las 3.00 pm., en una zona donde hay mucho movimiento y como ya es muy conocida, cuenta con clientes fijos. También produce sus dulces a pedidos de diferentes empresas, para diferentes ocasiones o eventos que realicen. Esto es otro ingreso que tiene y esta muy contenta por lo logrado.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,100.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes para preparar sus dulces  como: Maíz morado, arroz y azúcar en kilos, manzanas y piñas, canela molida y otros ingredientes.  En cuestión de utensilios comprará vasos y cucharitas de plástico.
 
Trinidad se siente aun con muchas fuerzas de seguir trabajando. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños anhelados, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que quieren crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Trinidad belongs to the "María Auxiliadora" community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province.  She is 64 years old, widowed, and has 4 children who all now live independently. 

Trinidad is a solid and hard-working woman who has liked being in business and working since she was very young.  Her business is selling 'mazamorras' (a corn-based milky pudding) and 'flan' (caramel custard).  She has been selling sweet treats for several years and she tells us that her business is going very well since it makes her good daily profits.  She makes her sales in the afternoons, outside her house, from 3.00pm onwards.  She lives in a very busy area and, as she is very well known, she has regular customers.  She also produces her desserts to order for different companies, for different occasions or events that they are hosting.  This is another source of income that she has and she is very happy to have achieved it.

Trinidad will use this loan for 1,100 Peruvian soles to buy ingredients for preparing her sweet treats such as 'maíz morado' (purple corn), rice and sugar by the kilo, apples and pineapples, ground cinnamon and other ingredients.  She will also buy some utensils: plastic cups and spoons.

Trinidad still feels that she has a lot of strength to continue working.  She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping to fulfil not only her dreams but also those of other women who want to grow and get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy purple corn, rice and sugar by the kilo, apples and pineapples, ground cinnamon and other ingredients

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoem was born in 1962 and she is a pig breeder who can earn some profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. K., is a farming laborer and a farmer who owns a 3.5-hectare plot of land where he grows rice. He sells part of the rice yield and the other part he keeps to support his family. This couple supports three children, two of whom are boat-taxi drivers, while the other is attending local public school.

In the rice field, there is a problem because the field is far away from the irrigation system. So to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Chhoem is applying for a loan to buy gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide. 

Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Lolie

texts.en:
Lolie is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a rice mill, buying and selling copra (dried coconut milk) and farming. She lives in Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 25,000. 

Lolie is borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can pay for the laborers' salaries and other expenses in the rice mill.  This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lolie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries and other expenses in the rice mill

loans.name: Otila

texts.en:
Otila owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has 4 years of experience in this business. Otila  needs a loan of WST $2450 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 tala or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Otila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Otila's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome for her farm

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi W. is 52  years old and has five children.  She has been farming for 22 years in her home area of Muranga in Central Kenya producing bananas and French beans.  She employs three farmhands.  She also runs a retail shop for additional income. 

Naomi is requesting for a loan for 50,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help her in purchasing farm inputs, specifically a water pump and banana inputs in order to expand  her banana plantation. She says that the inputs will increase her French beans production since she will be able to manage the water shortage. Naomi concurs with other farmers that drought and general water shortage remain their greatest farming challenge. She adds that Juhudi loan will help alleviate poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and other irrigation equipment

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a single woman with four children. Three of the children attend school and one is already married. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, clothing and rent.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling spices. She sells onions, cucumber and chili sauce at the market to market dwellers. Riziki faces a major challenge of competition and the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of cucumbers, onions and chili sauce. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cucumber, onions and chili sauce.

loans.name: Janilyn

texts.en:
Janilyn is 52 years old and married with 2 children.

Janilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari  (variety) store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries. 

Janilyn has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 18 years and also earns an income from coconut farming and raising cattle.

Janilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 37-year-old father of four daughters and two sons. Muhammad has been living with his parents as he couldn't afford to furnish a house as he is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

Muhammad has saved money for a long time so that he could furnish the house and he took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the last three items to move in finally.

Muhammad is photographed in FATEN's office.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: to purchase a fridge, washing machine and TV.

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is a Palestinian National Authority employee and the father of one daughter, Nada, and three sons: Atef, Khaled and Fayez. Jaber has a small farm and raises goats. He started the farm three years ago to support his family as his [job] won't be enough when the children are older.

Jaber (who appears in the picture) took out a loan from FATEN to purchase new species of goats to produce stronger goats with better milk production, which will insure a better price when sold.

loans.use: to purchase different species of goats.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Revendeur de pièces détachées, Kodjo a 30ans et a démarré en 2003. Il s’approvisionne à ACCRA. Il veut assurer sa future vie maritale et sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Kodjo is 30 years old and started his business of selling spare parts in 2003. He purchases his merchandise in Accra. He wants ensure that he can afford to get married in future and is requesting the loan to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Teresita has a pig-raising business and she sells mature pigs. She has had this business for four years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela  tiene 41 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa, junto a su esposo Jorge de 41 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Marion de 14 y Jorge de 07 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Graciela trabaja arduamente para educar a sus queridos hijos quienes vienen cursando el nivel primario y secundario en distintas Instituciones Educativas. Graciela tiene su puesto de ventas en la ciudad de San Francisco donde ofrece variedad de víveres como arroz, azúcar y variedad de bebidas, ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable y está muy bien ubicada, justo en la calle principal de su ciudad. Desde muy tempranas horas abre las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primeros compradores quienes sabiendo de la variedad de sus mercadería no dudan en llevar lo necesario para la vianda familiar. Lleva 06 años en este negocio y menciona que le va muy bien ya que gracias a ello pudo adquirir muchos bienes para su hogar. Con el crédito solicitado comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas. Con el tiempo, espera mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para así poder prestar mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este será su sexto crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de ustedes para seguir prosperando y por ello se compromete ser puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de los integrantes. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Graciela, 41, is a kind, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Jorge, 41, and their two beloved children, Marion, 14, and Jorge, 7, who are the main motivators of all her efforts.  Graciela works hard to educate her beloved children who are in elementary and secondary school in different educational institutions. 

Graciela has a sales stand in the city of San Francisco where she stocks a variety of foodstuffs like rice, sugar and a selection of beverages.  She is happy with her business because it’s quite profitable and well located precisely on the city’s main street.  She opens her doors for business very early awaiting her first customers who, knowing about the variety of merchandise, don’t hesitate to take what they need for their family meals.  She’s been in business six years and she mentions that she does very well because thanks to it she’s been able to purchase many good for her home.

She will use the requested loan to buy stock items in bulk for her sales stand.  In time, she hopes to improve the store and make it grow to provide better service to her customers.  

This will be her 6th loan and she’s very happy to know that once again she’ll have support from you to continue making progress and she, therefore, commits to be very punctual with her payments.  She is very well liked by the other members of the communal bank.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more stock items for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Santa Rosa  La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Santa  Rosa  La   Nueva   Esperanza , sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así  por así se llama  su  pueblo , y encontraron en fundación  realidad  la esperanza  para cambiar su vida.
El grupo esta conformado por once integrantes,  y tienen que reunirse cada semana para realizar sus  pagos.
La representante de este grupo es la señora  Flor  Guadalupe  tiene  treinta y ocho años de edad, tiene 2 hijas Clara Luisa de catorce años de edad estudia la secundaria y Fátima de  diez años quien estudia la primaria .
La  señora  Flor Guadalupe   se dedica a la  venta de antojitos mexicanos  y  pollos, necesita el préstamo para comprar mas pollos ya que rápido se le termina, sus  clientes le compran por mayoreo por, esa razón  termina rápido.
Sus clientes le recomiendan que compre mas pollos por que en ocasiones  rápido se le termina.
Uno de sus sueños es tener una pillería mas grande ya  que a sus clientes les gusta como les despacha, están  muy contentos con el servicio que les brinda.
Los  integrantes se llaman:
Francisca - necesita el préstamo  para la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Fidelina- necesita el préstamo para la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Angélica-  necesita el préstamo para la venta de refresco.
Yesenia-necesita el préstamo para la venta de carnes frías.
Alejandra-necesita el préstamo para la  venta de comida.
María  Luisa – necesita el préstamo para la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Soledad-necesita el préstamo para la venta de quesos.
Isabel –necesita el préstamo  para la  venta de pollos.
Alba- necesita el préstamo para la venta de pollos.
Adriana- necesita el préstamo par la venta de antojitos mexicanos.

Le dan las gracias a fundación realidad  por dale la esperanza  para empezar sus propios negocios y tener  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called Santa Rosa La Nueva Esperanza (Santa Rosa the New Hope).  Its members decided to call it this because that is the name of their town, and in Fundación Realidad they found the hope of changing their lives. There are 11 members in the group, and they meet each week to make their payments. 

The representative of this group is Flor Guadalupe.  She is 38 years old, and has two daughters: Clara Luisa, 14, goes to high school, and Fatima, 10, goes to primary school.  Flor Guadalupe sells chickens and Mexican dishes. She needs the loan to buy more chickens, since she runs out quickly. Her customers buy from her wholesale, and that's why she runs out quickly. Her customers recommend that she buy more chickens because sometimes she runs out quickly. One of her dreams is to have a larger store, since her customers like how she serves them. They are very happy with the service she offers.  The members are:

Francisca - She needs the loan to sell Mexican dishes
Fidelina - She needs the loan to sell Mexican dishes
Angélica - She needs the loan to sell soft drinks
Yesenia - She needs the loan to sell cold cuts
Alejandra - She needs the loan to sell food
María Luisa She needs the loan to buy Mexican dishes
Soledad - She needs the loan to sell cheeses
Isabel - She needs the loan to sell chickens
Alba - She needs the loan to sell chickens
Adriana- She needs the loan to sell Mexican dishes

They are thankful to Fundación Realidad for giving them the hope of starting their own businesses, and of having a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy and sell chickens at wholesale and retail

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Juan es casado, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad; el Sr. Juan se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi por toda la ciudad de Ica; él lo hace en un auto alquilado, se dedica a brindar este servicio por más de 15 años; gana aproximadamente S/. 350 nuevos soles semanales; el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de su propio auto, ya que cuenta con unos ahorros y lo quiere completar con el crédito. Su principal desafío es estar expuesto a las peligrosidades de las calles; su sueño es tener 2 autos propios mas para hacer crecer su negocio. El Sr. Juan está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Juan is married and he has four grown children. Juan offers a taxi service throughout the entire city of Ica and he does this in a rented car. He has made his living offering this service for more than fifteen years and he earns approximately 350 PEN per week. 

He will invest the loan granted by purchasing his own car, since he already has some savings and he wants to use the loan to complete the purchase. His main challenge is exposure to the dangers on the streets. His dream is to have two cars of his own so he can grow his business. Juan is very thankful for the loan granted to him.

loans.use: to buy his own car.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladis vive en un lugar  muy bonito, en donde  las personas cosechan moras, ella es casada con el señor Román y con quien procreo cuatro hijos que  aun están a su responsabilidad.

     Ella solicito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de refracción para su taxi, así tenerlo en buen estado para que los pasajero se sientan seguros, en esta actividad lleva cuatro años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingresos para su familia.

   Quien la animo a esta actividad fue su esposo quien es el que se encargar de conducir el taxi, así  tener una mejor ganancias para salir adelante.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda mejorar su ingreso para apoyar a sus hijos en su crecimiento, así también comprar material para construir una galerita para estacionar su taxi.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys lives in a very pretty place, where people harvest berries. She is married to Sr. Román with whom she has four children, who are all still dependents.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of spare parts for her taxi, thereby keeping it in good condition so that the passengers feel safe. She has been doing this job for four years and notes that it is going well and that it has generated a good income for her family.

The person who encouraged her in this work was her husband who drives the taxi, thereby earning a better income in order to get ahead. 

What she wants most is for this work to increase their income so they can support their children as they grow and also  buy material to build a place to park their taxi.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inició gracias a iniciativa D. la señora Ramona, ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas D. Ciudad del Este y D. allí surge el comité denominado Kuña Marangatu, se encuentran actualmente en el quinto ciclo, con 13 integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, ellas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor y luchador y desean poder crecer más cada día.
Una D. las integrantes del comité es la señora Evangelista, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropas D. todo tipo, con lo cual pueD. mantener a su familia. Dice tener muchos clientes, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos, lo que le sirve para poder los gastos diarios D. la casa. Tiene muchos pedidos con los que tiene que cumplir, además D. eso le gustaría poder renovar la variedad D. prendas que tiene.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas D. todo tipo para el abastecimiento D. su negocio, además D. eso quiere cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ramona got together this current committee.  She contacted her neighbors and friends in Ciudad del Este and created the committee called 'Kuña Marangatu'.  The group are currently in their fifth loan cycle and have 13 members.  This is a group which stands out in their neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible.  They have a great entrepreneurial and tenacious spirit and would like to be able to continue growing every day.

One of the members of this committee is Evangelista who sells all kinds of clothes.  This enables her to support her family.  She tells us that she has many customers and so makes very good income.  She uses this income to cover her daily household expenses.  She has a lot of orders to fill and would also like to be able to update the range of clothes that she has.

Evangelista is requesting this loan to buy all kinds of clothes with which to stock her business.  In addition, she would like to fill the orders that her customers make with her.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of clothes to sell

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.ru:
Екатерина с мужем и двумя вхрослыми дочерьми живет в Мелитополе. Она занимается продажей женской одежды на местном привокзальном рынке. Свое дело Екатерина начала еще 12 лет назад. На данный момент у нее в товар вложено 40 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет 5 000 гривен. 

Екатерина планирует приобрести сезонный товар: женскую одежду на осень-зиму и реализовать его по приемлемым ценам. Предприимчивость и умение правильно вести бизнес помогут Екатерине осуществить свои цели и продолжить расширять свой бизнес, открывая новые точки реализации в будущем. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Yekaterina and her husband with two grown daughters live in Melitopol. She sells women's clothing on the local market near the train station. Yekaterina started her business twelve years ago. At this time she has 40,000 hrivna invested in her merchandise. Her clean profit is 5,000 hrivna.

Yekaterina plans to buy seasonal merchandise: women's clothing for the autumn and winter season and to sell it at reasonable prices. Her entrepreneurship and ability to run her business correctly allow Yekaterina to realize her goals and continue to expand her business by opening new locations to sell in the future.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise: women's clothing for the autumn and winter season and sell it at reasonable prices

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 43-year-old woman, who is married and has a project raising chicks for sale. Amal has a good experience in this field beside getting help from her husband which makes her project successful. 

Amal wants to expand her project and purchase more chicks and more feed for them, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Amal gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to expand her project and purchase more chicks and feed. That will improve her project and she will be able to compete with others in the same field and increase her sales and so increase her income. 

Amal is a conservative woman, so her husband Nayef is photographed instead of her in the poultry project.

 About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old and a married woman with seven children. Four of them are in school. She has a business selling g-nut paste in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Christine has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sacks of g-nuts to make into paste to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more g-nuts for sale.

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.es:
María de 49 años de edad, es soltera, reside en su casa propia junto a unos  familiares, ubicada  en la zona rural del distrito de Las Lomas que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Es una zona agrícola y ganadera.

Ella cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar mango y arroz, ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar sus gastos diarios personales. También cría y comercializa ganado ovino.

María desea comprar fertilizantes para así brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar nuevas plantaciones. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old, single, and lives in her own home with some relatives. She resides in the rural section of the District of Las Lomas, which is part of the Department of Piura. This is an area known for farming and livestock breeding.

María has a piece of farmland on which she grows mangos and rice. She has several years of experience in this line of work. Throughout this entire time, she has gained plenty of knowledge of how to manage these crops. The income she generates from this business will be used to cover her daily personal expenses. She also raises and sells sheep.

María wants to buy fertilizers so that she can maintain her land for planting new crops. This will enable her to have a good harvest. In order to accomplish this goal, she needs to request a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maintaining her farmland.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth has operated her retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She is 41 years old, married to James and they have five school-going children.  Apart from operating the retail shop as her primary activity, she also sells clothes to sustain her income.

Beth was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock like sweets, cooking fat, rice,and washing detergent to sell in her retail shop.

In the future, Beth hopes to grow her retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: buy more variety of stocks like sweets, cooking fat, rice,and washing detergent

loans.name: Hatidzokere Shure Group

texts.en:
Chiedza is a 33-year-old lady who is a single mother of two children, aged 13 and 9 years. Both children are going to school. She does not have any other dependents. 

She has been in the poultry business for two years and does not have any employees. She buys her chicks in town. The challenge she faces in the business is that, due to the high temperatures, some of the chicks may die prematurely, resulting in a loss. 

Chiedza is also employed as a general hand at ZIMRA (Zimbabwe Revenue Authority). She operates from the last floor in the ZIMRA Building. 

As a single mother, she would be able to provide a better life for her children with the profits from her business. In the next five years she would like to own a poultry shop in town.

loans.use: to purchase feed, chicks, and medicines.

loans.name: Bidii Shg Group

texts.en:
Joseph is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG group. Joseph and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

Joseph takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and to produce quality maize next season. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest six bags of maize on that land. 

With the income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children and save for future use. 

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

The photograph shows Joseph with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Julia Evagelina

texts.es:
La señora Julia Evagelina es casada, tiene 47 años de edad, cursó la educación primaria, se dedica al cuidado de niños en una casa hogar para niños, y también al bordado de blusas de cruceta, lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos para producir mas productos bordados, espera ver en el futuro un negocio grande y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia Evangelina is 47 years old, married, and completed her primary school education. She takes care of children at an orphanage and also produces blouses through cross-stitch embroidery. Julia has 10 years of experience.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread so that she can produce more embroideries. In the future, she hopes to have a larger business and more income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 46 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is a widow with two children aged 7 and 9 who are in school and live at home. Hawa has been selling rice, red oil, bitter ball (an  eggplant-like vegetable), etc., for the past 12 years. She started this business with money given to her by her sisters and she learned this business from her mother. 

Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, and bitter ball and many other items for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, bitter ball, etc., for her business

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a married man living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been running a transportation business for the last 25 years, after getting capital from being an employed driver. His major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and high taxes. However, he has a goal of diversifying his business to include farming. The purpose of this loan is to buy a car for his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy a car for his transportation business

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis, es un joven de 38 años de edad, de oficio  maestro en una escuela pública, y en tiempos libres labora en un pequeño comedor familiar, de sus ingresos apoya a sus hermanos menores quienes son huérfanos. Jorge Luis estudia la carrera de licenciatura en pedagogía, solicita este crédito para pagar  el curso de titulación, siendo su principal meta para llegar a crecer profesionalmente y poder mejorar su economía.

loans.use: Para pagar curso de titulacion.

loans.name: Dutsimbatare Group

texts.fr:
Savera fait partie du groupe  Dutsimbatare et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 21 ans et est mariée à Etienne ,un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 11mois à 9 ans. 

Elle fait le commerce de  riz, du haricot et de l'huile de palme depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son dix-huitième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz et de  haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Savera is a member of the Dutsimbatare and lives in Gitega. She is 21 years old and is married to Etienne, a businessman. Together, they have five children between the ages of 11 months and 9 years old.

She's been selling rice, beans, and palm oil for 10 years.

She is on her eighteenth loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan she receives, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land and see her children in school.

loans.use: to increase her profit and to buy a large quanitity of rice and beans for resale.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita is a sari-sari (variety) store owner in the town of San Dionesio, Iloilo. She is a married woman with eight children; five adults and three dependents ages 19, 11 and 10 years old. Julita has been doing this sari-sari store business for 10 years. She and her husband work hard together to earn a living and to provide the needs of their children. Thus, she is asking for a bigger amount of loans to improve her store. From this loan she will buy assorted goods such as drinks, food seasoning, noodles, canned goods, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, sugar, coffee and cereals. In the future, Julita wishes to be a successful woman. She wants to improve their livelihoods to have enough money to send all her children to college and finish their degree.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food seasoning, noodles, canned goods, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, sugar, coffee and cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tools and accessories

loans.name: Khalig

texts.en:
Khalig is a 47 year old man who lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He is married and has two children.
Seven years ago he decided to start his business.
Having borrowed $300, he bought two sheep.
He later borrowed $700, with which he bought ten pregnant sheep.
Now he requests a loan of $1000 to buy five pregnant sheep and two calves.

loans.use: to buy five pregnant sheep and two calves

loans.name: Thua

texts.en: Mrs Thua is 52 and her husband is 65 years old. They don’t have any children. Mr Loc, her husband, just broke a rib in an accident. Mrs Thua had to borrow money from a moneylender to pay for his medical treatment. So her selling lottery tickets is important to increase their income by about $5 person/month. Their average income is $ 31person/month. Mrs Thua has already repaid the three loans on time. Now, she wants to borrow $50 for her ticket selling business.

loans.use: Selling lottery tickets

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena N. is 32 years old, married, and has one child. She owns a business center where she types and photocopies documents for clients. She would like a loan to purchase a computer and scanner, as well as a Photostatting machine and printer.

loans.use: To buy computer, scanner & printer.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en: I am 55 years old and live in a small town in Pakistan. I have two daughters. One is married and the other is in 10th grade. I have been making crocheted items since I got married. I make table mats and cushion covers to order, which take from one day to a few days to make depending on the amount of effort involved. I make a reasonable profit from each piece but I could expand my business by purchasing more raw materials such as thread, needles and hiring women to work for me. This expansion would require an initial investment of $250 and need a loan to make it happen.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and hire staff

loans.name: Johana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Johana began her business of used clothing, shoes and toy sales when her husband was left unemployed. With a lot of effort she's been able to expand her business, which is located in the Ivan Montenegro market in the city of Managua.

She began with two thousand Cordobas. Now, her store is well supplied and she has a large set of customers.

Before dedicating herself to her present business Johana stayed at home and spent her time taking care of her children. Johana has worked with CEPRODEL for 8 months and feels that it offers her very reasonable conditions.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace aproximadamente Johana comienza su negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y juguetes usados a raiz de que su esposo queda sin trabajo. Con mcha dedicacion ha logrado hacer crecer este negocio que actualmente esta ubicado en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua.

Comienza con un capita de C$2,000 (dos mil cordobas), lo cual era parte de la liquidacion de su esposo. Hoy en dia su tienda esta bien surtida, tiene una clientela amplia.

Antes de dedicarse a su negocio actual Johana era ama de casa y se dedicaba a cuidar a sus dos hijos.

Johana lleva trabajando con CEPRODEL desde hace 8 meses, tiempo en el que dice sentirse a gusto por el desembolso casi inmediato y las condiciones razonables que se le ofrece.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and improving business structure

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru:
S. Safarali is 47 years old, has higher technological education and an electrician by profession. He is married and has 3 children. Safarali's main work place is in the Yavan city power station where he works as an electrician. Besides his job he is also raising cattle at his home. He will use the loan to purchase 3 heads of cattle to raise and sell them. He will use the profit to buy more of young cattle and the remaining money to support his family because his very limited salary is not enough and he does not have any other means of income. Safarali is planning to pay off the loan in 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сафаров Сафарали, возраст – 47 лет, образование высшее техническое, по специальности – электрик, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Основным местом работы Сафарали является Городские электричесикие сети города Явана, где он работает электриком. Помимо этого он также занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота у себя дома. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести 3 голов крупного рогатого скота для их откормки и перепродажи. Вырученные деньги он будет использовать на приобретение молодняка, а оставшуюся прибыль будет направлять на содержание своей семьи, так как небольшой размер заработной платы не хватает на месяц. Других источников дохода он не имеет. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase 3 heads of cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth O. sells foodstuffs. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria.

Ruth needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She started the business in 1993.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Rosa Lily

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Lily belongs to the Women's Communal Bank, located at Jr. Ricardo Palma No. 225, in the Calleria District, Ucayali, Peru.  She is 62 years old and is the mother of four children, all of whom are independent. She is married and her husband is a mason.  With her first loan of 300 soles, she decided to invest in a used clothing and shoe business. 
Currently, she sells clothes, shoes and other clothing accessories.  She wakes up very early in the morning to search for her goods and afterwards travels to different areas where there is big demand. 

With the loan of 1000 Soles, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will invest in the purchas of clothes such as polos shirts, pants, jackes and shoes, etc... 

Rosa Lily doesn't believe says that she has been lucky with her clothing sales, such that the there has been increased demand since she started working with Manuela Ramos.
