loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Adzedzi

texts.en:
Adzedzi M. is 37 years old and the married mother of 5 children, all enrolled in school. Her husband is a farmer, and it is therefore difficult for him to meet the needs of his family, as cultivable land is becoming more and more rare and less fertile. Mrs. M. has been specializing in the sale of insecticides for the last 3 years. Her shop is located in Avetonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She hopes that with her loans she can increase the capacity of her business by buying 20 cartons of insecticide. This will help her to participate in meeting the needs of her family from the profits that she will earn from the sale of her merchandise. Mrs. M. is a good client, as she has already benefited from 1 loan, on which she made payments regularly.

Adzedzi M. est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants tous à l’école. Son mari est un cultivateur et subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille puisque les terres cultivables deviennent de plus en plus rares et moins fertiles. Madame M. était specialisée dans la vente des insecticides depuis 3 années. Elle vend ses produits dans une baraque qu’elle a installé à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite avec les fonds augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant 20 cartons d’insecticides et par là participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises. M. est un bon client puisqu’elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit et les remboursements ont été réguliers.

loans.use: To buy 20 cartons of insecticide

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov C. and her husband got married in 1988. They have three daughters, and all of them are silk weavers. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sreypov has been a silk weaver since 1988. It is a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished product to middle-men in the village who then sell it in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Sreypov's husband is a silk weaver as well. The family has three looms.

Mrs. Sreypov is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
A. Mahmud lives in J.Ismoil, Tajikistan. He is 29 years old and married. Mr. A. Mahmud is a very hard-working man and a good family man. He and his wife work in the collective farm, but because it is the seasonal work, he also raises livestock. Mr. A. Mahmud is very experienced in livestock. It is the family business, so his wife helps him to support and develop their livestock business, and he uses his skills and experience in practice.

Mr. A. Mahmud is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 8 months to buy a milk cow and start a sour-milk product business.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and start a sour-milk product business

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly S., 50, and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Im, 53, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1982 and have six children, three sons and three daughters. Three of her children have full time employment in Phnom Penh. Of her other three children, two are in local school and the youngest one stays at home.

Somaly has been a tailor for over twenty years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sews cloth to serve the villagers at her home, while Mr. Vuthy has been working at one NGO in Phnom Penh for twenty years. Somaly is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to use for work.

loans.use: Somaly would like to purchase a motorcycle for her children to use for work.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem, 39 years old, is a married man with one child. He owns an aluminum workshop in a village close to the Southern city of Nabatieh. Kassem has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 5 years and has always repaid his loans on time. Kassem is a very responsible man whose priority in life is the improvement of his business, which is the only source of income for his family. He needs a loan of US$1,200 to purchase raw material for his workshop.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for an aluminum workshop

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en:
Lydya is married with 1 child, aged 18. She is a milk seller. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

Lydia now hopes for a loan to buy more milk for her business.

loans.use: To buy more milk for her business.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna habita en un barrio de la capital, llamado Laureles Sur, tiene 38 años de edad, con dos hijos de 14 y 20 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante y esta pendiente de su familia. La Sra. Reyna trabaja en servicios domésticos en una casa particular, desde hace un año, ya que se propuso trabajar para ayudar a  su esposo y a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la construcción de una pared de su casa ya que las paredes que tiene son de tabla y quiere comenzar hacer mejoras para estar bien con su familia. A largo plazo es terminar de hacer su casa, y poder ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien.
texts.en:
Reyna lives in the capital city in a neighbourhood called Laureles Sur, she is 38, has two children ages 14 and 20, her husband is a vendor that takes care of the family. A year ago, Reyna started providing domestic services in a private house to help her husband, and to help her children continue studying. The loan request is to build a wall in her house because the current walls are made of thin wood and she wants to make improvements for the well-being of her family. In the long term she wants to finish her house and be able to help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is a wife of M. A. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 17 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a driver by profession and has been for 4 years. He drives a 32-seater bus. Her younger son is a ticket checker. Her daughter is in the 11th standard grade. Yasmeen baji's husband drives a donkey cart. Yasmeen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to repair a vehicle of her elder son.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rashida baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Asia baji wants a loan to buy chickens to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Sattar baji wants a loan to buy flower for her flower bouquet selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera O. is 48 years old and married with 7 children. She is a client of LAPO [Kiva's Field Partner] and a leader of a lending group under LAPO microfinance. Vera sells yams and palm oil. She has been in this business for a long time. Vera has so many customers because yams and palm oil are essential foodstuffs that are used on a daily basis in Nigeria. Vera needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more yams and palm oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 45 años, vive con sus hijos Omar de 15 y Sheyla de 8 años. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas en un triciclo en una de las plazas más conocidas de la ciudad de Puno, desde hace 22 años. Rosa no pudo cursar estudios secundarios, ya que desde muy pequeña tuvo que trabajar para solventar sus gastos, es así que optó por la venta de golosinas, las cuales se venden muy bien por esa zona, ya que queda cerca de colegios, institutos, etc. Lo más difícil para Rosa es tener que permanecer casi todo el día bajo el calor del sol y por las tardes soportar el frió inclemente de la zona, aun así, sabe que gracias a su trabajo ella puede mantener a sus hijos y brindarles comida y educación. Es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and lives with her children Omar, age 15, and Sheyla, age 8. She has sold candy from a tricycle in one of the popular plazas in the city of Puno for 22 years. Rosa did not finish secondary school, as since she was very young she had to work to meet her expenses, so she opted to sell candy which sells very well in this zone as it is close to schools, institutes, etc. The most difficult thing for Rosa is having to work almost every day under the hot sun and in the evenings withstand the inclement cold of the area. However, she knows that thanks to this work she can support her children and provide them food and an education. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Primsa. With the money she will buy a large quantity of candy to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of candy to resell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 38-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Ahmad has been a mobile sweets seller for two years. 

Ahmad has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase raw materials to make his sweets. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.  

Ahmad expects that the loan will help him to expand his business. He sells sweets in his neighborhood village. His clients are his friends and family. When Ahmad first started his business, he didn’t have enough capital. He decided to do this work because of his honesty and friends' support. In the future, he plans to expand his business to other villages.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make his sweets.

loans.name: Yungueñitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Yungueñitas” se encuentran cursando su primer ciclo y esta representada por la señora Mercedes Angélica. Todas las socias residen en el mismo barrio y se dedican a actividades comerciales como la venta D. dulces, ropa, masitas, tienda D. abarrotes, zapatos y celulares, la competencia es muy fuerte en este  rubro ya que venden ropa D. importación china, colombiana y brasilera situación que afecta D. gran manera a la producción nacional. El destino del crédito es para el incremento del capital D. trabajo para incrementar su mercadería y permitir el crecimiento D. sus fuentes D. ingreso.  Las Socias tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con otras instituciones parecidas a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen del manejo y administración D. los recursos otorgados, así como la responsabilidad que se requiere para cumplir con los pagos a tiempo.
texts.en:
The group "Yungueñita" is represented by Ms Mercedes Angélica. All of the members live in the same neighborhood and work as vendors of sweets, clothing, pastries, groceries, shoes and cellular phones. Competition is very strong in this business sector, especially with the sale of clothing imported from China, Columbia and Brazil, which highly affects national production. The loan money is intended for the growth of capital so as to increase merchandise and allow for the growth of income. The members have experience in solidarity work with other similar institutions, like Fundación Agrocapital, who manage and administer donated resources. They believe their experience has given them the responsibility required to meet payment deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng C., 49, is a professional handicraft maker who lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She makes various kinds of baskets and sells them at the market. She earns approximately $3 per day. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are in school. They also have one child who is a barber, and one who is a garment worker.

Her husband stays at home and helps her make baskets. Mrs. Seng C. is asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase more bamboo so she can make more baskets to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao A. est un jeune cordonnier de 29 ans ; célibataire sans enfant .propriétaire d’un atelier de cordonnerie à lome la capitale togolaise. Durant plus de 5 ans il exerce ce métier ; principale source de son revenu .avec ce crédit  de  200 000 f CFA il compte accroître son  chiffre d’affaire pour mieux  satisfaire ses clients
texts.en:
Yao A. is a young shoemaker, 20 years old, unmarried, and without children. He is the owner of a shoe shop in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been in this trade for over five years, and it's his principal source of income. With this loan of 200,000 francs CFA, he intends to increase his turnover in order to satisfy his customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoe-making supplies

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.en:
M. Makhfirat is a hard-working woman. She is married with three children, two of whom are married and have their own family. For the past 10 years, Makhfirat has dedicated herself to selling office supplies. She started her business after her husband's contract with the construction company he was employed with terminated. She then decided to generate her own income to try to fill the gap. She enjoys her business and has developed a stable enterprise. Makhfirat has requested a loan of $ 800 USD to purchase new supply of items to sell. She commits to paying her loan back within 12 months. This loan is important for her family's well-being as it will help Makhfirat’s business grow. She truly appreciates your generosity. 

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies for selling

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la  señora Nicolasa L. le está haciendo falta el vitropiso y los enjarres  en el interior de la casa. En este momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagar le a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora, portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo. 
Planean pagar el crédito con sus ingresos ya que su esposa el señor Evaristo Linares se encargara de los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Nicolasa L. needs floor tiles and plaster for the interior of her house. At the moment they do not have enough money to buy the materials and pay for someone who can make the improvements so she has asked for a loan. They plan to pay back the credit from their incomes, with her husband, Mr. Evaristo Linares, in charge of household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishings for the interior of the house such as plaster and floor tiles

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Maria es casada, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Maria vende golosinas variadas en la puerta del estadio de manera ambulatoria en un triciclo, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, además Maria vende las golosinas en las diferentes fiestas. También Maria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, golosinas y azúcar.
Los sueños de Maria son aumentar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus 3 últimos hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Magnolia community bank. Maria, 37, is married and has 5 children. Maria, a street vendor, uses a tricycle and sells a variety of sweets in the entry to the stadium on Saturdays and Sundays. She also sells sweets at the different festivals. Maria also has a grocery store in her house. Maria needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy soft drinks, sweets, and sugar. Maria’s dreams are to increase her business and give her last 3 children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, and sugar

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: Katherine es una joven soltera muy colaboradora con sus padres, con quienes vive y está involucrada en el progreso económico de su hogar. Las ganas que tiene de apoyar a su familia fueron el punto determinante para empezar a trabajar, buscó muchas posibilidades y eligió hacerlo como costurera en una fábrica de ropa, ya que los pagos que recibe por sus servicios ayudan a cubrir algunas necesidades de la familia. Pero sus deseos están basados en obtener experiencia y dinero suficiente para iniciar su propio negocio dentro de su hogar. El tiempo trabajando en esta fábrica le dio la posibilidad de conocer a varios propietarios, quienes le comunican que gustosos solicitarían sus servicios cuando inicie su negocio propio, y también atendería los pedidos de personas particulares. Katherine está muy contenta porque ya cuenta con una parte del capital para la comprar su máquinas. Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, y en todos estos ciclos de crédito ha trabajado con mucho empeño junto a sus compañeras de grupo, asumiendo todos los retos y sacrificios que requieren para mejorar progresar con su banco comunal. Con los 1000 soles que solicita adquirirá una de las máquinas que requiere para iniciar su negocio propio, el cual promete ser prospero.
texts.en:
Katherine is a single, young, woman who lives with her parents whom she helps out a lot. She is very much involved in the economic progress of the household. She decided to get a job because of her desire to help her family and investigated several possibilities, finally settling on sewing in a clothing factory. The payment she receives helps cover some of her family’s needs. Katherine would like to obtain enough experience and money to start her own business in her home. Since she’s been working at the factory, she has met several property owners who have let her know that they would be happy to hire her once she gets her own business going. She will also honor requests from private clients. Katherine is very happy because she already has part of the capital necessary to buy her machines. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she has worked very hard, together with her fellow bank friends, all of this time taking on the challenges and sacrifices necessary to progress with her communal bank. She will buy the machines she needs for her business with the 1000 soles she’s asking for, which will bring her prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una máquina de costura

loans.name: Ta Malaneh Enterprise Group

texts.en:
This is a group containing Kadiatu T., Amie F., Sallamatu B. K., Kadiatu K., and Memunatu K.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town. They named their group Ta Malaneh, which is a Temne phrase meaning, “Let’s embrace each other.” This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have receivedfrom SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have been of great help to these women. They were able to repay their loans on time and in full, while also feeding their children, paying school fees, and saving some money for unforeseen situations. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of SLL 1,000,000, for each person, to further strengthen their businesses.

Kadiatu T. (second from right) is the leader of the group. Kadiatu is forty-eight years of age. She is married with five children. Three of her children are already adults, and two are still in school. Kadiatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and has been in business for over twenty-five years.

loans.use: Invest in her palm-oil business

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: two sons and four daughters. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Georgina is a fishmonger and sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a table at the market square and also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. Georgina desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Kehongo

texts.en: Kehongo M., a married man, is a Tanzanian small business owner.  He runs a food shop business at Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells varieties of food crop products such as: wheat flower, maize flower, beans, ground nuts, sugar, and cooking oil. He purchases the goods direct from the producers at wholesale and sometimes from the Kariakoo city market. Business income is used to capitalize the business and meet his family's daily needs. He is requesting a loan of  800,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy goods for resale

loans.name: Bashiran Muhammad Rafiq Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is married to M. R. who runs a timber-selling business in the city of Chichawatni, Pakistan. They have been citizens of this city for the past sixteen years. Bashiran baji is a very active and hardworking lady. She helps her husband by tying the pieces of wood together. They have been doing this business for the last eight years. Her husband chose this profession due to no gas being available in the community so that people use wood to cook their food.

Bashiran baji is applying for a loan to buy more timber to increase the profit of her husband’s timber selling business. In the photo, Bashiran baji is standing first on the right.

This loan consists of four additional people: 

Tahira baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Kanizan baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Lalan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy mason’s tools.

loans.use: To buy timbers for her husband's business

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en: Erdenebileg is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Mongolia's capital city, Ulaanbaatar. He has two children; his youngest daughter currently attends the Mongolian University of Agriculture. Erdenebileg graduated from an industrial training college in Russia, as a technician, mechanic, and master teacher in 1979. He has also worked as a translator for a tractor exporting company and as a teacher at a technical college. Erdenebileg currently operates an auto-repair business that specializes in diesel engined cars. He purchases car parts for his business from sellers in South Korea. Erdenebileg started his business in 1996 and has found much success. Today, his current business capital exceeds 4 million tugrugs and his average monthly income is 1.6 million tugrugs. With the success of his business, Erdenebilig was recently able to purchase a home for his  family. This enabled them to move out of their previous rented home. He, also currently pays tuition for his youngest. For the future, Erdenebileg says” I plan to expand business and increase my income so that I can renovate my new house”. Erdenebileg is requesting a 1.500.00 tugrug (approx. $1036 USD) loan  to purchase spare parts for diesel-engined cars.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for diesel-engined cars.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is hoping to obtain financial assistance from Kiva lenders for his hog-raising business that is situated in his house located at Barangay Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela. He is involved in his farming business which is the major source of income for most of the residents in his village.

Due to lack of financial capital, Virgilio is requesting to borrow PHP 3,000 from Kiva lenders as additional business capital. 

Virgilio is already 55 years old and is married to Antonia who is now 52 years of age. The couple is luckily blessed with four children.

Virgilio’s dream is to continue his hog-raising business to support his family’s daily needs and the education of their younger children as well. He wants his children to finish their college education in order for them to live a progressive life.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm S. is married with two children. She lives with her husband in Kompong Chnang Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling groceries, typically earning US $3 per day. Her husband operates his motor taxi in the town and other nearby local markets, earning an income of US $2 of net profit per day. Both of them have to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for the family and the children. Therefore, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase various kinds of groceries and soft drink to expand her current business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: buy groceries

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Julia es casada, tiene 43 años y 6 hijos, Julia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la region en donD. venD. ropa y D. las ferias compra lana D. alpaca que venD. a los intermediarios en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. chompas, fustanes, casacas.
Los sueños D. Julia son mejorar su negocio y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank "Las Margaritas." She is married, 43 years old and has 6 children. Julia travels to the various markets in the region where she sells clothes, and at these markets she also buys alpaca wool that she then sells to intermediaries (brokers) in the city of Ayacucho. Julia needs a loan of 2500 soles to purchase sweaters, embroidered skirts and jackets. Julia dreams of improving her business and educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sweaters, embroidered skirts and jackets

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor, de 30 años, es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. El trabajo de Leonor es la venta de helados, junto a su inseparable carrito recorre las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de personas que deseen refrescarse con un delicioso helado, ella es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, por lo cual siempre tiene más clientes que su competencia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiende para encargarse de su negocio así como de las tareas del hogar, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes, ya que esto la cansa mucho. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para poner una tienda de helados.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Leonor con MFP y espera tener la misma puntualidad que tuvo en sus primeros créditos, pues en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados planea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para así poder comprar más helados.
texts.en:
Leonor, 30, is a fighter and a very happy woman. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents. She is determined to work very hard to succeed in life. Leonor sells ice cream. Together with her inseparable cart, she travels the streets of the city of Juliaca looking for people who want to refresh themselves with a delicious ice cream. She is a happy and charismatic salesperson. That is why she always has more customers than her competition. What she likes most about her work is the freedom she has to run her business and do her household chores. She has been doing this for four years. The most difficult part is walking all day looking for customers. It makes her very tired. In the future she hopes to be able to get enough money together to have an ice cream store. This is Leonor’s fourth loan with MFP. She expects to be as punctual as she was with her first loans. She is a very responsible and supportive member of her communal bank. She will use the 1,500 PEN she is asking for to buy more ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Tida

texts.fr: Tida D. est une femme de 46 ans elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 3 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE depuis 6 ans et demi. Avec son crédit elle vend sur étalage des pommes de terre et des oignons au niveau du marché de son quartier. Les bénéfices générés par son activité de petit commerce lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et d'assurer leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Tida D. is a 46-year-old woman.  She is divorced and lives with her three children, whom she supports.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE for 6½ years.  With her loan, she's selling potatoes and onions all laid out at the markeplace of her district.  The profits generated by her small-scale business allows her to improve her children's living conditions and to ensure they have schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her small commercial business

loans.name: Milagro Maria

texts.es: Milagro de 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos niños, un varòncito de 6 años  y una niña de 1 añito, labora en la financiera FAMA como Jefe Servicio Financiero, esa solicitando 2do refinancimiento y espera ser beneficiada por el fondo kiva para compra de material de construcciòn y construir un dormitorio en su casa, su marido le ayuda para los gastos del hogar, se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer emprendedora responsable, honesta, reconocido en la comunidad con buenas referencias crèditicia, es muy responsable con sus compromisos, posee capacidad y voluntad de pago. El mayor sueño de Milagro es poder tener una vivienda digna con las condiciones basicas para que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente amplio y agradable.
texts.en:
Milagro is 29 years old and married. She has two small children, a 6 year old son and a 1 year old daughter.

Milagro works for Financiera FAMA as a financial services manager. She is requesting her second loan and hopes to be the beneficiary of Kiva funding so that she can buy construction materials to build a bedroom in her house. Her husband helps with the household expenses. Milagro is characterized as an enterprising, responsible, and honest woman. She is known in her community and has good credit references. In addition, she has demonstrated responsibility in her commitments, as well as the capacity and willingness to repay her loans.

Milagro’s dream is to have a decent home with the basic necessities so that her children can grow up in a spacious and pleasant environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 20 años, vive con su hijo en una casa arrendada.
Hace 8 meses la necesidad y los deseos de salir adelante la llevaron a emprender su propio negocio. Con el fruto del arduo trabajo en la agricultura que realizó en su tierra natal, logró ahorrar para comprar mercadería e implementar una tienda de comestibles.
Luego de 6 meses de atención y constancia ya ha logrado adquirir clientela, la cual le permite tener un ingreso estable sin descuidar la atención de su bebé.
Lo difícil para ella es darse tiempo para comprar los productos para surtir su tienda, por lo que lo hace durante los fines de semana, que compra las frutas y verduras, para lo demás sus proveedores traen su mercadería hasta su tienda. 
Guillermina tiene grandes deseos de mejorar, tener mayor cantidad de mercadería y dar mejor atención a sus clientes.

Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, la primera vez demostró ser puntual en sus pagos, es por eso que ahora tiene la opción de renovar su préstamo. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá más mercadería en panteones (queque navideño), leche evaporada y chocolate para taza, productos muy demandados en navidad.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 20 years old and lives with her son in a rented home. 8 months ago she decided to begin her own business as a result of need and a desire to make something of her life. As a result of hard work in agriculture that she has done in her homeland, she was able to save money to buy merchandise and begin a grocery store. After 6 months of dedication and perseverance, she has gained customers which allows her to have a stable income without taking away from the care of her baby. What is difficult for her is to have time to buy the products to stock her store with, which is why she does it on weekends. She buys fruits and vegetables and, for all other goods, her suppliers bring the merchandise to her store. Guillermina has big dreams for improvement, to have larger quantities of merchandise and provide better service for her customers. This is the second time that she has a loan with the MFP. The first time she was shown to be on time with all her payments and, for that reason, she now has the option of renewing the loan. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more merchandise such as "panteones" (a Christmas cake), evaporated milk and drinking chocolate, products that are in high demand during Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Soraya Alamdari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Mohamed J.

texts.en:
Mohamed J. G. is 29 years old. He has been married for six years and has two kids. The oldest has entered primary school. His wife, Hawanatu Mansaray, is a petty trader, selling textiles in the main market in the town. Mohamed sells food and drinks and has been in this business for the last ten years. He believes that if his business were improved it would provide him and his family their livelihood.

Mohamed has been a group client in the ARD Micro Credit Programme for the last twelve months with a good credit history. He wants to leave the group and take out an individual loan. Mohamed needs the loan so that he can increase and diversify his inventory so as to increase his sales and income. He is hardworking and is determined to educate his children from the increased profits of his business. He is also determined to construct a small house for the family on a piece of land he has already bought.

loans.use: To increase and diversify his inventory

loans.name: Nixon Jacinto

texts.es:
Nixon Y. de 57 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, solo tiene agua y luz como servicio básico, no tiene esposa pero tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad, el  vive solo en su casa. 

Nixon trabajaba como albañil poco a poco pudo reunir dinero para comprarse una camioneta así  pudo cambiar de trabajo a servicio de fletes con su propia camioneta. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 14h00 y desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00 todos los días, el promedio de fletes que hace son de 8 a12 al día. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es cuando se le daña el vehiculo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para el mantenimiento del vehiculo y así dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere abril un negocio de venta y reparación de vehículos.
texts.en:
Nixon Y. is 57 years old and lives in the greater urban area of Guayaquil. He has only basic services of water and electricity. He does not have a wife, but has 4 children who are already adults. He lives alone in his house. Nixon was working as a mason so that little by little he could raise money to buy a truck so that he could have his own freight service. He is now working from 7am until 2pm and from 3pm to 7pm, every day, or 8 to 12 hours per day, on average. One problem that arises is when the vehicle is damaged. He is asking for a loan to maintain the vehicle so that he can provide better service to his customers. In the future he would like to open a business for selling and repairing vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle repair

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty S. is from the city of Naawan in Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old. Liberty is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Liberty sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Liberty has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Liberty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liberty is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Liberty's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Heyling Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Heyling Carolina L. A., tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y su esposo es ebanista ellos viven en el humilde en el humilde Barrio San Ignacio, tienen 3 hijos, actualmente ellos se dedican a los estudios de primaria. La familia sobrevive de la agricultura desde hace 10 años.

Como toda familia Nicaragüense, anhela con mejorar las condiciones de vida de todos y dentro de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado para culminar este sueño, ha sido la falta de un mejor manejo agronómico adecuado al cultivo, es para esto que solicita de este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales agrícolas, tales como fertilizantes e insumos que garanticen una cosecha de calidad y la venta rápida de esta producción, en los años anteriores lo  manejaban, gracias al capital brindado por su esposo, pero este año la ventas han bajado y se les ha dificultado el reunir el dinero necesario para la compra, esto a futuro les daría el capital para la planificación e inversión en la diversificación de nuevas cosechas.
texts.en:
Heyling Carolina L. A. is 26 and married. Her husband is a cabinetmaker. They live in the humble San Ignacio neighborhood. They have three children; they are currently in primary school. The family has survived through farming for ten years. Like all Nicaraguan families, they long to improve their living conditions. One of the problems they have faced in fulfilling this dream has been the lack of better agronomic management, which would be good for the crops. That is why she is asking for this loan to buy agricultural materials like fertilizers and supplies that guarantee a quality harvest and rapid sale of this production. In previous years they managed thanks to money from her husband. But, this years sales have decreased, and it is difficult for them to get together enough money for the purchase. This will give them capital in the future to plan and invest in the diversification of new crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and supplies for their fields

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna M. is a married woman who supports her family by running a general store and fish vending. She lives in Brgy Culipapa, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental with her husband Noel and their seven children who are 14 to 25 years old. Two of her children have their own families and the other five are going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.

Paterna is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can maintain operation of her general store and fish vending business. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Paterna aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 30-year-old married woman with two school-age children. Six years ago, she started running a tailoring business from her home to earn income and help her husband in the household. She produces all kinds of tailoring supplies in addition to sewing curtains. She is well known by customers because she's very talented in her work.

Today, Fatmeh is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase additionA. textiles to augment her productivity, meet her customers' demands, and so increase her family income.

loans.use: To purchase additional textiles

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is into rental services; she rents out canopies, plastic chairs and tables to make ends meet. She is very happy with her business and she is well known in her locality. She has so many customers as a result of her popularity. With the proceeds from the business, she assists and supports her husband in financing the home. 

Roseline is married with six children and her husband is doing well in his business too. She is 60 years of age and, even at her age, she is still business-conscious. She hopes for a loan of 170,000 nairas to purchase more canopies, plastic chairs and tables to meet the demand of her numerous customers in town. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more canopies, plastic chairs and tables

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie T. is from the village of Salimpuno, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Gerlie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gerlie raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Gerlie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Gerlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Gerlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gerlie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase chicken feed. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gerlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 40 años y tiene dos hijos.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender comida en el mercado modelo de Calca. Ya son 20  años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de chancho y cordero.

Marivel se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marivel belongs to the commercial bank "Valle Sagrado" (Sacred Valley), which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She is 40 years old, and has 2 children. She currently lives in the city of Calca. Her main economic activity is selling food in the Mercado Modelo in Calca. She has had this business for 20 years, and it is going very well. She needs a loan to buy pork and lamb meat. Marivel is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pork and lamb meat

loans.name: Jantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Jantoyerela sont  des femmes mariées  avec en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Sanoubougou II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  des produits alimentaires  tels les fruits et légumes avec Mariam C., les poissons, les tubercules et la restauration.
Mariam C. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  10 paniers de fruits (avocats). Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et dans  les villages avoisinants auprès des producteurs.  Les fruits sont vendus au  marché   de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et  souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five member of the group Jantoyerela are married women averaging 38 years of age and three children. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Sanoubougou II, a district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their first collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. This group of women does commerce in foods, such as fruit and vegetables (in the case of Mariam C.), fish, tubers, and food catering. Mariam C. plans on using her loan to buy ten baskets of fruit (avocados). She gets her supplies at the big market and in neighboring villages from producers. The fruit is sold at the Sikasso market and as a family. Accepting cash and often credit, she makes her retail sales to a customer base composed of women and men. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 18,500 francs CFA. Part of the profit will be used for family expenses, and the other part will be invested in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruit

loans.name: Bernarda Del Socorro

texts.es: Bernarda Del Socorro tiene 58 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 15 años que tiene esta actividad,  Su madre siempre le dio el consejo en iniciar esta actividad, de esa manera logra conseguir el sustento económico. Eligió vender bolsos, pantalones, faldas, toallas, sabanas y calzado por lo que le genera buenas ganancias para comercializar en mayor cantidad. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria pues tiene ciertos pedidos. Desea terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Bernarda Del Socorro is 58 years old and her business is buying and selling general merchandise. She has done this for more than 15 years. Her mother always gave her the advice to start this business, and she manages to sustain herself financially in this way. She chose to sell bags, trousers, skirts, towels, sheets and shoes therefore she generates good profits in order to sell greater quantities. The loan that she is asking for is to buy necessary raw material as she has certain orders. She wants to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Abdukosim

texts.en:
S. Abdukosim has been baking traditional bread since childhood. He inherited this skill from his father and grandfather. His working day starts at 4 a.m. when he and his assistants begin to knead dough, form the bread, and heat the stove. For the first time, Abdukosim kneads dough from 2 sacks of flour of 50 kg. each. The summer is an important period for his business, as citizens have many weddings and other family events. He needs to have a stock of flour and coal. For this reason Abdukosim applied to IMON International for a loan of 9000 Somoni. Abdukosim and his family appreciate your support in helping him improve his business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the flour at wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Mrs. Dy S. is 27 year of age and single. She lives with her mother who is shown in the photo. Dy S. works in a company located in the middle of Phnom Penh City and earns a salary of $150 of a month. She has two financial helpers in her younger sisters who are employed in a small firm. Dy S. is taking out this loan as capital to start a vehicle-cleaning service for additional income and will also use part of the loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To begin a vehicle-cleaning service.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina M. is from the village of Mangcuram. She is 27 years old. Cristina is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Cristina raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cristina has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Willma solicito 750 $us, se dedica a la venta  de  productos alimenticios en los días de feria que se realiza los días  lunes, miércoles, sábado y domingo, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su hija en la ciudad de El Alto . El crédito lo destinara como capital de trabajo para la adquisición de más mercadería y así incrementar sus ventas. Es el segundo crédito en impro y el segundo vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Wilma requests a loan of $750 US. She sells prepared foods on days when street markets convene, on Mondays, Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays. She lives with her parents in their house, alongside her daughter in the city of El Alto. This loan will be invested as working capital and it will be used towards the purchase of merchandise, to improve sales. This is her second loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables in greater quantities to meet client demand.

loans.name: Realiza

texts.en:
This is Realiza G., 38, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo G., a carpenter, and mother of two children, one of whom are already in elementary while the youngest, just barely able to toddle around, is the apple of Realiza and Romeo’s eyes. By the grace of God, Realiza has managed to support her older child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send both of her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Realiza, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Realiza operates a meat shop. Live pigs are bought from hog raisers and then slaughtered and sold to the immediate community. She has many patrons who buy the cut meat and then sell it at their respective market stalls. There are many patrons who prefer Realiza’s products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. It is also a little cheaper to buy meat from an independent meat shop than the ones in the marker who sometimes use the services of professional slaughter houses for their meat. The cost of slaughter is added to the final price of the cut meat, and passed along to the customers. Thus, Realiza has many patrons who regularly anticipate her meat. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy live pigs to be slaughtered and sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Realiza dreams of being able to give both her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her own market stall someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy live pigs to be slaughtered and sold every day

loans.name: Rosa Eliana

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”  ubicado en la provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la señora estudió educación superior completo.

La señora Rosa esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses como grupo mientras tanto y en la actualidad como Banco Comunal,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de  abarrotes.

En la actualidad la señora  solicitará un nuevo  crédito S/. 600.00 nuevos soles dinero que le servirá para comprar más insumos para su tienda de abarrotes.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una estabilidad segura, por lo que necesita incrementar su capital y hacer crecer  el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la responsabilidad y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Las Perlas II” (The Pearls II) communal bank, located in the district and province of Huancané, within the Puno department. She is a 41 year old single mother and has one son. She has a high school education. Rosa has been working with the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” (Manuela Ramos Movement), as a group and now a communal bank, for eight months. She tells us that her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used as working capital for her grocery business. This time she is requesting a loan of 600 PEN ($225), which will allow her to buy more merchandise for her grocery store. She wants to have secure stability and she needs to increase her capital and grow her business. What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is its members’ responsibility and timeliness.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Today Sunshine Group

texts.en:
Deddeh W., who is holding the sign in the picture, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Today Sunshine.  She is 40 years old married, and has five children who are between the ages of three to twenty years. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to financial constraints. 

For seven years, she has been selling used clothes and working in the motorcycle transport business in Wroto Town Community Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollars portion of this 46,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes, spare parts and petroleum.
She describes herself as an easy-going woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes, spare parts and petroleum

loans.name: El Crucero [The Crossing] Group

texts.es:
La señora  Fe de Luz H. S., vive en la localidad de Emiliano zapata, municipio de Copainala estado de Chiapas  México. Es viuda tiene dos hijas. 
Una de ellas se fue a vivir a otra ciudad y dejo a su hijo Aldeín con la señora Fe de Luz, su otra hija se llama Sonia Saraos H. y tiene 19 años. 
Así la señora Fe de Luz vive con su nieto Aldeín de 9 años y su hija Sonia.

    Solicito el  préstamo para comprar mercancía y  surtir su tienda de ropas como son: pantalones, camisas, playeras, trajecitos para niños, blusas, vestidos entre otro para venderlo en las comunidades cercanas de su pueblo. Lleva con esta actividad nueve años en donde le va bien ya que ha obtenido buen ingresos en su hogar.
Lo que lo motivo  a realizar esta actividad fue su familia ya que es una mujer sola y tenía que buscar de donde obtener ingresos y salir adelante con ellos.

    Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio compra más mercancía de mejor calidad, así su clientela se anime a comprarle más y con ello obtenga mejores ganancias y pueda agrandar su tienda.

      El sueño que fe de luz  tiene es poder ahorrar para lograr construir un local en donde pueda exhibir su mercancía de ropa y las personas de las riberas cercanas adquieran sus ropas, mientras ella sale a vender en las comunidades,  así obtener ingresos de ambos lados de su negocio, pero lo más importante es que su hija siga estudiando y termine su carrera de ser doctora.

     Ella formo el grupo con dos señoras mas las cuales ya han trabajado con el préstamo y cometan que les va bien, el grupo se llama "el crucero" la razón del nombre es porque una de las integrantes a traviesa la carretera que divide a otras localidades y decidieron ponerle ese nombre.

       Las integrantes del grupo son tres señoras y cada una con diferente actividad:

   Ofelia Gómez Jiménez: invierte el préstamo en la compra plásticos de tuperware como son: toper, jarras, copas, entre otros.
   Fe de luz  H. S.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía de ropas como son: pantalones, playeras, camisas, entre otros. 
  Eleyda Domínguez Márquez: compra semillas de la región para venderlo en el mercado. Como son: canela, tomillo, achiote, ajo, entre otros.
texts.en:
Fe de Luz H. S. lives in the town of Emiliano Zapata, municipality of Copainala, in the state of Chiapas, México. She is a widow with one daughter in her care: Sonia Saraos H., age 19, and a grandson who has lived with her since he was little, Aldeín, age 9. 

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise and stock her clothing business with items such as pants, shirts, t-shirts, children's suits, blouses, and dresses, among others. She sells these items in the communities near her village. She has done this work for nin years, and it is going well for her, since she has been able to obtain a good income for her household. 

What motivated her to start this activity was her family, since she is a woman alone and had to find a way to obtain an income and help her family get ahead. 

With the earnings she obtains from her business, she will buy more merchandise of better quality, so that her customers will be motivated to buy more. With this, she will be able to earn better profits and expand her business. 

The dream that Fe de Luz has is to be able to save up enough to build a store where she can display her merchandise, so the people from nearby settlements can buy her clothing while she goes out to sell her merchandise in other communities. Thus, she would obtain income from both sides of her business. However, the most important thing for her is that her daughter continues her studies and finishes her degree so she can become a doctor. 

She formed the group with two other women who have already worked with a loan, and they comment that it is going well for them. The group is called "El Crucero" [The Crossing], and the reason for the name is that one of the members has cross the highway which divides the area from other towns, so they decided to choose this name. 

The group is made up of three women, each with a different activity: 

Ofelia Gómez Jiménez will invest the loan in buying Tupperware plastic items, such as plastic boxes, pitchers and cups, among others. 
Fe de Luz H. S. will invest the loan in buying clothing to sell such as pants, t-shirts, shirts, and others. 
Eleyda Domínguez Márquez will buy local seeds to sell at the market, such as cinnamon, thyme, achiote and garlic, among others.

loans.use: Buying clothing to sell such as pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, and others

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro tiene 55 años de edad, es divorciado y vive junto a un hijo de 14 años de edad en el distrito de Reque, una zona urbana que se encuentra situada a más de quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al alquiler de equipo de sonido. El cuenta con una mezcladora y varioa amplificadores y los alquila para amenizar todo tipo de fiestas sociales y ceremonias. Sus clientes generalmente alquilan estos equipos los fines de semana. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad. Teodoro se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

El desea mejorar sus equipos adquiriendo una mejor consola y nuevos parlantes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su meta.

Teodoro es una persona bastante tranquila y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y que su negocio sea el más conocido por la zona.
texts.en:
Teodoro, 55, is divorced and lives with a 14 year old son in Reque district, an urban area located fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He rents sound systems.  He has a synthesizer and several speakers that he rents out for all kinds of social events and ceremonies.  His customers usually rent the equipment on weekends.  Income from these rentals makes it possible for Teodoro to support his family.

He wants to improve the equipment buying a better console and new speakers.  He feels asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan then is a good idea to reach his goal.

Teodoro is quite levelheaded and hard working.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman and that his business becomes very well known throughout the area.

loans.use: To buy sound equipment to stock his sound equipment rental business.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin P. is from the city of Lam-an Ozamiz. He is 38 years old. Erwin is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Erwin owns and operates a transport business. Erwin has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Erwin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Erwin is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken by Erwin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Danila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Danila; tiene 48 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta juguetes, ella vende en el comercial el Molino, la socia vende todo tipo de juguetes, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes al por mayor.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ms. Danila is a member of the communal bank “Los Diamantes” [The Diamonds] which is in Cusco District, Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco.  

She is 48 years old, a single mother and has two children. Her time is divided between the daily chores and selling toys at the market.  She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm selling all kinds of toys at Comercial el Molino [The Molino Market]. She is able to provide for her children through her work.  She would like to expand and buy toys wholesale with the money requested.

The member is grateful for the loan and has committed herself to pay it on a timely manner.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to buy toys wholesale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida P. is 31 years old, married, and supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:  a sari-sari (general) store,  an electronic reloading business, and a tricycle business. She lives in Prk. Abanico, Brgy. San Pedro, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Sari-sari (general) store, electronic reloading and tricycle businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12000. Zenaida is now borrowing PHP 10000 so that she could purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 28000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Zenaida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Venecia

texts.en:
Mrs. Venecia G. is 57 years of age, married, and a resident of Bocator, Tangub City, Mis. Occ. She is married to Tomas G., a fisherman and laborer in their barangay (village). They are blessed with 1 child who is married already. She helped her husband in growing their business by engaging in fish vending. For 10 years she has been able to sustain their business, and at this time she is earning an average income of P3,000.00 a month. She joined PAGLAUM MPC this year because she is very interested in their products and services. As a newly recognized borrower, she is requesting 4,000.00 for her 1st loan to add capital to her fish vending business. The future income from this loan will be used for loan repayments and savings for her future, especially for her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn M. is from the village of D'ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Rowelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sewing supplies business, providing new dressmaking supplies to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rowelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is from the village of Lusot Baliangao, Mis. Occ. She is 51 years old. Evelyn is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Lavender".

Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling bread to the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADENYA de l’association Sabougnouma est composé de 4 femmes mariées du quartier Dabani de la préfecture de SAN région de Ségou quatrième  région administrative de la république du MALI. Les membres du groupe BADENYA vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elle ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage et la  parenté. Les membres du groupe ont intégré le programme de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a 2 ans et sont à leur 3 eme cycle. Elles évoluent dans les activités génératrices de revenus il y’ a environ 20 ans.  
NATOGOMA T. qui est la vendeuse de condiments et de savons du groupe, compte acheter avec son prêt, 10 sacs de fakoye, 20 paniers de Sounbala, 10 paniers de potasse et 30 sacs d’oignon frais et 5 cartons de savons  à SAN et environnants  pour revendre à GAO en détail, en demi gros et en espèce.  
Elle espère mensuellement sur un bénéfice de 42.000FCFA tandis que les autres membres du groupe compte sur un bénéfice de 39.000FCFA, qui seront utilisés pour rembourser les prêts, subvenir aux besoins familiaux et réinvestir dans l’entreprise pour pouvoir l’agrandir.
texts.en:
The Badenya solidarity group of the Sabougnouma association is composed of four married women from the Dabani neighborhood, prefecture of San, in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members live in large traditional families. They average 45 years of age and five children each. They came together as neighbors and through ties of kinship. 

The group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago and are now on their 3rd loan cycle. They have been engaged in income-generating activities for about twenty years.
