NATOGOMA T. is the group member who sells condiments and soap. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 bags of fakoye, 20 baskets of Sounbala, 10 baskets of potash, 30 bags of fresh onions and 5 boxes of soap in SAN and surrounding areas for resale in GAO at retail or wholesale, for cash.

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 42,000 FCFA while the other members of the group are hoping for a 39,000 FCFA monthly profit, which will be used to repay the loans, provide for the needs of their families, and to reinvest in their activities for expansion purposes.

loans.use: Purchase of miscellaneous items

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer es soltero y tiene 28 años, reside en casa de a sus padres en una zona urbano marginal en el Distrito de Jose Leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años, Elmer brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporta a sus clientes en la ruta entre José Leonardo Ortiz y la cuidad de Chiclayo. 

Elmer desea realizar la compra de SOAT, regularizar sus permisos de operatividad y  algunas mejoras a su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo, que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elmer is 28 years old and single. He lives with his parents in an urban zone next to José Leonardo Ortiz district, which is part of Lambayeque province, 20 minutes from Chiclayo city.

For the last three years, Elmer has been working in public transportation. He drives a mototaxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle attached to a passenger cabin. He drives the route between José Leonardo Ortiz and Chiclayo city.

Elmer wants to purchase SOAT (vehicle insurance), obtain his operator's license as a public transportation driver, and make improvements to his motorcycle to keep it in good condition so that he can continue offering good service to his customers. For these reasons, he is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase of vehicle insurance.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina lives in a small city called Kot Radha Kishan which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and is famous for its agriculture and dairy industry. She lives there in a single-room brick house with her family in the area of Judgewala. She came here 20 years ago. She is 45 years old, married to M. H., and has 4 sons. Due to financial reasons she is unable to educate her children.  

Her husband is a talented man, operates a musical band and entertains people at their functions by offering musical performances. People contact him at different functions such as marriage ceremonies and birthday parties, etc.  He is the only breadwinner in the family. For this reason, his growth in business is absolutely necessary for them to improve financially. 

That’s why Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a musical instrument (guitar) to improve the quality of his band which should earn him better profits. Robina is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and do her household works. 

She is hopeful that an investment will put her husband’s business in more profitable position which will result in better financial conditions for her family. 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To buy a musical instrument (guitar)

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation. 

Said has operated a retail shop for the past six years, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. The business has helped him meet his family's basic needs on a daily basis. Said is planning to use this loan to purchase stock, bundles of wheat and maize flour, and cooking oil. Said decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business to meet customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is 38 years old and married with one child in school.  Febe works very hard to provide for them.

Febe runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for the general store.

Febe has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as coffee, bread, sugar etc. 

In the future, Febe would like to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Vobiya

texts.en: Vobiya is 54 years old, a widow, and has five children, none of whom go to school. She currently runs a business selling charcoal. Vobiya has taken a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma M. is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend college. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling as retail and at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a poultry farm in the future. 

With the KES 35,000, she wants to build a poultry farm. She will purchase timber, wire mesh and iron sheets. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase timber, wire mesh and iron sheets in order to build a poultry farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for an agricultural business.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a 45 year old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She runs a rice farming business. She has been growing rice for 8 years. This business earns 4,300 PHP per month.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Nena hopes to improve her business and to earn bigger income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is 55 years old. She is divorced and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her three children. 

Luong runs a cafe, which she began eight years ago. The income source from the cafe helps her to feed her children and maintain their living conditions. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of beverages and food to meet her customers' needs. 

She hopes her business will ensure that her family members have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more beverages and food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building tools

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has one child.

In 2010, Thamer opened a shop for women’s accessories. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a loan of $1,800 to renovate his shop from outside and inside, to make shelves and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop from outside and inside, to make shelves and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 30 years old and married with six children between the ages of 1 and 13 years old. He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Karuguuza, Uganda. For five years, Jimmy has been dealing in the sale of local gin. From this business, he has been able to build a permanent house, which he is about to complete. He faces the challenge of the high rate of inflation but hopes to sell his local gin to bigger markets like the city where there is a local market. Jimmy needs a loan to buy local gin to sell.

loans.use: To buy local gin.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru:
Фахриддин честный и ответственный муж. Он женат и любящий отец одного сына. Он преподает в школе и параллельно занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур.  Он выращивает картофель, морковь и пшеницу.  Раньше он получал кредит от Имон Интернэшнл и оно помогло ему в положительную сторону. Он увеличил оборотный капитал и улучшил условия его жизни. Теперь, он хотел бы получит еще кредит для покупки минеральное удобрение и мешки для его урожая. Фахриддин заранее хочет поблагодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Fakhriddin is an honest and responsible man. He is married and a loving father of one son. He teaches in a school and at the same time is involved in growing crops. He grows potatoes, carrots and wheat. Previously, he received a loan from IMON International and it helped him in a positive way. He increased his working capital and improved his quality of life. Now, he would like to receive another loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and bags for his crops. Fakhriddin wishes in advance to thank his creditors for their support and kindness. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers and bags

loans.name: Freddy Saul

texts.es:
Freddy Saúl  tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive solo en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
 
La V.R.C NUEVOS UNIDOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

Freddy Saúl se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café, etc. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas,  para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar una casa para llegar a tener una familia.

Le gusta escuchar música, y visitar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Freddy Saúl is 33 years old, single, and lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province.

The Communal Bank “Nuevos Unidos” is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, which is part of the canton of Chillanes.  The members of this Communal Bank are farmers who grow mainly corn, cacao, oranges, bananas, and coffee.

Freddy Saúl grows corn, cacao, oranges, bananas, coffee, and other crops.  He buys his supplies and sells his products at the market in San José del Tambo each weekend.

Freddy Saúl is requesting a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, and agricultural composts for his crops.  This loan provides the support to meet his financial needs and improve his farming activities.  The challenges he faces include the falling prices of the products he sells to people, such as middlemen.  His dream is to buy a house so that he can start a family.

Freddy Saúl enjoys listening to music and visiting his parents.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, and compost for his crops.

loans.name: Indaura Ismelda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Indaura, tiene 57 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tienen 8 hijos, 7 de sus hijos son mayores y el menor  de 17 años estudia en un colegio a distancia, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga tiene un local en su casa en el cual  vende artículos de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días  desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando sus clientes necesitan algo. Tiene su negocio ya por más de 15 años y nos cuenta que le gusta mucho ya que en él se entretiene.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar como: regalos, tarjetas, peluches  y útiles escolares. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 20 ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución.
 
Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, that’s full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know how to work and be devoted to their families.  Indaura, 57, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has 8 children. Seven of her children are adults and the youngest is 17 years old and goes to a distance learning school.  Two of her children still live with her.   Her husband’s a merchant.

Our friend has a locale at home where she sells general merchandise and stationary items.  She works every day from 8am until 6pm and sometimes even later when her customers need something.  She’s had the business for over 15 years and she tells us that she likes it very much because it keeps her entertained.

This loan is to buy general merchandise like: gift items, greeting cards, stuffed toys and school supplies.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for 20 cycles and she likes it because of the additional services the institution provides.  Her dream is to increase business and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy gift items, greeting cards, stuffed toys and school supplies.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que tiene gastos escolares, que es pagar las inscripciones y comprar los útiles escolares que son cuadernos, carpetas, libros, plumas y lápices, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero para poder pagar estos gastos que tiene para que sus hijos puedan estudiar este año escolar. 
Doña Maritza trabaja en un restaurante de comida Mexicana con una parte del sueldo que recibe pagar el crédito ya que es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene. 
Desea que sus hijos tengan una buena educación, para que tengan un futuro mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Maritza is s single mother and she is raising 3 children. She is asking for a loan since she has to pay for school expenses and buy supplies such as notebooks, folders, books, pens and pencils. At this time, she doesn't have the money to pay for these expenses so that her children can go to school this year.   

Maritza works a Mexican restaurant and with part of her wages will pay off the loan, since it is her only source of income. She wants for her children to have a good education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses buying supplies and paying for registration fees.

loans.name: Probo

texts.en:
Probo is 33 years old, married and has two school aged children. His wife is a teacher who already has nine years in this service. Probo has run a hog raising business for almost seven years. He has five sow and seven pigs for fattening.

Probo is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He needs additional capital to cope with the increasing price of feed nowadays. He plans to improve his practices in taking care of his sow to gain higher profits through the piglets he sells. Probo says that this will help him uplift their living.

Probo dreams to finish their children's education till college. He has no other wealth to give to his children, other than education.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 57-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a professional taxi driver since 1991. His service path is based on a wide geographical area. Despite his older age, Hussein is obliged to work hard in order to gain good income to be able to well support his family financially. And today, he is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform much needed maintenance on his taxi to increase its safety. He says that he will attract more customers after making the repairs. In the future, he plans to delegate his business to his oldest son.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance on his taxi to increase its safety

loans.name: Koam

texts.en:
Mrs. Koam is 35-year-old married woman who has been resided in Siem Reap province. She is a responsible housewife who takes care of three children. All of her children are getting ready for school, so she has to try hard to earn more income to support their education. 

Mrs. Koam is in the business of making a paste of fermented fish and cultivating vegetable crops. She gets fresh fish from her husband who catches them out of the river and nearby lake. She is able to earn around $4 USD per day through this business.

Mrs. Koam has another skill in making clothes. However, she cannot start and operate this business due to the lack of assets like a sewing machine and other necessary machines. Now she is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy those machines to start running her sewing business. She hopes that she can improve her business, generate more income and make a good standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other necessary machines.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Teresa, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una aldea rural de Puerto Cortes, tiene 5 hijos de 30, 27, 23, 16 y 8 años de edad, dos de ellos están estudiando.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz, y además vende carne  y algunas verduras y frutas en cantidades pequeñas. Ella trabaja muy duro todo el día. Su  clientela esta en su aldea y ha crecido. De este negocio salen los ingresos que cubren los gastos de alimentación y gastos de estudio de sus hijos.
Ha   trabajado con financiamiento con ODEF, este es su sexto préstamo y lo utiliza para compra de materia prima como el Maíz, carnes, verduras y frutas.
Actualmente, cocina en una hornilla tradicional bajo una galera al aire libre, su meta es mejorar su hornilla y local para mantener su clientela.
texts.en:
Teresa is 56 years old and a single mother.  She lives in a rural village in Puerto Cortes.  She has five children; ages 30, 27, 23, 16, and 8.  Two of them attend school.

She has been making and selling corn tortillas for ten years.  She also sells meat and some fruits and vegetables in small quantities.  She works very hard all day.  Her customers are in her village, and clientele has grown.

It is from this business that she gets the income to cover the food expenses and her children’s educational expenses.

She has worked with loans from ODEF.  This is her sixth loan.  She will use it to buy raw material like corn, meat, fruits, and vegetables.

She currently cooks with a traditional stove in a kitchen in the open air.

Her goal is to improve her stove and her place in order to keep her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn or corn flour to make tortillas and to buy meat, vegetables, and fruit.

loans.name: Chui Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chui Group in Western Kenya! Philip is the facilitator of the Chui group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Philip takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Philip had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Philip was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Philip  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Philip will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Chui group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife, parents and one sibling. Ali happily helps support his father, and they’re both covering the family's needs and expenses. He has been working on his own for the past four years. His job consists of transporting cars in his tow truck so they may be fixed. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on his shuttle. This loan will allow him to carry on his job properly. In the future, he plans to have his own house and children.

loans.use: perform needed maintenance on his shuttle

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is a 37-year-old single mother of four from the Suba Ragana township, an upcoming town in Migori, Western Kenya.

Benter has operated a clothes-selling business in the Ragana area for the last seven years. She has been in KADET LTD for some time now, and she is taking her third loan which she will use to buy new stock of used clothing for sale. She anticipates sales as we approach the December festivities. She will use her profits to expand her business.

Her dream is to ensure her business is always stocked and she has what her clientele demands.

loans.use: To buy a stock of used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Ines Matilde

texts.es: La señora Matilde es clienta que participo en banca comunal trabajo muy bien pero ahora solicita un crédito individual, la Sra. es una persona muy amable y responsable ya que no tubo ningún problema con el pago de sus cuotas, ella vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos que se encuentran estudiando, en una casa en anticrético en la zona de villa exaltación , necesita el crédito para la compra de un puesto de venta en la ciudad de Oruro, la señora tiene la actividad de fabricación de latas y envases para hornos, ya sean de pan como las latas para hornear lechones, la fabricación la realiza de forma manual, y de planchas, ella viaja a las ferias de Oruro, Potosí, Tarija y Sucre, donde ya tiene un mercado establecido el sueño que ella tiene es hacer construir una casita en el terreno que se esta comprando, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como chofer,  con el dinero del crédito se comprara un puesto de venta en un mercado ya que así podrá ofrecer sus productos en un puesto fijo. La Sra. Matilde es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Matilde was a member of a communal bank that worked very well but is now requesting an individual loan. The lady is a very kind and responsible person as she never had any problems making her repayments. She lives with her husband and 4 children, who are studying, in a house in Anticretico in the Villa Exaltacion area. She needs the loan to buy a kiosk in the city of Oruro. The lady makes cans and containers for ovens, be it for baking bread or roasting suckling pigs. She manufactures her products by hand and with smoothing irons. She travels to the street markets of Oruro, Potosi, Tarija and Sucre where she has an established customer base. Her dream is to build a little house on the plot of land she is buying. She has her husband's support. He works as a driver. With the loan she will buy a kiosk at a market as in this way she will be able to sell her products from a fixed stand. Sra. Matilde is a very hardworking person, grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to acquire a kiosk.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es: A sus 50 años, el señor José Fernando se dedica a la producción de artículos de acero desde su taller adecuado en un pequeño local en un barrio del occidente de la ciudad de Medellín en el cual fabrica escaleras, pasamanos y camarotes en una jornada de lunes a viernes de 8:00 a.m a 5:00 p.m, gracias al conocimiento que su padre le brindo sobre esta labor. Con el fin de cumplir con varios pedidos, el señor José Fernando necesita de la compra de acero con el cual pueda entregar a sus clientes lo prometido. El sueño del señor José Fernando es ampliar su negocio y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y dos hijos.
texts.en:
At 50 years of age, Sr. José Fernando has been producing objects made of steel from his workshop set up in a small space in a neighborhood west of the city of Medellín. He produces stairs, handrails, and bunk beds Monday through Friday from 8am to 5pm. Thanks to the knowledge he obtained from his father, he is able to complete the work on various orders.

Sr. José Fernando needs to buy steel so that he can deliver the orders he promised to his customers. His dream is to expand his business and provide a better quality of life for his wife and two children.

loans.use: to buy steel.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à KABOILA II un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
SAFIATOU 1ère à droite sur la photo fait le commerce d’atieké à dans le groupe de femmes DEMBAGNOUMA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 3 sacs de 100kg d’atieké.Elle s’approvisionne à Loulouni les jour sde foires et souvent au marché de  Médine dans la ville de Sikasso.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille  dans leur quartier (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Dembagnouma group are essentially married women who average 32 years of age and have an average of two children each. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Kaboila II, one of Sikasso town's working-class districts.

They are on their sixth loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of satisfying customer demand. The previous loans have all be repaid in full.

Safiatou, who is on the far right of the photo, sells "atiéke" (a type of semolina made from cassava) in the Dembagnouma women's group. With her loan she is planning to buy three 100kg sacks of "atiéke". She gets her supplies in Loulouni on fair days and often at the Médine market in Sikasso town. She resells them at a fixed place in Sikasso's Grand Market and within her family in their neighborhood (wholesale and retail) to a customer base made up of men and women for cash. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 23,250FCFA, of which part will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it, and the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy "atiéke" (semolina made from cassava)

loans.name: La Hermita Group

texts.es:
Grupo La Hermita ha demostrado ser un grupo responsable y cumplidos con sus cuotas, siendo fieles clientes, y sacando provecho de cada uno de los créditos solicitados, por sexta vez se encuentran solicitando crédito para el desarrollo de sus negocios. Quien los coordina es Doña Mayra de 27 años, casada y con 2 hijos, uno de 10 años y su bebe de 15 meses, quien tiene un taller de zapatería donde artesanalmente elaboran sandalias y zapatos colegiales. Ahora con el crédito invertirá en materia prima como pega amarilla, blanca, suelas, fibras, royal y eva. Para así seguir manteniendo la producción de manera eficaz. 
Las demás socias son María, de 44 años quien se dedica a  la venta de cosechas y también prepara y vende nacatamales. Nelson de 27 años se dedica a la venta de especies.
texts.en:
The group "La Hermita" has demonstrated to be a responsible group making all their payments. They are loyal clients and have taken advantage of each requested loan. For the sixth time, the group is requesting a loan to develop their businesses.

Mayra is coordinating the loan request. She is 27 years old and married with 2 children, the youngest is 10 years old and her baby is 15 months old. Mayra has a shoe workshop where she handcrafts sandals and school shoes.

She will invest the loan in raw materials such as yellow and white glue, soles, fiber, Royal fabric, and EVA rubber to efficiently continue production.

The remainder members of the group are María, age 44, who sells crops and also prepares and sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales], and Nelson, age 27, who sells condiments.

loans.use: invest in raw material such as yellow and white glue, soles, fiber, Royal fabric, and EVA rubber.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Jovita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Jovita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice grains to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Laura Patricia

texts.en:
Laura Patricia is a single mother with one son, age 14, and one daughter, age 12. She started her butcher shop 15 years ago, investing all her savings into it, and little by little her business gained more clients and grew. 'Paty' works arduously at her butcher shop, which is located in Progreso, in the state of Yucatán, in order to provide the necessities for her children, so that they will have the chance to study and create a better quality of life.

At present the whole family works together in the butcher shop. The number of customers has grown, and for that reason Paty needs a loan in the amount of $750.00, which she will use to buy meat and vegetables to vary her stock and offer greater variety and better service to her customers. You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Your assistance will be a great help to this family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng Y. is 45 years old and lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their 4 children.  Cheng Y.'s children work at a local garment factory, and her husband is a chef for wedding ceremonies.  She owns a small grocery stand and can earn about $2/day in profits.  This loan will be used to purchase more grocery products and also to repair their home from leaking during the rainy season.  In the future, she would like to increase her grocery inventory and send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: "I hope to buy a refrigerator to enable me sell cooled drinks and  water," says Mrs. Susan E., who lives in Ofumwengbe in Benin City. She is married with 3 children and is 35 years old. She has 3 years' experience in running her business.

loans.use: Purchase of fridge and provisions

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Mr. Rafael is a low income vulnerable person. He is 38 and married with three children. He lives in Saatli town, which is in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan, in the Caucasus region.

Rafael owns and operates a mini shop in Saatli. He sells spare parts, oil, and other supplies for cars. But, as you see in the picture, the working capital he has is very limited; he has no opportunity to diversify his assortment. For this purpose he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch and now is waiting to receive a $400 loan.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Zoila Belinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Zoila is 44 years old and lives in Puerto Malabrigo in the District of Rázuri in the Province of Ascope in the Department of La Libertad. She studied in secondary school until the age of 15. Mrs. Zoila has five children, four of whom are young and depend on her.

She became a widow a few years ago and lives alone with her children, at this time she was given S/. 150.00 from her brother and used this to purchase artificial flowers and ceramic flowers to sell as a traveling salesperson in her community. She uses her profits to nourish her children.

She found out that Manuela Ramos was providing loans to women in her community she decided to form her own group called "Malabrigo" and with the first loan of S/. 300.00 (approximately $100) she purchased decorations, plus toys/stuffed animals, and kitchen utensils which she sold door to door. Additionally. Ms. Zoila also sells food: ceviche, cotton candy, rice with milk (arroz con leche) and others.

With these profits she is saving, plus the last loan she received from Manueal Ramos of S/. 500 (approximately $167) which will be repaid in 4 months, she travelled to Lima to purchase deocrations, toys and clothes at more afforadable procies and in this way she can have more products.

Mrs. Zoila's dream is to set up a 'bazar' or type of shop in her house and to provide an education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zoila tiene 44 años de edad y vive en el Puerto Malabrigo en el Distrito de Rázuri de la Provincia de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad. Estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria. La señora Zoila tiene cinco hijos, cuatro menores de edad que dependen de ella. Hace algunos años enviudó y quedó sola con sus hijos, en ese momento recibió una propina de S/. 150.00 de su hermano y con ese dinero compró flores artificiales y floreros de cerámica para vender como ambulante en su comunidad, con lo que ganaba alimentaba a sus hijos. Al enterarse que Manuela Ramos estaba atendiendo con préstamos a mujeres de su comunidad decide formar su Grupo Mientras Tanto “Malabrigo” y con el primer préstamo que recibe de S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $100) compra adornos, peluches y utensilios de cocina para luego vender de puerta en puerta. Adicionalmente la señora Zoila también vende comida: cebiche, papa a la huancaína, arroz con leche y otros. Con las ganancias que fue guardando, más el último préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500 (aproximadamente $167) el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, viajó a Lima para comprar adornos, juguetes y ropa a precios más cómodos y así pueda tener mayores utilidades. La señora Zoila sueña con implementar un bazar en su casa y con darle educación superior a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase decorations, toys and clothing

loans.name: Javhar

texts.ru:
Javhar R. is 42, has a high school education, is married and has two sons. Javhar sells national items on the market in the city of Kurgan-Tjube. The market is called "Atush." She has been working in this business for the past 6 years. She is one of the few people in the region selling national items that are used in traditional rituals such as marriage, birth of a sun etc. With the obtained loan she plans to increase the variety of goods she has for sale. In this manner she will allow the locals to acquire the necessary items to conduct traditional national rituals. She plans to repay the loan withing 12 months

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Расулова Джавхар, возраст – 42 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 2 сыновей. Джавхар занимется продажей национальных вещей на рынке города Курган-Тюбе под названием «Атуш». Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 6 лет. Она является одним из немногих предпринимателей, которые занимаются продажей местным жителям продукции предназначенной для проведение национальных обычаев, таких как свадьба, рождение сына и т.д. На полученный кредит она планирует закупить новый ассортимент товра. Таким образом она даст возможность местным жителям приобретать необходимые товары для проведения национальных обрядов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: increase the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Pašana

texts.en: Pašana K. was born in 1963. She is widow and lives with her son who is studying. She has daughter who is married. She does not have any income except her husband's pension.This is her first loan in the amount of 600 KM. With this loan she intends to buy poultry and stock food and to begin poultry breeding. She believes that  she will earn some extra money and help her son to finish his studies.

loans.use: Buying poultry and stock food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve the appearance of his restaurant

loans.name: Azama

texts.en:
Mr. Azama K. is 28 years old, married, and the father of 1 child. He has been selling cement since 2004. His store is located in the central market of Aventonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Mr. Azama hopes to use his loan to buy 10 tons of cement to satisfy the needs of his clientele, which is increasing, as the popularity of the market in Aventonou brings more tourists and therefore more vendors to the small village. His sales of new concrete will allow him to increase his profits and to take care of his family. Mr. Azama is a good client, as he paid back his previous loan regularly and on time.

Monsieur Azama K. est âgé de 28 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il est revendeur de ciment depuis 2004. Son magasin est situé au grand marché d'Avetonou, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Azama souhaite, avec ce crédit, acheter 10 tonnes de ciments pour satisfaire aux besoins de la clientèle étant donné que ce village est une zone touristique qui attire plusieurs personnes à y construire d’où la demande très forte en ciments. Ces ventes lui permettront d’augmenter ses profits et de subvenir décemment aux charges de sa famille. Monsieur Azama est un bon client puisqu’il a pu remboursé à temps l’emprunt qu’il a contracté.

loans.use: To buy 10 tons of cement

loans.name: Sadika

texts.en: Sadika is from a small village, Čubrić, near the town of Banovići. She is divorced  and she has 3 children  ranging from 15-27 years old. She has a full-time job and she works at a coal mine. Her monthly salary is  400 KM (about US$ 320). This is her first  loan at MCO WWI in the amount of  US$ 825. Sadika is going to buy feed for her goats which represent  her additional source of income. She will also buy  compost and seeds for sowing. She wants to increase income for her children and herself.

loans.use: To buy feed for goats

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: Isoken O. is a hair stylist. She is single and twenty-seven years old. She creates various hair styles for people in her community. This business has been profitable for her. She has been in it since 2003. She learned the business for a year before starting her own business.  She is also a LAPO client. She needs a loan of $875 to buy clothes and start selling clothes in her community as an additional business.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for sales

loans.name: Urmila

texts.en:
Mrs. Urmila S. is a tailor in the village of Bhatkepati, located in Kathmandu district. The majority of people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. S. lives in a joint family home with her husband, mother-in-law and two daughters. Her husband Mr. Krishna S. is a farmer in Bhatkepati. Both of her daughters are studying in primary school.

S. is a tailor. Tailoring work is the traditional work for their family. She makes different verities of dresses for both ladies and gents. She especially prefers to make ladies' dresses. Now she is requesting for a Rs 10000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her work. She uses her earnings to provide better education for her daughters.

loans.use: Urmila would like to buy raw materials for her work as a tailor.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, 42 years old, is single and lives in a small village in the South of Lebanon. Linda is a dress designer. She needs a loan of US$500 to purchase a new sewing machine in order to expand her business, which she has named Al Rabih (Arabic: Spring).

Linda has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for three cycles and always repays her loans on time.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Marietha is a thirty-five-year-old married mother from Dar es Salaam. She has four children between the ages of eight and eighteen. Marietha runs a small store from which she sells essential grocery items in Dar es Salaam.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Marietha started her stall in 2006 and she has been earning monthly profits of US$ 100 from it since. She is requesting a loan of US$ 275 in order to purchase additional stocks of vegetables in bulk. She intends to retail these for a profit and hopefully increase the quantity and range of her products in the future.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
Hector M. V. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

El señor Héctor M. V. es un joven soltero que desea independizarse y empezar su propio camino sin sus padres, el quiere hacer desde este momento un patrimonio para cuando el desee formar una familia ya tengan un establecimiento donde vivir. Hector solicita la cantidad de 300 dolares.

El trabaja en un maquiladora y con estos ingresos va a poder pagar el préstamo recibido.
texts.en:
Hector M. V. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Héctor M. V. is a young single man who wishes to become independent and begin his own path without his parents. Today he wants to build a home so that when he wishes to have a family they will have an established place to live. Hector is asking for $300 dollars. He works in a factory and with these earnings he is going to be able to pay the loan he receives.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire a house

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly K., 48, is a true entrepreneur who sells fish in the village market. Living in Kampong Cham, she is able to make around US$4 each day of profit. Her fish come from her husband who is a fisherman. Even though her husband is a fisherman, they need to purchase fish from other fisherman because her husband may not catch enough for resale at the market. The couple has one son who is employed as a car driver with a salary of US$150 each month.

Inflation has played a huge role in the society. The domestic price of rice and fertilizer has doubled over the past year, while the price of meat and fish has increased 30 to 60 percent, according to the government report. This factor was caused by inflation. Most of the employed people get the same pay, while prices keep increasing.

Ly K. is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase a wooden boat, a motor and other fishing nets for her husband to catch more fish for resale. These items will cost around US$600. The remaining funds will be used to open another business and help double the family income.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat, motor and fishing nets.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen I. is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She sells provisions in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She also sells clothes and jewelry. She travels to the North to purchase clothes and jewelry to sell in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more provisions, clothes and jewelry to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe sabali sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames avec une moyenne d’age  de 41 ans et quatre (4) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et résident à sanankoroba (village situé à  25  kilomètres de Bamako la capitale du Mali).

Ayant deja bénéficié de 6 prêts de groupe, elles comptent utiliser le prêt actuel pour s’approvisionner en tubercules et en fruit dans les marchés des villages environnants deux fois par mois pour les révendre en détail au marché de Sanankoroba.

Elles comptent réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 43.000FCFA pour payer les intérêts du prêt et subvénir aux bésoins de leurs familles. Elles espèrent augmenter le montant de leur prêt pour diversifier leurs articles à fin de mieux servir la clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabali are married women living generally in polygamous households and who average 41 years of age and four children. They know one another by ties of community and reside in Sanankoroba (a village located 25 km from Bamako, the capital of Mali).

Having already benefited from six group loans, they intend to use the current loan to get supplies of tubers and fruit at the marketplaces of surrounding villages twice a month. These goods would be resold at the retail level at the Sanankoroba marketplace.

With this loan, they intend to realize an average monthly profit of 43,000 francs CFA to pay their loan interest and to support their families. They hope to have a larger loan amount to diversify their goods in order to serve their customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tubers, fruit, soap, and various items

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a 40 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. He has been selling bread for eight years. Mouhamad is a mobile merchant; he sells bread in a small truck. Mouhamad decided to do his business because he is the first one to do it. He is special because he is the only who sells bread in his village.  He requests a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance on his house. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

loans.use: To do maintenance on his house.

loans.name: Marili

texts.es:
Siendo muy joven,  Marili no tuvo reparos en emprender un negocio. Su principal motivan fue el cuidado de sus dos hijos. Por ellos fue que hace tres años empezó a vender jugos, pero este trabajo le demandaba mucho tiempo y ella en ese entonces tenia que ocuparse de su menor hijo que aun estaba bebe.

Es por ello que decide cambiar su negocio de venta de jugo a la venta de dulces en la puerta de su casa. Hoy ya lleva tres años trabajando con mucho empeño. Gracias a su dedicación ha podido agrandará su negocio y  actualmente no solo vende dulces sino también todo tipo de abarrotes. Hace poco ha logrado poner piso afuera de su casa para poder poner un pequeño carrito donde atiende a sus clientes.

Dentro de sus planes a corto plazo está agrandar el local de su tienda para poder vender mayores productos.
texts.en:
Being very young, Marili didn't have doubts about starting up a business. Her principle motive was the care of her two children. It was for them that three years ago she began to sell juices, but this line of work took up a lot of time and she still had to look after her youngest son who was still a baby at this time. It was for this reason that she decided to change her business and sell sweets from her house door. Today, she has been working for three years with great effort. Thanks to her dedication she has been able to expand her business and now she not only sells sweets but also all sorts of groceries. A short time ago she was able to put down a floor outside her house to construct a small stall where she can attend her customers. Among her short-term plans is a plan to expand her shop site in order to be able to sell more products.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her shop site

loans.name: Shahnaz M. Yaqoob Group
loans.use: To buy materials for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino maneja junto con su esposa una tienda de abarrotes desde hace un par de años. Aunque lleva poco tiempo con los préstamos de  EDAPROSPO Faustino esta dispuesto a seguir creciendo como micro empresario y además de su tienda también participa en ferias de venta  en temporadas festivas. En estas fechas se encuentra vendiendo útiles escolares en una feria en su localidad, ya que en marzo empieza el año escolar en su país.

Por otro lado, en las tardes Faustino trabaja en viveros brindando servicio de mantenimiento. En este trabajo ya lleva más de cinco años. Poco a poco y a medida que transcurra el tiempo el quiere ver su tienda crecer, por lo que necesita continuar invirtiendo en la implementación de su local y aumento de mercadería.

Compra de mercadería
texts.en:
Faustino, together with his wife, has been managing a grocery store for a couple of years. Although he has been borrowing from EDAPROSPO for only a short time, Faustino is ready to continue growing as a small business owner and in addition to his store he also participates in markets set up during festivals and celebrations. These days he sells school supplies at a market in his neighbourhood because the school year starts in March in his country. In addition, in the evenings Faustino works in a nursery, providing maintenance services. He has had this job for more than five years. Slowly and over time he wants to see his store grow, for which he must continue investing in the establishment of his store and in the increase of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Sanu L. lives with her husband, Chakra Bahadur L. and their three children. Her husband is a taxi driver in the Kathmandu valley. Her two daughters are studying in grades nine and three respectively and her son is in primary school.

Sanu opened her small business three years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different food items in her shop. In particular, she makes Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice). She also sells tea and coffee.

The demand for food is increasing in her area, so Sanu is requesting her first loan of Rs15,000 to buy necessary ingredients for her shop.

loans.use: Buy food materials.

loans.name: Pedro Del Rosario

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro del Rosario tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Pedro tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio, 
La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, Don Pedro dio inicio estableciendo la venta de frijoles cocidos, mas tarde con el apoyo de su esposa deciden agregar otro negocio como es la venta de tortillas. Los propósitos de Don Pedro son de predominar con su negocio ya que hay mucha competencia. Por lo que el financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo ya que con esto podrá invertir en materia prima como leña, maíz y frijoles y así podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes sus productos. El deseo de Don Pedro son de aumentar sus ventas para proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Señor Pedro del Rosario is 58 years old and married. Don Pedro has three children and they are all in school. He dedicated his self to this business seventeen years ago.

His business is located in his home. Don Pedro began establishing his self with cooked beans sales. Later with the support of his wife, they decided to add another business, which is the tortilla sales. Don Pedro's goal is for his business to become predominant, since there is a lot of competition. For this purpose, the financing will be used as working capital since he'll be able to invest it in raw materials like firewood, corn, and beans, so that he may offer his products to his clients. Don Pedro's desire is to increase sales to provide his family with what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Laura es separada tiene 59 años, dos hijos de 34 y 39 años.
Ella estudio cosmetología, trabajo en una peluquería por años y hace tres años decido independizarse, actualmente Laura da servicios de corte, tinte, peinados, atiende a domicilio. 
Laura necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para la compra de materiales de peluquería como tintes, líquidos de ondulación, y una secadora.
Desde que esta en Finca, tiene mayor oportunidad para poder invertir, aprendió a manejar mejor el negocio, lleva mejor sus cuentas.
El sueño de Laura es abrir un salón de belleza y spa amplio.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes Microfinance Institute.

Laura is a 59-year-old separated mother of two children, ages 34 and 39. She studied cosmetology. She worked at a hair salon for years, but three years ago, she decided to work for herself. Laura currently provides at-home hair cut, color, and style services.

Laura needs a 1,200.00 PEN loan, which will be used to purchase hairstylist supplies such as hair dye, perm solutions, and a hair dryer.

Ever since she joined Finca, she has had a greater opportunity to invest, and she has learned how to better manage both her business and her accounts.

Laura dreams of opening up her own spacious beauty salon and spa.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hair salon supplies

loans.name: But

texts.en: But S., a 38-year-old mother of six children, all teenagers and attending school, generates her daily income by selling stone with her husband. Purchasing large stone blocks from people who live near the mountains, they break down and carve them into small pieces, finally selling the pieces to people who need them to build their houses. This stone-selling business is the family's main source of income, and But S. is now applying for a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase additional stone blocks for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional stone blocks for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Adelina

texts.es:
La dama Rosa S. se dedica a su negocio de tienda de comestibles ofreciendo diferentes tipos de comestibles livianos como tortas y café. Ella hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos comestibles para continuar en su negocio.

Es de importancia destacar que con el crédito que ella hoy en día solicita, logrará la compra de los comestibles para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Rosa S. has a food business where she offers light options like cakes and coffee. She has turned to Ceprodel to request a credit to buy such food to continue her business. It's important to point out that with the credit that she's requesting, she will be able to purchase the food and sell it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. runs a provisions store. She sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store on the street. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business.

Doris is 26 years old, married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. All are currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso.

Doris is a hardworking woman. She is hoping to improve upon her standard of living and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her crop yield

loans.name: Shahnaz Muhammad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji, the wife of M. H., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for 18 years. Her husband drives an auto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled motor vehicle) and has four years of experience in this profession. Shahnaz baji operates a business sewing clothes. She takes orders from her neighbors and earns income. She uses her income on necessities. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw, because its engine seizes. This loan group consists of four additional people:
  • Kalsoom Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.
  • Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.
  • Salamat baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.
  • Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Shahnaz baji is the first woman on the right side in this photo. Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Dam's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dam Y. is the group leader for five members who all live in Chuos village in Takeo province. She is a vegetable middle-woman in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more vegetables to re-sell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Lin Un, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Dam Y. is 44 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: purchasing more vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
For Irene, who is 25 years old, patience and hard work are both important to becoming successful in life.  She once worked in Kuwait as domestic helper for 5 months. However, she did not become successful there, so she went home for good, and started managing a general store. She is also involved in direct selling. Her ambition to improve both businesses encourages her to request for a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 10,000. 

She is married to Vic A., a tricycle driver. They have one son, Vincent, age 5 who is a nursery school pupil. Five family members live in their home with her parents. She hopes that her business will grow with the support of the Kiva lenders to give her family a satisfying life.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena N. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 62 years old. Magdalena is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Magdalena owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Magdalena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Magdalena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua.
Rufina es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Rufina junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el cual su esposo realiza transporte de pasajeros, Rufina tiene proyectado implementar un restaurante, pues su esposo sabe cocinar.
Rufina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sillas y platos.
Los sueños de Rufina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un restaurante grande.

loans.use: Para la compra de sillas y platos.

loans.name: Jamilatu

texts.en:
Jamilatu is 40 years old and married with six children, who are all in school. She owns and operates a grocery store, selling items such as rice, evaporated milk, canned food and drink, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soap, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market.

Jamilatu wants to use her loan to buy a bulk supply of rice, canned food and drink, milk, assorted spices, washing soap and powder etc. to expand her business. She hopes to make a good income from her expanded business in order to provide her children with a good quality education.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en: Oussama is a taxi driver, and he supports his family with this business. He has been involved in this work for six years.  Oussama is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay for maintenance and repairs for his taxi.

loans.use: For maintenance and repairs for his taxi

loans.name: Yris

texts.es:
Yris tiene 43 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo (Manuel), de 44 años, quien es vendedor, y con sus 3 hijas: María de 18, Carla de 14 y Eduardo de 7 añitos de edad.

Su negocio es la venta de joyería, la cual elabora ella misma en su vivienda y gracias a sus conocimientos de bisutería. Yris realiza bonitos modelos, los cuales distribuye por pedidos, pero actualmente viene trabajando en unos lindos bonsáis navideños, lo cuales son muy solicitados en estas fechas, ya que estamos próximos a la navidad. 
A Yris le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque puede manifestar toda su creatividad  y crear bonitas joyas y diseños para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se promete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mostacillas, alambres y otros materiales para cubrir todos los pedidos que le hicieron de estos adornos navideños.
texts.en:
Yris is 43 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband Manuel, who is a 44-year old salesman, and their three children: Maria (18), Carla (14) and Eduardo (7). They have a jewelry business; she makes the jewelry in their home, thanks to her knowledge of jewelry-making. Yris makes pretty models which are distributed through orders, but currently she is working on some beautiful Christmas bonsai trees, which are often requested during this time of year as we are getting closer to Christmas. Yris likes her job very much, because she can express all of her creativity and create pretty pieces of jewelry and designs to satisfy the demands of her customers. This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to be on time with all of her payments. With the money that she is requesting she will buy a large quantity of beads, wires and other materials in order to make up all of her orders for these Christmas decorations.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: materials to make jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and expand her arable area

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: K. Yvette vit depuis 45 ans au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à M’GBAVADE Germain, un couturier, Yvette est mère de deux enfants, dont un est à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Yvette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Yvette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a 10 ans environs que Yvette mène comme activité, la vente de chaussure de façon ambulante. Yvette vend également de la nourriture à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Yvette s’approvisionne. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Yvette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever davantage le niveau de son activité, et de se faire une épargne.
texts.en:
Yvette K. has lived for 45 years in the district of Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to a dressmaker, Germain M'Gbavade, Yvette is the mother of two children, one of which lives in her care. Both of her children attend school. Yvette lives with her children and husband. The couple shares the family expenses. Yvette did not attend school. For approximately the last 10 years, Yvette has sold shoes door-to-door. Yvette also sells food from her home. Yvette gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is an old client of ALIDé and has repaid her previous loans. Yvette is requesting a third loan from ALIDé in order to increase her business and to earn some savings.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of shoes for resale

loans.name: Melva Aidee

texts.es:
La señora Melva es otra de las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias en la ciudad de Portoviejo, ya son 11 ciclos los que lleva en la Fundación, vive con su  hijo  ya que se separo de su esposo  y es él quien la acompaña  en casa y en su negocio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace cinco años,  recorre junto a su hijo en una moto para comprar por libras  la pesca  a los mayoristas en el  balneario de Crucita  a  media hora de la ciudad de Portoviejo, invierte un aproximado de 200 dólares en cada adquisición de igual manera  salen todos los días a vender y calcula que diario le quedan libre de ganancias 40 dólares;  con este nuevo préstamo solicitado Melva comprará pescado que se vende más en ésta época del año y  tener un suficiente stock para sus clientes. 

Uno de sus sueños es  poder tener su casa propia
texts.en:
Melva is another member of the Mujeres Solidarias communal bank, which is in its 11th loan cycle with the Fundación. She is separated from her husband and lives with her son, who is her companion at home and at work. She has sold fish for the last 5 years. She and her son drive to buy pounds of fish from wholesalers in the seaside resort of Crucita, which is half-an-hour away from the city of Portoviejo. She invests about 200 dollars in each purchase which they go out daily to sell. She figures that her daily profits are 40 dollars. Melva will use this new loan to buy fish which is the best seller during this season and have sufficient stock available for her customers. One of her dreams is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita D. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Lolita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita has a retail store from which she sells seafood products, such as fish and shrimp, in her local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
La Srta. Mariela Baéz es de la ciudad de Roque Gonzalez, soltera estudiante universitaria, está cursando el 6to.curso de la Carrera de Derecho en la Universidad  Nacional, es huérfana de padre, actualmente vive con su madre.

   Mariela manifiesta que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar ya que su madre tuvo que solventar sus gastos y la de sus hermanas, se dedicó a la actividad de vendedora ambulante realizando inicialmente en su ciudad de Carapegua, luego empezó a viajar con su  madre en la cuidad de Lambaré y actualmente ya cuenta con clientela formada en ambas ciudades con gran cantidad de pedidos lo que la llevó a la necesidad de contar con más capital.

  Solicitó el préstamo con nuestra entidad  para la compra de artículos de mercería.
texts.en:
Miss Mariela Baéz is from the city of Roque Gonzalez. She is single and a university student. She is in the sixth semester in Law School at the National University. She lost her father, and lives with her mother. Mariela developed very young when she began to work, since her mother had to take care of the expenses for her and her sisters. She worked as a street vendor starting first in her city, Carapegua. She then began to travel with her mother to another city, Lambaré, and she now has customers in both cities with many orders. Thus she needs to have more capital. She requested a loan from our agency to buy articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dresses, t-shirts, shirts, skirts, blouses, shoes, sneakers and more

loans.name: Delia Filomena

texts.es: Delia Filomena H. M. tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la comercialización de chiverías, gaseosas, dulces pero con el tiempo y los préstamos fue mejorando el negocio con la compra de mayor variedad de productos. Actualmente esta señora de 51 años  invertirá en  granos básicos, carne, embutidos, enlatados, refrescos etc.… ya que estos son productos muy buscados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Delia Filomena H. M. runs a small grocery store. She started out by selling dairy products, soft drinks and sweets, but over time and with the help of loans, she has gradually expanded her business by stocking a greater variety of products. Currently, this 51-year-old woman will invest in bulk grains and beans, meat, sausages, canned foods, soft drinks, etc., since these products are very popular with her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bulk grains and beans, meat, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Sylvanous

texts.en:
Sylvanous owns a boutique where he sells shirts to make a living. He loves this business because he makes his customers look good. He is an honest and hardworking man. He hopes to open another boutique before the end of this year.

Sylvanous is 32 years old and is married with a child who is five years old and attends school.

Sylvanous is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more shirts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is widowed with six children. All of her children have finished school. She owns a four-room house where she stays with three people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Imelda takes care of grandchildren who go to school.  The family gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. Imelda owns a restaurant in Kitawuluzi where she serves all types of food ranging from traditional to snacks like chips and soft drinks. She works seven days a week. Imelda receives at least 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at retail. Besides this restaurant business, she also sells second hand clothes in a nearby shop and has a stall of food and vegetables.

 Imelda has been in this business for 30 years prior to this business she was a and her business challenges include seasonality. Imelda has been with MCDT for eight years, servicing her 26th loan.  She wants to use this loan to increase her stock of food for the restaurant, to buy crates of soda and boxes of Safi, mineral water and splash,  and to buy second hand clothes.  She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start a fully refurnished hotel.

She was supposed to get the loan on 18/03/10 but got it on 19/03/10 because of pre-Agm (pre- Annual General meeting)

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs, drinks and  other items.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
