Caridad B., 67, is from the village of Upper Lamac Oroquieta City where she is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Caridad owns and operates a tailoring business that provides clothing alteration and tailoring services in the local community. Caridad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Caridad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan, her 10th, of 6000 PHP which will be used to further invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 12 años se dedica a vender artículos de limpieza para el hogar, actividad que también realizan sus hijos de manera ambulante en las ferias comerciales de su ciudad, una manera de apoyarla en el trabajo. Es así que ínter diario salen a vender estos productos, y más cuando son fechas festivas, que es cuando tiene mayor demanda. Ella disfruta mucho su trabajo, ya que las ganancias que recibe son la recompensa al arduo trabajo que tuvo día tras día, soportando los días soleados o de lluvia. Es por ello que desea tener un puesto de venta e incrementar su capital de trabajo. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto será muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Susy, 35, lives with her 2 children in the house of her parents. For more than 12 years, she has made a living selling home cleaning products, work that her children also now do. They work as street vendors in various markets around their city. Susy goes out every day to sell these products and she works even harder on holidays because that is when demand is greatest. She likes her work very much and the money she makes is the reward for the difficult job that she has to do day after day, rain or shine. It's for this business that she would like to have a kiosk and additional working capital. This is her third MFP loan and she has shown that she will be responsible about repaying it. This support will be very helpful to the progress of her business. She will use the loan to buy merchandise so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr:
Née le 28 Février 1984 à Sikasso ville, Madame  Catherine D.  est mariée, mère de 3 enfants et réside dans une  grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Banconi, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de 7 ans au petit commerce notamment  à l’achat-vente des pagnes wax, de tissus brodés, de chaussures en plastiques, etc. 
Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle surtout pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel. 
Elle  sollicite ce 4ème prêt pour acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes wax, 4 complets de tissus brodés, des dizaines de paires de chaussures en plastiques en provenance de Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso)
Ces marchandises sont vendues de façon ambulante, dans les structures professionnelles et à domicile  à une clientele diverse et variée.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born 28 February 1984 in Sikasso, Mrs. Catherine D. is married, the mother of three children and lives in a traditional extended family in Banconi, one of the boroughs on the outskirts of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After attempting several unsuccessful activities, she ventured into retail commerce some seven years ago selling pagnes wax (a variety of colourful West-African fabric), embroidery, plastic shoes, etc. She is in high demand because of the quality of her products. Wanting to satisfy an ever-increasing number of customers, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, where she is requesting a fourth individual loan. With this loan she will buy 10 lengths of pagne wax fabric, four sets of embroidered clothing, dozens of plastic shoes coming from Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). She sells her products as an itinerant vendor, in commercial structures or through home delivery, to a varied customer base. She hopes this loan will help her attain monthly earnings of 100,000 FCFA which she will use essentially to increase her working capital, contribute to family expenses and reimburse her loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sitha C. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Deth Sam, live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1980 and have two daughters. Both daughters are married, but one lives outside the family home.

Mrs. Sitha C. has been selling vegetables and pork in front of her house for more than two years. Besides this business, she also supplements her income with new silk weavings to earn extra income to support her family. Her husband has been a house builder for more than five years.  

Sitha is asking for her second loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Aime Gilbert

texts.en:
S. B. Aime Gibert is the 41-year-old owner of a small clothes store in Marche Moungali. He is the father to three children between the ages of 4 and 13 and is happily married. 

He started the sales of men's clothing in 1994 with $300 and gradually began to add women's clothing for sale as well. His challenge sometimes is keeping enough merchandise in stock. This loan will help with having enough stock. 

He wants to grow his business and be able to provide for his family and provide his children with a better education.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (shirts and pants) in bulk

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the Keen Ventures group of Faulu Kenya. She has been doing outside catering for ten years and, in addition, she grows tea and maize for commercial purposes. She was previously employed but went into business so as to earn more income for her family.

Veronica has requested Kes 40,000 to buy more ingredients for preparing food. Veronica, who is widowed, hopes to grow her business so as to provide a better education for her six children. She describes herself as hardworking and aggressive.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung Cagayan. She is 59 years old and a widow with five adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately $110 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, sus 3 hijos y su padre. La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa casual a sus amigos y familiares y  los fines de semana  disponen de su tiempo para vender tamales (platillo típico de Lima). Muy temprano por la mañana realiza sus compras, y en seguida lava las hojas, en la que envuelve los tamales. Le gusta su  trabajo, puesto que tiene mucha acogida por parte de sus clientes, por tanto es que Raquel trabaja en compañía de su familia, mientra ella hace el aderezo su esposo muele el maíz. Más adelante quiere poner reja a su puerta, para la seguridad de su casa y de su negocio. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas, como lo estuvo haciendo, puesto que sabe que le es de mucha utilidad para el progreso de su negocio. Con este crédito que solicita, renovar sus utensilios de cocina, para continuar con la venta de tamales, además comprar más prendas de vestir para su negocio.
texts.en:
Raquel is 40 years old. She is a very hard working Mom. She lives in her own house together with her husband, their 3 children and her father. She sells casual clothing to her friends and family and on the weekends she sells tamales (a popular dish in Lima). In the very early in the morning she goes shopping and then she washes the corn husks that will hold the tamales. She enjoys her work, especially because her business is very well patronized by her clients. Raquel works alongside her family. While she makes the sauce her husband mills the corn. In the future she hopes to install a gate at her door, to make her house and business safe. She is committed to the obligations of this loan, as she always has. She knows that these loans key to the progress of her business. With this loan she will purchase new kitchen tools so that she may continue making tamales. She would also like to have more table cloths to dress up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr:
Madame Maguette B. est une femme mariée de 39 ans. Elle habite dans le quartier de Ndeungagne  à Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 8 et 18 ans.
Madame B. a choisi l’activité de commerce par le biais de sa mère dans le but de réaliser des bénéfices. Ainsi elle s’active depuis plus de 20 ans dans la vente de poissons à la plage de Yoff. Auparavant elle exerçait  son activité au marché tilène. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis novembre 2003. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs qui sera utilisé pour l’achat de poissons destinés a la vente. Son objectif est d’améliorer le cadre  de vie sociale de sa famille avec l’augmentation de ses revenus.
texts.en:
Ms. Maguette B. is a 39-year-old married woman.  She lives in the Ndeungagne district in Yoff.  She is a mother of eight children who are between 8 and 18 years old.  Maguette chose commerce through her mother with the goal of earning money.  Thus, she has been active for over twenty years in selling fish at the beach of Yoff.  In the past, she used to operate her business at the Tilène market. Maguette has been an associate of the Yoff branch since November 2003.  She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs that will be used for buying fish to be sold.  Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions by increasing her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes es una pequeña comerciante, vende comida. Son 15 años en las ventas pues ha hecho su medio de sobrevivencia, ella sale a vender sus deliciosos platillos todos los días en su vivienda. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, carne, pollo, frutas y verduras para lograr aumentar las ventas para mejorar su economía, ya que muchas veces vende poco y pierde lo que se descapitaliza, y no cuenta con dinero para invertir más. Es una mujer que ha logrado mejorar cada día sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is a small business owner. She sells prepared foods. She has had 15 years experience in this field and it has been her livelihood. She sells her delicious food every day from her home. With this loan she will purchase basic grains, meats, chicken, fruits and vegetables. She will be able to increase her sales and improve her finances. She often her sales are small and it impacts her capital, no longer being able to reinvest in the business. She is a woman that has managed to improve her earnings every day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr:
Agée de 45ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant de 14ans .Elle est dans la vente des chaussures pour enfants en 1993  avec un capital de 18500f.
Par jour elle vend 10000f et 30000f selon les périodes.
Le prêt va lui permettre d’augmenter le stock de sa marchandise en achetant : les baskets, baby boots, pour fillettes, les bottes sandales pour garçons et filles.
Le choix dans la qualité de marchandises, la recherche des articles à la mode, faire des soldes à la fin de chaque période ou  revoir les prix à la baisse  sont ses stratégies de vente.
Elle veut générer beaucoup de bénéfices et devenir importateur car ouvrir une boutique de ventes des chaussures  pour enfants.
Dans son milieu de vie, elle est  considérer comme une femme courageuse parce qu’elle améliore et s’occupe de la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
Ms. Yolande B. M. is 45 years old, unmarried, and has one child, aged 14. She began a business selling children's footwear in 1993, with a working capital of 18,500 F. On a daily basis, she sells between 10,000 F and 30,000 F worth of shoes, depending on the time of year. This loan will allow her to increase her stock of merchandise by buying sneakers, baby boots for girls, and sandals for boys and girls. Her sales strategies involve choosing good quality merchandise, researching the latest fashions, and settling her accounts at the end of each cycle or reviewing her price reductions. She wants to generate large profits and become an importer in order to open a shop selling children's shoes. Being middle aged, she is considered a courageous woman for improving herself and taking care of her child's education.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's shoes such as baby boots, sandals, and sneakers.

loans.name: Amour Divin Group

texts.en:
Ronald L. is the coordinator of his group Amour Divin or “Divine Love”. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and 1 year old daughter. He says that his moS.difficult challenges are merchandise transport from his house to the local market.

Ronald L. is excited to be taking his 3rd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loans and growing his business. He plans to use this loan to inveS.in his food stall. He will use the profits in the future to build a home for himself and his family.  In the meantime he plans to continue enjoying growing his business and singing in his church’s men’s choir.
 This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients generally. His group is located in Trou du Nord. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of Haiti suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Purchase cookies, candies, canned milk for sale

loans.name: Burenjargal

texts.en:
Burenjargal D. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent.  His two children, ages 16 and 14, both attend a local high school and his oldest daughter, age 21, attends university.

Burenjargal operates a grocery business next to his home with the help of his wife. In the beginning, he started selling a limited variety of food stuffs in his small kiosk in 2002, and has since managed to open his own grocery shop. With his grocery business profit, Burenjargal was able not only to improve his family's quality of life, but also to pay his son's tuition fees. He would like to one day own a bigger grocery store, where he can sell a larger variety of goods that will attract many more customers. His wife is responsible for managing the grocery shop, while he uses his car to drive a taxi to supplement his family income. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan so that he can purchase a larger variety of products to sell at his grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of products.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta L. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Violeta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana D. is a married woman who lives in Cordova, Brgy. Cogon, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business venture: a vegetable vending  business.  Her husband Wensislao D., who is 47 years old, helps his wife in running the business. They have 5 children who are 7 to 23 years old. 

Luciana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luciana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future and expand her business.  Luciana D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna L., 31, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Lambert L., a computer technician, and together they have an elementary-aged kid staying at home managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Lorna has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Lorna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at a wholesale price and selling at piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lorna hopes that business will improve and pick up soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mr. Thai H. (shown in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Sakhorn Sbaung, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple is old, but they are still strong enough to work. 

Mr.Thai H. and his wife are rice and lotus farmers. Farming is the main business to support their standard of living. They hope to continue the business by purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm. Therefore, Thai is applying for another loan in the amount of $500.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Estrilla

texts.en:
Estrilla Q. is from the village of farmington tampilisan Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 63 years old. Estrilla is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Estrilla owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling soft drinks in the local community. Estrilla has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estrilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Estrilla is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Estrilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fabrice

texts.fr:
Homme de 33ans célibataire et père d’un enfant âgée de 5ans. Ayant un niveau universitaire et n’ayant pu décrocher du travail, et ayant 3 personnes en charge, il se lança dans le commerce de vente de tissus en 2003 avec un capital de 200000frs. Sa recette journalière est de 25000 à 70000frs.Ayant fini le premier cycle avec succès, avec ce second prêt il compte acheter des différentes qualités de tissus de cérémonie, de soie, de super 100 et d’autres tissus de première marque dont la demande est forte.  
Il use de beaucoup de stratégies pour épargner, attirer sa clientèle, et présenter les meilleurs prix a ses potentiels clients et ceux en dépit de la hausse des marchandises sur le marché.
 
Le prêt précédent lui a permis d’avoir un second étalage dans le marché. Les conditions de vie de sa famille s’améliorent de jours en jours.
texts.en:
This man is 33 years old, single, and has a 5-year-old child. Unable to find work despite having a university degree and with three people in his care, he started selling fabrics in 2003 with a capital of 200,000 frs. His daily revenue varies from 25,000 to 70,000 frs. He completed a first loan cycle successfully and plans to use this second loan to buy various grades of ceremonial fabrics, silk, super 100 and other top brand fabrics in high demand. 

He has a strategic approach to saving money, attracting clients, and offering the best prices to his customers despite the higher cost of the merchandise on the market.

The previous loan had allowed him to have a second booth at the market. The living conditions of his family are improving steadily.

loans.use: To buy bolts of ceremonial fabrics, satin, denim, velvet, wild silk and poplin

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 36 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio de 36 años y sus 2 queridos hijos George de 12 y Juan de 8 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Norma ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, café y plátano, los cuales los comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced, donde los vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta La Merced, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
36-year old Norma is a friendly, hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her 36-year old husband Julio and their two much-loved children George (12) and Juan (8). She wishes to provide them with a better standard of living.

By working hard Norma has managed to make her fields more productive. She grows coffee and bananas which she sells wholesale in the town of La Merced.

Her farm has provided the income necessary to support the household so she wishes to put all her earnings into improving the business. She most enjoys caring for her crops, a job she’s been doing for ten years. The most difficult part of the work is transporting the produce to La Merced as the bags are heavy and make her tired.

In the future Norma would like to buy more land and increase production. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She has always been very punctual with the repayments on her previous loans and expects to be the same this time. She is an active member of the community bank, always in agreement with what the group decides.  With the loan money she plans to buy more fertilizer and insecticide to use on her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Miriam Margarita

texts.es: Miriam Margarita A. C., reside en el municipio de Ilopango, en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Miriam es una señora muy responsable y dedicada a su hogar, quien posee su propio negocio, en el que se encarga de elaborar pupusas, platillo típico salvadoreño, el cual posee una gran demanda por ser el platillo más famoso del país. Miriam trabaja de lunes a domingo, elaborando las pupusas que son hechas de masa de maíz o de arroz, la cual se revuelve con queso, chicharrón y queso. Debido al excelente sabor, Miriam cuenta  con muchos clientes, lo que desea aprovechar, por lo que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima y de esta forma elaborar mayor cantidad de pupusas y así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Miriam Margarita A. C. lives in the municipality of Ilopango in the department of San Salvador with her husband and two children who attend school. Miriam is a very responsible woman and dedicated to her family. She has her own business making pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish) which is in great demand as it is the most famous dish in the country.

Miriam works seven days a week making the pupusas from a dough made of maize flour or rice which is stuffed with cheese or pork. Because of their delicious flavour, she has many customers so Miriam wishes to buy more ingredients with the loan money. This way she can make more pupusas and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pupusas

loans.name: Vedi

texts.en:
Vedi is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. He has operated his business of construction supplies and building of residential houses for the last year. 

Vedi faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing construction materials in his business. With the 20,000 KES he is requesting, he wants to purchase materials to finish up building of residential houses. He dreams of expanding and constructing many residential houses in the future. Vedi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to finish building residential houses

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Neema K., who is in her mid-thirties, is married with two children.  She has been running a cafe for two years.  She works from 7.00am to 6.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Neema's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan to purchase missing food items for her cafe.  Her dream is to one day own a good restaurant.

Neema will share this loan with her loan group "Waefeso" which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Neema is the tallest in a black blouse,1st from right, back row.

loans.use: To purchase missing items for her cafe.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma forma parte del banco comunal “Lonko-Domo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante, desde hace 4 años. Vende productos de paquetería, específicamente; pañuelos, cortinas, manteles, paños de cocina y artículos para decorar una casa. Norma trabaja de lunes a sábado, recorriendo los domicilios de sus clientes frecuentes, que son muchos. Ya que Norma brinda facilidades de pago a sus clientes y utiliza un trato afable, lo que ha generado vínculos de amistad entre su clientela. Actualmente está incorporando a su negocio la venta de ropa de invierno, rubro que genera mejores ganancias.
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en una importadora y la ropa en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el préstamo comprará mercadería específicamente; ropa y productos de paquetería. 
Las motivaciones de Norma de continuar con el negocio, se deben a que le gusta lo que realiza, no sólo vender, sino que también tener contacto con las personas, tener un trato más cercano y empático con su clientela. 
Su sueño es tener un gran capital con el cual pueda invertir y comprar más mercadería, así con esto obtener mayores ganancias y tener una vida más confortable y tranquila. 
Norma vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 23 y 19 años de edad.
Para Norma Fondo esperanza ha significado una gran ayuda para su vida y negocio, por lo que está muy contenta y agradecida de participar. Ella también asiste a las reuniones, en las cuales disfruta mucho, además ha aprendido a manejar y organizar mejor su negocio.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Norma is part of the “Lonko-Domo” communal bank belonging to the city of Temuco.  She’s been a street vendor for four years.  She sells home goods, specifically, handkerchiefs, curtains, tablecloths, napkins and home decoration articles.  Norma works Monday through Saturday visiting homes of her customers, who are numerous, because Norma gives them easy payment plans and treats them kindly; this has led to bonds of friendship among her customers.  She is currently incorporating the sale of winter clothes into her business, a line that generates better profits.  She usually buys her merchandise from an importer and she buys the clothes in the city of Santiago.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise, specifically clothes and home use items.  Norma’s motivation to stay in business is that she enjoys what she does, not only selling, but also having contact with people and having a close, empathetic relationship with her clientele.

Her dream is to have a large capital to invest and buy more merchandise so that she can earn higher profits and have a more tranquil and comfortable life.  Norma lives with her husband and two children who are 23 and 19 years old.

For Norma, Fondo Esperanza has meant a great help for her life and business which makes her happy and grateful to participate.  She attends the meetings which she enjoys very much.  Besides, she’s learned to manage and better organize her business.

Temuco is the capital of the La Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  In its surroundings are a series of lakeside spas (Pucón, Villarica) and a showy native flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.   It’s worth stressing that 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous people existing in our country, lives in this region.

loans.use: to buy clothes and home goods.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 13 years, she has operated a business selling charcoal and kikois. She sells these items as retail from her home to neighbors and passersby. A major challenge Mwanahamisi faces in her business is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting, she wants to purchase five sacks of charcoal and bundles of kikois to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of charcoal and bundles of kikois to sell

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is from the village of Barangay 5, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 52 years old. Nestor is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing tri-sikad or mechanical tricycle services to local community members. He is also planting and harvesting rubber trees seasonally. Nestor has been engaged in his business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately $280 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nestor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. 

He is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be his 4th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 37 years old and married. She is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She primarily grows rice to sell. Gemma raises her pigs in her backyard. She plans to use her loan to buy piglets, pig feed and farm supplies. Gemma works hard to support her family. She hopes to have an abundant harvest. She also hopes to expand her piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, pig feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 55-year-old widow.  She has two children whom she supports.  Margaret runs a cosmetics shop in Kisauni, Mombasa and her business has been in operation for six years.

Margaret has been good client of Kiva partner KADET LTD.  This is her second loan to finance her business.  She will use this loan to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.  Margaret will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and meet her family’s needs.  Her dream is to live a happy life and see her children live the best possible lives that she can provide.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Noudjiou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUDJIOU est composé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léontine est celle qui à la main levée sur la photo. Léontine est née le 03 Avril 1963 au Bénin et est mariée à un certain Ambroise. Le couple cinq enfants, tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Léontine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,  Léontine vend des fruits et légumes depuis une trentaine d'année. Léontine s’approvisionne dans un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Léontine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NOUDJIOU , un premier  crédit.
texts.en: The NOUDJIOU group consists of three people who are friends.  The group representative, named Leontine, is the one with the raised hand in the photo. Leontine was born on April 3, 1963 in Benin and is married to Ambroise.  The couple have five children, all under their care.  Among the children, some are in school.  The children live together with their parents. Leontine has never attended school.  To support herself and her children, Leontine has been selling fruits and vegetables for thirty-some years.  Leontine stocks up at one of the markets in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues and her income, Leontine is asking for, together with the other members of the NOUDJIOU group, a first loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit and carrots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hairdressing epuipment

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida tiene 54 años D. edad, es viuda y vive junto a su hija y nieto en la zona rural del distrito D. Chepén. Adelaida es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que goza D. buenas referencias personales.

Adelaida se dedica a la crianza y venta D. cuyes, en su domicilio. Además cría vacas, para vender su leche y realiza labores agrícolas desD. hace 10 años aproximadamente. Actualmente siembra alfalfa para alimentar a sus animales.

Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar y sembrar alfalfa  y así seguir alimentando a su ganado vacuno, para que estos produzcan la leche, que venD. y a sus cuyes para que crezcan adecuadamente y pueda venderlos a mayores precios.

Adelaida es una mujer emprendedora y este préstamo le ayudaría a continuar su negocio D. manera satisfactoria.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old, widowed, and lives with her daughter and grandson in the rural section of the District of Chepén. She is a hardworking and earnest woman who has good personal references.

Adelaida raises and sells guinea pigs from her home. She also raises cows and sells the milk. Adelaida has engaged in farm work for approximately 10 years. She currently grows alfalfa to feed to her animals.

Adelaida is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy and grow alfalfa. This will allow her to continue feeding her cows so that they can produce milk for her to sell. She will also feed her guinea pigs so that they can grow properly and be sold at better prices.

Adelaida is a hardworking woman and this loan will help continue her business in a satisfactory manner.

loans.use: to purchase and grow alfalfa so that she can feed her animals.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old married man, the father of three children who are his life, as he describes them. He seeks perfection to provide them with the best living.

Ali has worked as a mechanic since 1999. He is a man with good reputation and a hard worker who struggles to improve and expand his business to attract more customers. 

His garage is located on the main road, where he's visible to everyone and especially to passers by. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy new tools and lubricants necessary to improve his business.
 
Through these tools, Ali will be capable of accomplishing his work in a shorter period of time with more technical improvements.
 
Ali is working hard to provide his family with the best, healthful living and the best education he can provide, since he didn't get the chance to finish his own education.

Ali hopes to expand his garage to attract more customers and expand his car-maintenance range as well.

loans.use: To buy new tools and lubricants necessary for his business.

loans.name: Yemalin De Yevie Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEMALIN DE YEVIE  est composé de 16 membres qui vivent tous dans le même quartier. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Julienne, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Julienne est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Gildas. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Julienne et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges familiales.  Julienne vit au Bénin avec son mari et ses enfants. Julienne n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Julienne mène comme activité depuis trois ans environs, la vente de produits divers (savons, pâtes alimentaires, ustensiles en plastiques, etc.) à son domicile et aussi dans un marché du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Julienne vend également des boissons. C'est dans une ville du Bénin que Julienne s'approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Julienne sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement YEMALIN DE YEVIE. Leur ambition est d’amener leur activité à un niveau plus élevé.
texts.en:
Group Yemalin de Yevie is composed of 16 members, who all live in the same district. The group's president, named Julienne, is raising her hand in the picture. In order to increase their level of activity and to better meet customer demand, this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support for the first time.
Julienne is 35 years old and married to Gildas. The couple has two children, who both attend school and are in their care. Julienne and her husband provide for the family's multiple needs together. Julienne lives in Benin with her husband and her children. She never went to school. In order to provide for herself and for her family, Julienne has been retailing various products for about three years (soap, pasta, plastic cutlery...), both from her home and at a market in Benin. As a secondary activity, she also sells beverages. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin.
To grow her business and to better satisfy her customers, Julienne is requesting a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the Yemalin de Yevie members. Their ambition is to bring up their activity level.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, pasta, and dozens of plastic utensils.

loans.name: Erdenemunh

texts.en: Erdenemunh is 48 years old and lives with his four children and wife in a ger in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His eldest son is a college student. His other two children are high school students. The youngest daughter attends kindergarten. His wife plants and sells vegetables. Erdenemunh started his business in 2009 with his wife by making wooden furniture. Currently he is doing his business at his home. He is planning to expand his business, buy a car for his family and build a house to live in. He sells wooden products and furniture. He is a diligent, self-confident, and open-minded man who says, "I want to develop my business along with this loan. I have many plans to accomplish in my life and some of them are already on the way. I want to be a successful businessman." He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and materials

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Fante kenkey is made from fermented corn dough. Efua is into the business of making kenkey. The dried plantain leaves that she is arranging will be used to wrap the dough to boil. 

Efia is single and has 8 children. She has been in the kenkey business for about 10 years. Having to take care of 8 children has not been that easy for her, and so a loan from Kiva will help buy bags of maize to make Fante kenkey to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to make Fante kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Sarsenbek

texts.en:
Sarsenbek is 36 years old and lives with his three children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt), in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His three children are high school students. His wife stays at home. He started his business in 2001 by herding livestock in the countryside. He still owns some livestock there. 

He moved to the local area from the countryside in 2009. He has been driving a taxi from Ulgii town to Bayan-Nuur town. He owns the taxi car.  When he goes on taxi service, he earns 300,000 MNT per round trip as net profit. He goes on these trips twice a week and repairs his car once a month. 

He is a diligent and energetic man who says, "I want to expand my business and improve my life. Well, this is my life goal." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts to repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is from the village of Chognari in the Imereti region of West Georgia. He is 31 years old and lives with his family: his wife, Ketevan, his 1-year-old son, his mother and his elder brother. 

Vasil works in the village as a shoemaker. His brother is a joiner. They are the only income providers in the family. Along with their main job the family owns one hectare of land, where they grow maize, which they sell locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris (approximately 420 USD).

Vasil constructed a new house next to his existing one, but because of scarce financing, he couldn’t construct the roof. He requested a loan for constructing the roof of the house.

As he finishes the roof, the family will have a bigger house and more comfort.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a roof on his new house.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron has operated a charcoal business in Naivasha Town for the last seven months.  He is 30 years old, married, Ann and has two children.

Haron was introduced to Kiva field partner KADET by another borrower and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Hairolla

texts.en: Hairolla is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife babysits her seven-month-old baby and his elder two kids are school students. He started his business in 2004 by trading raw materials (wool, cashmere, etc). He has many regular customers and guaranteed suppliers. He is well known for his fair trading and excellent service. He always looks for new business opportunities. Therefore, this year, he planned to buy livestock from herders and resell it when the price rises during winter time. He is a sharp and hardworking man who is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy livestock.

loans.use: To buy livestock to re-sell

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en:
Liberatha is married with 6 children aged 10 to 28. She has been a maize farmer for 33 years. She would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow her crop.

She will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer costs during maize production. They need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production.
 
With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is a 22-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. She’s a brave and talented young woman looking for a better future. She has been working as a beautician since 2009 providing customers with beauty services wherever they are located. Cynthia is friendly and knows very well how to gain and maintain her customers. Today, she’ asking to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies in order to satisfy her customer’s needs. In the future, Cynthia plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Minda has a shop that retails eggs, salt per kilogram & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy trays of eggs, sacks of salts and beverages.

Minda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy eggs, salt & beverages

loans.name: Juan Marcos

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos se dedica a la elaboración de cereales desde hace siete años, anteriormente trabajo en una fabrica donde elaboraban dichos productos, aprendió el proceso de elaboración  luego se independizo y comenzó con negocio propio desde hace cuatro años realizando sus ventas en ferias locales, actualmente vive en la casa de su tío en la localidad de el paso, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, quienes también colaboran en la elaboración de dichos productos, solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima  al por mayor ya que los precios por fin de año van subiendo rápidamente y  le urge tener almacenado materia prima para evitar que le afecte el alza de precios de los insumos para la elaboración de cereales.
texts.en:
Señor Marcos has been making cereal for a living for seven years now.  Previously, he worked in a factory where he made the same products.  He learned this process, then he became self-employed, and started his own business four years ago, making his sales at the local markets.  He currently lives with his uncle in the town of El Paso.  He also lives with his wife and three school age children, who also work with him to make his products. 

He is requesting a loan to buy raw materials wholesale since the prices go up rapidly at the end of the year.  He urgently needs to stock up on raw materials to avoid the affect of the rising prices for supplies to make cereals.

loans.use: purchase raw materials to make cereals.

loans.name: Antiqa

texts.en:
Antiqa is 57 years old, married, and has three sons. She is a market vendor and sells many different kinds of food like macaroni, cookies, candies, tinned food, tea, and beverages like juices, soda and fizzy drinks. She has six years of experience in this field.  During this time, Antiqa has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

Antiqa`s merchandise is very popular and brings her a stable income of 230 AZN per month. The products that she sells are very popular and in use in everyday life. For instance tea is the beverage people drink most of all with cookies or candies. The demand is high and Antiqa wants to cover this demand. 

For this purpose she applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN to purchase and diversify her food and beverage items in her shop. She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more, diverse food products and beverages

loans.name: Nilton Carlos

texts.es:
Nilton de 41 años, es un hombre soltero, que trabaja como Zapatero, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya algún tiempo,  Aunque le hubiese gustado ser mecánico de avión, en la actualidad disfruta mucho de su trabajo, es tanto así que lo ha llegado a considerar como su pasatiempo personal, Nilton vive en Ica, ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agro exportaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños. 

Todos los días el se dedica a trabajar durante 12 horas diarias, en este lapso del tiempo, él puede satisfacer los pedidos de aproximadamente 10 clientes, lo que le permite tener un ingreso de S/.50. Él considera que su negocio tiene esta gran acogida por que cobra lo justo y necesario a sus clientes, siempre está pendiente también de brindar un buen servicio, para que sus clientes regresen y lo recomienden con sus conocidos.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, él podrá comprar sandalias para poder venderlas, gracias a su perspectiva y visión de negocio, confía que con este nuevo producto podrá lograr incrementar sus ingresos continuamente y así es como quiere lograr tener un reconocimiento especial por la diversidad de su trabajo. Él sabe que una manera de siempre lograr y tener mejores ingresos es logrando crear nuevos y pequeños negocios, en esta oportunidad él se ha trazado como meta poder comprarse una moto taxi.
texts.en:
Nilton is 41, single, and works as a shoemaker. He has been doing this work for some time. Although he would have liked to be an aircraft mechanic, he now enjoys his work very much; so much so, that he has come to consider it a personal hobby. 

Nilton lives in Ica, a city currently characterized by increased investment, not only in agricultural exports; that is to say, financing of these, but also by the opening of new retail centers which offer a lot of jobs to people who live in Ica.

He works 12 hours a day, every day. In this period of time he can accommodate orders from approximately 10 customers, which allows him to have an income of 50 soles. He considers that his business has had this great reception, because he charges his cusomers what is fair and necessary. He is also always looking to provide a good service, so that his customers return, and recommend him to people they know.  

With the help of the Kiva lenders, he will be able to buy sandals to sell. Because of his outlook and vision for his business, he is confident that with this new product he will be able to succeed in steadily increasing his income. This is how he wishes to gain special acknowledgement for the variety of his work. 

He knows that one way to get ahead and have better income, is by managing to create new small businesses. On this occasion, he has set himself the goal of being able to buy a mototaxi.

loans.use: To buy sandals to sell.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is 29 years old, a married woman with four children. Two of the children are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, forty-five, is married, and resides with his wife and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He and his wife have been producing brooms to sell for over four years, earning approximately USD 6 per day. Due to the difficulty in delivering his brooms, Touch is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike that he can use to carry his brooms. In the future, he would like to expand his broom production and rebuild his present house so that it is much stronger and provides better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry the brooms that he sells.

loans.name: Videkon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VIDEKON  est composé de trois personnes qui résident  dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Gbèlognon Anastasie (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 44 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire.  Gbèlognon Anastasie est veuve, avec trois enfants à sa charge. Tous ces enfants sont scolarisés. Gbèlognon Anastasie vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par dame, Gbèlognon Anastasie. Pour cette raison, Gbèlognon Anastasie vend des sachets et des gâteaux fait à base de farine de blé depuis quinze ans de façon ambulante. Gbèlognon Anastasie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Gbèlognon Anastasie ensemble avec les membres du  groupe VIDEKON sollicite pour la sixième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont étés bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sachets et de la farine de blé.

loans.name: Dinu

texts.en:
Dinu is a young man, who lives in the village of Visoca in the district of Soroca. Despite the fact that most young people of his age are working in Moscow, Dinu provides an example of how young people can make a living in his village. 

After his graduation from secondary school, he did not have the financial resources to continue his studies at the university. Thus, in 2007, when he graduated from the local high school, he started working as a tractor driver at an agricultural enterprise. 

He gained good experience for the next four years, and in 2011 decided to start his own business with his parents. His parents owned some agricultural machinery (tractor T-40, trailer, plow, cultivator) and five hectares of agricultural land (two hectares of orchard and three hectares of arable land). They acquired the machinery and land as a result of privatization after the dissolution of the collective farm (kolkhoz). 

Dinu has leased another six hectares of orchards and seven hectares of arable land, so he cultivates 18 hectares of land in total. In 2012, Dinu purchased on credit a tractor (MTZ-82), which cost 300 000 MDL, and a second-hand water tank at a cost of 30 000 MDL. 

Dinu also needs a disc harrow, which he has been leasing from other farmers, making it difficult to carry out the work on time. He is praying for help from Kiva lenders. The disc harrow costs 80,000 MDL which is equivalent to US$5,600. Dinu has requested a loan of US$3,000, to add to US$2,600 of his own.

loans.use: to buy farm equipment.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is 53 years old single and blessed with seven children aged between 28 and 16 years old.She has been into salon business for eight years and earns a monthly income of KES .28,000.


This being her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya,she intends to buy more stock of braids,weaves,dryer,shampoo,hair conditioners and hair chemicals in the salon as she anticipates to save and pay fees for her children from the expanded business profits.Her dream is to live happily.

loans.use: To purchase hair additions for her salon

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanlé K., a lively woman with an unemployed husband, was born in 1946 in Aného in Les Lacs in southern Togo. She is a poor and illiterate woman with three (03) small boys in her care. Since her youth, she has been involved in the sale of various products at the market in Bè. This business has allowed her to finance the education of all of her children and to handle the needs of her family. Her husband, who does not have a full-time job anymore, is no longer able to help her at home. All the household expenses rest therefore on Mrs. Kanlé K. who, with all of her experience and the rigor which she has demonstrated in the management of her two previous loans, has been able to pull through, but not without difficulty.

The previous loans, which were obtained and repaid without incident, have helped her significantly and have above all contributed to increasing her business and her profitability. Currently, she is asking for a new loan of $750 which will serve to buy more of a wide range of articles which are missing in her stock. This will augment her income for her needs and those of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Kanlé, femme vivant avec un mari sans emploi, est née en 1946 à Aného dans les Lacs au Sud du Togo. C’est une femme pauvre et analphabète avec trois (03) petits fils à charge. Depuis sa jeunesse, elle s’est donnée à la vente des produits divers au marché de Bè jusqu’à ce jour. Cette activité lui a permis d’assurer la scolarité de tous ses enfants et de faire face aux besoins familiaux. Son mari qui n’a plus de travail en plein temps n’arrive plus à l’aider au foyer. Toute la charge revenait donc à Madame K. Kanlé qui, avec toute son expérience et la rigueur dont elle fait preuve dans la gestion de son commerce et surtout dans la gestion des deux précédents crédits, arrive à s’en sortir non pas sans difficulté.

Les crédits antérieurs obtenus et bien remboursés l’ont beaucoup aidé et ont surtout contribué à accroître son activité et sa rentabilité. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $ 750 qui servira à acheter d’autres articles divers qui manquent dans son stock. Ceci augmentera ses revenus pour les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Irene would like to buy 2 dairy calves to rear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose Waithira Itibi would like to buy a variety of motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. is a widow who is 50 years old and has ten children. She is a native of Imo State but resides in Delta State, in Nigeria. She sells drinks, water and provisions to the community. She needs the loan for the growth of her business. She has 5 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and water for sale

loans.name: Ranohon

texts.ru:
Ranohon is a heroic mother—she raised 7 children. The older ones already have they own families. Ranohon is an energetic woman that cannot sit idle, so she sells food products on a market. To buy her products, Ranohon travels 100 km from her home. Ranohon has been an active MicroInvest client for 2 years. The money she received from MicroInvest, helped Ranohon to develop and expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

По нынешним временам Ранохон можно назвать матерью героиней, так как у нее 7 детей. Старшие ее дети уже имеют свои семьи. Ранохон не может сидеть без дела и поэтому она выходит на базар торговать. Ассортимент ее товаров составляет продукты питания. За товаром она ездит за 100 км от ее дома. С Микроинвест она сотрудничает уже 2 года и является одной из активных клиенток. Получаемые займы способствуют развитию ее бизнеса в положительную сторону.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Gladys Ramona

texts.es:
Gladys is a very hard-working woman who started her plantain business after having dedicated herself to the transportation business, which did not generate enough income since the maintenance of buses has a high cost.

She began her business approximately eight years ago with C$8,000 (Cordobas) in capital, renting a module in a major open-air market with only mesh enclosures. This business has provided sustenance for her family along with the work of Gladys’s husband.

Today Gladys has succeeded in increasing her sales through the credit lent to her through her sponsor, Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora que coloco su negocio de platanos despues de haberse dedicado al negocio del transporte, el cual no e generaba frutos ya que el mantenimiento de los buses tiene un alto costo.

Inicia su negocio hace aproximadamente 8 años con un capital de C$8,000 (cordobas) alquilando un modulo en el mercado mayoreo el cual estaba al aire libre solocercado con malla. Este negocio ha sido el sustento de su familia en conjunto con su esposo.

Hoy en dia Gladys ha logrado incrementar sus ventas a traves del credito brindado por CEPRODEL.

loans.use: Purchase products to stock the business

loans.name: Juju

texts.en: Juju is 58 years old and sells flavoured ice and drinks. She can earn US $7.50 per day. Her husband, S., sells rice and earns a small income. Juju requests a loan to expand her business to provide the family's needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia is the noble mother of a family that works in agriculture, as is typical in the area. She has invested 100% of her capital and wealth in this endeavor. Early every morning one can see how Amelia cares for her children and departs for her fields. She gives the fields the care and treatment necessary to produce high yields and to increase the quality of her income from the harvest. Amelia has clear goals, not so much for her personal satisfaction but in order to assist her children, upon whom she has focused her goals and desires. She is asking for our help raising money in order to purchase fertilizers and manure for her fields. This will make them more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Amelia, es una noble madre de familia que como es típico en la zona, está dedicada a las labores agrícolas en el que ha invertido el 100% de su capital y su patrimonio.Todos los días muy de mañana podríamos ver como Amelia atiende a sus niños y sale rumbo a sus chacras para darles el cuidado y tratamiento necesario para que puedan producir en cantidad y mejorar la calidad y sus ingresos en la cosecha.Claro como toda familia con metas claras no tanto para su satisfacción personal sino la superación de sus hijos en quienes ha enfocado sus metas y deseos solicita la podamos ayudar con la suma de dinero que solicita para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para sus tierras a fin hacerlas más productivas.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Rebecca's Imani Group

texts.en:
Rebecca C. is a 49-year-old mother living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She and her husband care for their four children, who range in age from 12 to 18, as well as two of their elders, who are 70 and 68 years old. To help support their family, Rebecca has sold cloth for the past five years, earning about $50 a month in profit.

Rebecca hopes to buy more fabric so she can expand her business. That's why she has applied for a group loan of $400 U.S. dollars along with two other women that she trusts. Teddy B. and Catherine F. have their own businesses, selling clothing and other essentials.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for a cloth-selling business

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 41 years old man who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Khalil has a chicken shop. This is the fourth time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy provisions to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To develop his chicken shop.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
CHEIKH D. is a specialist in animal feed and sells local grains at the retail level. He lives in the Malamine Senghor district in Thies and is single. He has been improving in his business for 17 years. With this loan, he wants to buy an ox and to increase his inventory of grains. He has a good loan history.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

MONSIEUR CHEIKH DIOUFest spécialisé dans l'embouche et vend des céréales locales au détail .IL habite au quartier Malamine Senghor à Thies et est célibataire. Il évolue dans son activité depuis 17 ans; avec ce prêt il veut acheter un boeuf et augmenter son stock de céréales. Il a un bon antécédent de crédit

loans.use: Animal feed

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness T. sells cooked rice. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Agness and her child. Since demand for her rice is high, she is requesting a loan of $300 to expand the business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Zeb-Un-Nisa's Group

texts.en:
Zeb-un-Nisa baji is the wife of S. A., and she lives in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, and she has lived in this house for the last 24 years. She is the mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. All of her sons completed their studies through 10th standard (grade), but they were unable to receive higher education (despite the fact that they wanted to) due to their poor financial situations. She is a housewife, and she prefers to do house-related work. Her husband works in a bus station. She has already successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute), which was used to start her own cigarette business. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy more cigarettes to sell.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Naseem baji, who seeks a loan to buy fruit to sell; (2) Shazia baji, who requests a loan to expand her embroidery business; and (3) Rashida baji, who asks for a loan to buy wheat to resell.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing additional cigarettes, fruit, wheat, and materials for an embroidery business)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is 24 years old and married with a six-year-old child. She began selling fish and cassava in 2008. Every day, she works from 5am to 8pm and earns a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Elizabeth now hopes for a loan to buy more fish and cassava for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and cassava for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Tumekindi Group

texts.en: Mwanaisha is 20 years and she is divorced with one child, aged 2 years old. She has been a fish and bites seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales. Mwanaisha is now looking for a loan to buy more fish and to make more bites to re-sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mkasi, who also has a business dealing with firewood and handbags sales.

loans.use: Mwanaisha would like to buy more fish and to make more bite to re-sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
M. Ronald is a married man with two children; he cares for one orphaned child. All of the children attend the same primary school. He has been a motorcycle mechanic in Lugazi for 7 years.

M. has had several loans from Pearl Microfinance. He used the loans to buy the spare parts he needed to repair motorcycles. As a result, he now owns two motorbikes and has a boda-boda (motorbike taxi) business. He is now able to pay his children's school fees properly and on time. He is happy that through borrowing, he has learned to save. He has also picked up the spirit of working hard from fellow borrowers; after all, how can one pay back loans without putting in a lot of effort?

loans.use: To buy spare parts for repairing motorcycles.

loans.name: Ângela

texts.pt:
Ângela N. natural de Marrumeu um dos distritos da província de Sofala uma das províncias centrais de Moçambique. Tem 39 anos e é separada, mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 14, 12 e 9 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Ângela estudou até 10ªclasse e parou quando se juntou, aos 8 anos mudou se da província de Sofala para Maputo na companhia dos seus pais este transferidos pelos serviços, em 1993 juntou se com o pai dos seu filhos e em 2003 separou se, para o seu sustento decide abrir um negocio que consiste na compra de roupas e produtos alimentícios na africa do sul para revender em Moçambique.

Ângela com o negocio tem tida um rendimento que varia de 5000,00mt a 6000,00mt e faz poupanças as vezes, para Ângela este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva valor que pretende ampliar o seu negocio e já teve empréstimos noutros bancos nos valores seguintes 10000,00mt; 20000,00mt e 30000,00mt valores que aplicou neste negocio.

Ângela pretende futuramente construir uma mercearia para ampliar melhor o negócio de vende de roupas.
texts.en:
30-year-old Ângela Nhuntumbo is the mother of three children ages 14, 12 and 9. Born in Marrumeu, in the province of Sofala, Mozambique, she moved to Maputo at age 8. Her studies where interrupted in 1993, before she finished high school. She lived with the father of her children from 1993-2003, when they separated and she started a business of buying clothes in South Africa to resell at home, to support the family. Ângela's current monthly income is between 5000,00 and 6000,00 mt, which allows her to save some money. She plans to use her loan (the first with Hluvuku) to increase her clothing inventory and improve the business. She has taken out bank loans in the past, in the amounts of 10000,00, 20000,00 and 30000,00 mt, all invested in the business. She plans to open a small clothing store, in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo. Ella trabaja desde hace 6 años con su estudio fotográfico, ofreciendo el servicio de toma de fotografías para todo tipo de tramites y eventos, también toma fotografías en eventos sociales como ceremonias, graduaciones y demás, así puede solventarse, está muy orgullosa de que durante muchos años sostuvo a sus 3 hijos, los que hoy son personas adultas e independientes, por ello ahora Gloria solo trabaja para sostenerse ella misma y su esposo, él que también trabaja, pero en otra actividad. Por su parte, ella disfruta de realizar esta actividad. Es la segunda vez que Gloria solicita un préstamo en MFP, es una de las clientes que cumple puntualmente  los pagos. Ella esta solicitando este dinero para compra de una cámara digital de mayor resolución.
texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and lives with her husband. She has worked 6 years with her photography studio, offering the service of taking photographs for all types of events, she also takes photos in social events like ceremonies, graduations, and this is how she is able to sustain herself. She is very proud that during many years she has sustained her three children, who are now independent adults, because of this Gloria now only works to sustain herself and her husband, who also works, but in a different field. For her part, she enjoys this activity. This is the second time Gloria has asked for a loan in MFP, and she is one of the clients who punctually completes her payments. She is asking for this money to buy a digital camera with better resolution.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a digital camera

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
La señora Alba tiene  35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; ella confecciona ropas interiores para damas,  emprendió esta actividad en forma independiente desde el año 2004, pues, anteriormente era empleada de una empresa de confecciones.
