Ella tiene una clientela formada, comercializa sus productos al por mayor, sus clientes son mesiteros en el micro centro de Ciudad del Este y otros vendedores que viajan en el interior del país; ella solicita el préstamo para  comprar telas en cantidad y así lograr aumentar sus ventar y por ende sus ingresos, ella va consolidando de a poco su negocio y cada vez va mejorando su local y aumentando sus herramientas de trabajos.
 Ella manifiesta que todos los créditos le fueron útiles por que siempre invirtió en su negocio por lo que espera que siempre obtenga apoyo de las instituciones formales.
texts.en:
Alba is 35 years old, married, with 4 children. She makes lingerie for women. She taught herself this profession in 2004, previously she was an employee in a seamstress shop. She has a good customer base, sells her products at wholesale, her customers are the vendors in the Ciudad del Este shopping center and other vendors that travel throughout the county. She is seeking a loan to buy quantities of fabric and in this way be able to increase her inventory and subsequently her income. She is consolidating her business a little and each time improving her locale and increasing the tools for her work. She states that all the loans were useful because she always invested in her business and she hope that she will always have the support of the formal institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various fabrics

loans.name: Wipala Group

texts.es:
La artesanía y chifelria son las principales actividades de la asociación  Wipala, confeccionan tejidos de aguayo, mochilas en aguayo y cuero, estuches para guitarra, billeteras, estuches para lápices; por otro lado las denominadas chifleras, se dedican a la elaboracion de amuletos, productos para atraer la buena suerte o para atraer el y lo que pida el cliente, una vez elaborados sus productos los comercializan en los departamentos de  Cochabamba y santa cruz, solo los martes y viernes  en ferias.
La asociación Wipala trabaja en el centro focal Los Andes hace cuatro años. A la cabeza de Basilia  C. forman un grupo muy unido ya que a lo largo del tiempo formaron una simpática amistad entre ellas. Ahora ellas necesitan comprar materia prima para ampliar su producción, de esta manera obtendrán mayores ventas y generaran mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Crafts and home remedies are the main activities of the members of the Wipala group. Some members weave aguayos [ traditional Andean textiles to carry small children], make backpacks of aguayo and leather, guitar cases, wallets, pencil cases. Those "chifleras" of the group make amulets, products to bring good luck or attract the person or thing the customer desires. Once their products are made they sell them in the areas of Cochabamba and Santa Cruz on market days, which are Tuesdays and Fridays. The Wipala group has been together for four years in the downtown area of Los Andes. They are a very united group and as they have been together for a long time, they have become friends with each other. Now they need to buy more of the raw materials for their businesses so that they can make more sales and generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the raw materials to make their handcrafted items.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Sean S. is 24 years old and runs a hair-dressing shop from her home. She lives in Kampong Cham with her husband. On average, she makes about $8 per day. Her husband makes $3 each day by selling rubber. Mrs. Sean is asking for a loan to purchase a small truck to transport rubber for her husband's business.

loans.use: Purchase small truck to transport rubber

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Modesta,

texts.es:
Modesta se dedica a su negocio desde hace quince años, pero solo los últimos cinco ha estado alquilando un puesto en el mercado de Vitarte. Ahora vende productos naturales y hierbas medicinales, mientras que anteriormente vendía productos de limpieza en el mercado de Caquetá.
Recién su segunda hija se unió a ella en su negocio, y ahora las dos  reciben préstamos de EDAPROSPO y juntas invierten en las hierbas y los productos naturales para ir agrandando su comercio.
Modesta lleva tres años recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO que le permiten invertir sus ganancias en los estudios de sus cuatro hijos, de veintitrés, veinte, dieciocho y seis años, y juntar, lo que sobra, a las ganancias de su esposo, que tiene una tiendita de abarrotes, para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Más adelante le gustaría invertir en su negocio poniendo vitrinas para exhibir sus productos más ordenadamente en su puesto, y así seguir mejorando en el negocio.
texts.en:
Modesta has had her business for 15 years, but has only been renting a space in the Vitarte Market for the past five. She now sells natural products and medicinal herbs. She used to sell cleaning products in the Caquetá market. Her second oldest daughter recently joined her in business and now they both get loans from EDAPROSPO. Together they invest in herbs and natural products so they can grow the business. Modesta has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for three years, which allows her to invest her earnings in her four children's studies. Her children are 23, 20, 18, and 6 years old. She gives what is left of her earnings to her husband, who has a small grocery store, to help cover their household expenses. In the future, she would like to invest more in her business. She would like to put in glass cases to exhibit her products in a more orderly way. In this way she could continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invirtió en medicinas por que su hijo se calló enfermo y necesitaba curas urgentes.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao L. is a forty-year-old widowed mother caring for five children. All of them are students and help her with her business when they are not studying. She currently makes a daily income to support her family by selling chickens and some vegetables in the local market, and generates an average income of $3 a day. She is a self-sacrificing woman who works hard every day and never wastes time. Sao L. has been hiring a neighbor's motorcycle for her business transportation for a long time. She has hoped to have her own motorcycle, and to make that possible she has decided to apply for a loan of $700. Her family lives in Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Luafulufa

texts.en: Luafulufa G., 48, is married with five children.  She has two years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people and the general public three days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala.  SPBD loans are Luafulufa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All her loan will be used on her business only.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer, chemicals, a wheel barrow and knives.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Cesar L. le está haciendo falta la instalación eléctrica y los acabados del exterior e interior, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar acabo está mejora. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo y así su familia vivirá en un mejor ambiente. 
 Cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor Cesar el se encontraba en su empleo y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Dinora González y si hija, quien son las personas que aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
The home of Cesar L. is in need of electric installation and exterior and interior final touches, but he does not have the money necessary to finish these improvements. This is why he is soliciting a loan--so that his family will live in a better environment. When we visited Cesar's home, he was at work, so his wife, Dinora González, and his daughter appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Electric installation and finishing interior and exterior of home

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.ru: Давлятов Хусниддин Аскаралиевич 1973 год рождения ,образование высшее .Женат, имеет 1 ребёнка ,жена Муротова Ширин .Место жительства Шахристанский район р. Шахристан .Клиент занимается животноводством уже около 10 лет .Клиент берёт заем 1600 сом .на 5 мес.для выращивания и откорма скота .Дополнительный семейный доход клиент занимается переработкой молока и сельским хозяйством.Хусниддин планирует продолжить сотрудничество с нашей оранизацией.На следующие кредиты он хочет построить большой просторный коровник.
texts.en:
D. Husniddin Askaralievich was born in 1973. He has a university diploma. He is married with one child. Husniddin and his wife, Shireen Murotova. live in Shakhristan. For the past ten years Husniddin has been involved in cattle breeding. He also earns money from milk processing and agriculture. Husniddin is applying for a 1600-som loan that he is planning to repay within five months. Husniddin is planning to cooperation with our organization. He would like to use future loans for building a large, spacious barn.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Verónica De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Verónica de Los Ángeles F. F. de 30 años de edad reside en Cojutepeque vive junto a su hijo el cual se dedica a estudiar. Ella posee cinco años de tener una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos, así también vende perfumes y cosméticos para mujer. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar más productos de primera necesidad para su tienda, así también comprar más perfumes y cosméticos, de manera que pueda ofrecer muchas más opciones a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Verónica de Los Ángeles F. F. is 30 and lives in Cojutepeque with her son, who goes to school. She has owned a store for five years where she sells perishable items as well as perfumes and cosmetics. She is requesting a loan with the goal of buying more basic goods for her store. She will also buy more perfume and cosmetics so she can offer her customers more options.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable goods and perfumes

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es socia del Bancomunal Antares.
Clara es  de Piura, enviudo hace diecinueve años, tiene 70 años, cinco hijos todos mayores y son profesionales.
Clara empezó vendiendo abarrotes en sus casa, hasta que se dio una oportunidad  de comprar un puesto en un mercado, lo compro con la ayuda de sus hijos y los  ahorros que tenia,  se puso  a vender abarrotes desde hace  27 años 
Desde que Clara esta en Finca ha sido una ayuda para crecer en  su negocio, ha recibido charlas las cuales han ayudado  ha organizarse y atender mejor a las clientas.
Clara necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles,  para la compra de sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos.
El sueño de clara es salir adelante para ayudar a sus hijos a surgir.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the Antares Community Bank. She is from Piura, a widow for nineteen years, 70 years old, with five children, all grown and professionals. Clara began selling groceries from her house until there was an opportunity to buy a stall in the market. She bought it with the help of her children and the savings she had. She has been selling groceries for 27 years. Since Clara has been in FINCA it has been a help to expand her business. She has attended talks that have helped with organization and to give better service to her clients. Clara needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of sacks of rice, sugar, milk, and noodles. Clara's dream is to get ahead in order to help her children advance.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice, sugar, milk, noodles

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Малика имеет свой собственный магазин около дома. В период кредитования она купила холодильник витрину чтобы хранить там продукты и молочные изделия. Так же у неё улучшилось семейное положение. На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет купить разновидности масел на 1500 сомонов, хозтовары на 500 сомонов так же макароны на 500 сомонов.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Malika owns a store not far from her home. She used her loan to purchase a refrigerator showcase for storing food and milk products. The loan also helped her marital status. Malika intends to use the requested loan in order to purchase 1,500 somoni worth of oil products, 500 somoni of household goods, and 500 somoni worth of noodles and macaroni.

Translated from Russian by Pavle Milekic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household goods, noodles, and butter

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат получает 2 раз  кредит. Он  рад что его дела идут хорошо. В прошлый раз он починил несколько машин. Его знакомый купил машину из Прибалтики и дал ему ремонтировать машину. Также переоборудовать машину на газовый аппарат. В основном он перекрашивает по желанию клиентов машины. Но на наших дорогах быстро выходят из строя  автомашины и работы ему хватает. Очередной кредит  получает на  покупки красок и необходимых запасных частей для ремонта машин.
texts.en:
This is Furkat's second time obtaining a loan. He is glad that his business is going well. Last time, he was able to fix several cars. His friend bought a car from the Baltic and gave it to Furkat to repair and to covert to gas equipment. Furkat mainly paints the cars according to his customers' requests. However, on our roads cars break down quickly, thus, giving Furkat plenty of work. He wants to obtain this loan to purchase paint and necessary spare parts for repairing cars.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint and spare parts

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina M. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 60-years old and married with five adult children. Josefina owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from buying and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Josefina joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pensamientos Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth A. R. tiene 47 años y vive en la localidad llamada Santa C., Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, Estado de México y es miembro activo de la UDE: Pensamientos.

Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de fragancias y cosméticos desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, con la finalidad de irse haciendo de artículos para su hogar a través de regalos por sus ventas, pero ahora tiene otra prioridad.  Hace poco menos de un año su yerno sufrió un grave accidente perdiendo la vida, por tal motivo Elizabeth decide recibir nuevamente a su hija con sus dos nietecitos, para apoyarle dentro de sus posibilidades.

Cuando le comentan sobre Fundación Realidad, ve la posibilidad de  solicitar un crédito integrándose así al grupo, ella cuenta con un poco de mercancía pero en estos momentos necesita recibir un recurso  para hacer que su negocio crezca y de esa manera  incrementar sus ventas, de tal forma  que obtenga  mayores ganancias y así poder cubrir gastos de alimentación para sus nietos; su hija trabaja pero lo que gana no es suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades. Elizabeth agradece el apoyo al  crédito que solicita a través  de Fundación Realidad  para obtener las ganancias necesarias.  
              
Los miembros del grupo son: 
Lourdes P. Venta de cosméticos, Ma. Elena Dámaso Venta de cosméticos, Mirna Socorro Venta de cosméticos, María D. Venta de plantas y servilletas, Ma. Del Socorro  Venta de tapetes, Nelva C. Venta de papelería y tlapalería, Norma Zenón Venta de frutas y legumbres, Ma. Del Rocío Venta de frutas y legumbres, Ma. Isabel Flores Venta de ropa, Reyna S. Venta de carpetas y blusas, Ma. De Lourdes O. Venta de antojitos, Raquel O.  estilista, Gisela P. Venta de ropa, Elizabeth A. Venta de cosméticos, Maricela C. Venta de discos, Concepción González Venta de zapatos, Paulina Ramírez Venta de zapatos, Eva Ramírez Venta de repostería.
texts.en:
Elizabeth A. R. is 47 years old and lives in the Santa C. locality in Valle de Chalco Solidaridad in the state of México and is an active member of group Pensamientos. Elizabeth has worked selling fragrances and cosmetics for approximately 2 years with aim of aquiring items for her home through gifts from her sales, but now she has a different priority. A little less than a year ago her son-in-law suffered a serious accident in which he lost his life, and thus Elizabeth decided to take in her daughter along with her two children to help them as much as possible. When people told her about Fundación Realidad she saw the possibility of requesting a loan, being a member of the communal group. She has little merchandise but she needs funds to grow her business to increase her sales and thus earn higher income to cover food costs for her grandchildren. Elizabeth is thankful for the loan that she requesting through Fundación Realidad to be able to obtain the necessary income. The members of the group are: Lourdes P. selling cosmetics, María Elena Dámaso selling cosmetics, Mirna Socorro selling cosmetics, María D. selling plants and napkins, María Del Socorro selling rugs, Nelva C. selling office supplies and hardware, Norma Zenón Venta selling fruits and vegetables, María Del Rocío selling fruits and vegetables, María Isabel Flores selling clothing, Reyna S. selling carpets and blouses, María De Lourdes O. selling regional delicacies, Raquel O. is a stylist, Gisela P. selling clothing, Elizabeth A. selling cosmetics, Maricela C. selling CDs, Concepción González selling shoes, Paulina Ramírez selling shoes, and Eva Ramírez selling pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, fragrances, materials for facial treatments to sell

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Mwanne

texts.en:
Mwanne is a member of the Mbuma borrower group in Kihesa, Irnga, she is 57 year old woman, she is married and a  mother of 1 child, her child is 40 years old.

Mwanne has owned a Grocery business for 25 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Mwanne`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer and soda.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Mwanne hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more  Drinks like beer and soda

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 24 años, vive con su pareja (agricultor) y padre de sus 2 hijas, quienes están estudiando. La casa donde habitan es propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cosméticos y joyas de dos líneas cosméticas. Estos productos son muy demandados por las personas que viven en su localidad, por lo que las vende al crédito o al contado. Lo que le gusta a Judith de su trabajo es aprender cómo tratar cada día mejor a sus clientes y sobre todo, es una actividad que la entretiene mucho. La rentabilidad de su negocio se da porque ya cuenta con clientes selectos y seguros, los mismos que la recomiendan a otras personas debido a su buen trato y paciencia. Para más adelante, a Judith le gustaría tener una tienda de comestibles, además de su negocio de venta de productos de belleza.
Con MF ya tiene 2 préstamos, le gusta su banco comunal porque entre todos los integrantes se entienden, ha hecho varios amigos y tienen mucha comunicación. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza para tener en stock , los mismos que mostrará a clientes para que adquieran el producto de forma inmediata sin necesidad de hacer el pedido por el catálogo.
texts.en:
Judith is 24 years old, and lives with her partner (who works in agriculture) and is the father of her two daughters that are both currently studying. They own their house. For the past three years she has dedicate herself to the sale of perfume, cosmetics, and jewelry from two different cosmetics lines. These products are in high demand by the people that live in her neighborhood, for which she sells them on credit and for cash. What Judith enjoys about her work is learning how to treat her clients better each day, and above all it is a job that she keeps her very entertained. She earns good profits because she counts on a selective and secure clientele base that refers her to other people because she treats her clients well and is patient. In the future, Judith would like to have a grocery store, in addition to her beauty products business. She has already made two loans through the MF bank; she likes her Communal Bank because all the members understand each other well, she has made many friends, and they communicate well. With the money that she is requesting she will purchase more beauty products to have in stock, which she will also use to show her clients so that they can acquire the products immediately without needing to order through the catalog.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (beauty products).

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia M. S. es una señora de 36 años de edad, quien vive en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Cuatro Bocas de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche) y agricultura. Ella vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo.

Desde hace ya varios años doña Sonia se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. Doña Sonia considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, ella y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida.

En estos momentos doña Sonia desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones), para comprar 5 vacas y así  poder incrementar la producción. Ella sabe que contar con mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresaria exitosa la motiva ha esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Doña Sonia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bansuperafe; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Sonia M. S. is 36 years old and lives in a small Costa Rican rural community named Cuatro Bocas de Upala, which is located in the Alajuela province. It is known for its commerce, raising cattle for both beef and dairy and agriculture. She lives with her two children and her husband. For many years now, Doña Sonia has been dedicated to raising cattle for the production of both beef and dairy. She sells her goods to the neighbors in her community, who are very satisfied with the quality of the products she offers. Doña Sonia attributes the improved living conditions that she and her family have enjoyed to the progress of her business. Currently, Doña Sonia is requesting a loan of 500,000 colones so she may purchase 5 cows and increase her production. She realizes that having more cows means more sacrifice and hard work. However, her desire to be a successful entrepreneur is what drives her dedication and efforts. Doña Sonia is a member of Empresa de Crédito Communal Bansuperafe, which is made up only of women, as it specialty is supporting non-professional women and female heads of households. It is one of the 100 organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her third loan, with which she expects to continue her personal and economic growth, as well as actively participating in her community’s credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 5 cows

loans.name: Toomoi

texts.en:
Toomoi N. is 59 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in the Uvurkhangai Province of central Mongolia. His oldest daughter is a university student; his second attends a local secondary school; his youngest will soon start kindergarten. N. operates a small grocery shop near his house. He sells a variety of food products to the residents of his neighborhood. He started his business in 2005 after managing a firewood selling business for several years. N. is a very hard working person and is very focused on growing his business. He says, "All I want is to be able to provide for my children's education." He is thus requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan, with which he will purchase more grocery products for his shop.

Abut XacBank:

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia and also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision and scale to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team; to lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: purchasing more grocery products for his shop

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une femme mariée, elle a 47 ans et mère de 03 enfants. Son prêt lui permet de faire de l'embouche ovine et de vendre du mil, de l'arachide et des haricots séchés. Avec ses bénéfices elle participe à la prise en charge sanitaire et scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amy D. is a married woman, aged 47, with three children. Her loan will enable her to fatten sheep for market, and sell millet, peanuts and dried beans. With the income she generates, she provides for her children’s basic needs and education.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce her ability to self-finance her business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is from Punta Aplaya, Bago City Negros Occidental. She is 41 years old and married to Rodrigo B.. They have seven school-age children. Her husband is a tricycle transportation driver. Since she joined with Project Dungganon, Melanie's perseverance and eagerness to improve her family's life has turned out in a positive way. She always dreamed of so many good things for her children, and she wants the best for them. Her husband Rodrigo has never failed to help their businesses. They keep on supporting each other in terms of how they will raise their children properly and how to handle their businesses to expand it. Sometimes it's hard, but they keep their faith and trust everything to God. 

Melanie used to be a vendor when she was younger. Her parents taught her to become independent to be able to survive. She sells fish and shrimp in the market, where she has many regular and loyal customers who buy her products. She is saving money for the education of her children and for future emergencies. She's hoping that all her children will be able to finish college and get a stable job, or be established in a gainful livelihood, because she does not want them to have no skills with which to support their own families in the future.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
Victorino C. M. tiene 57 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 11, 15 y 18 años respectivamente. El vive en Pueblo Nuevo con su familia de 5 miembros. El esta solicitando un prestamo para hacerle una repacion a la casa ya que tiene un hijo enfermo y necesita ese lugar un buen estado. Este le ayudará para tener una mayor comodidad ya que es necesaria esa reparacion. El se dedico a la argricultura de granos basicos y a la ganadería. Hace mucho tiempo el ha tenido prestamos con FUDECOSUR y los creditos le han ayudado en salir adelante con su familia.  El no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. El espera que pueda salir adelante y tener una mayor comodidad ya que se necesita. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Victorino C. M. is 57, married and has three children that are his priority, they are 11, 15 and 18 respectively. He lives in Pueblo Nuevo with his family of 5. He is requesting a loan to make repairs to his house because he has an ill son and needs the house to be in good conditions. This will help his son be more comfortable and makes the repairs necessary. He has worked in agriculture of basic grains and livestock. A long time ago he had loans with FUDECOSUR and the loans helped him get his family ahead. He hasn't had any other credits with Banks. He hopes to be able to get ahead and provide the comfort needed. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House repairs to help ill son

loans.name: Quebecor Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal Quebecor, está conformada por 10 socios entusiastas y emprendedores quienes tienen por afinidad dedicarse al comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 4 años.
Gladis Blanca es una socia del grupo y a su vez asume el cargo D. presidenta recientemente, tiene 37 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 12 y 18 años D. edad. Gladis se dedica a L. venta D. ropa desD. hace 3 años, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado implementar más su negocio y tener un pequeño ahorro, su gran anhelo es tener una tienda granD., para así captar una mayor clienteL. y mejorar su calidad D. vida. 
El reciente préstamo será utilizado para L. compra D. mercadería D. estación para diversificar sus productos, nuestros socios se sienten muy agradecidos por el apoyo recibido y se comprometen en L. puntualidad D. sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Quebecor Communal Bank is comprised of ten enthusiastic and entrepreneurial members. They have an affinity for devoting themselves to small businesses. They have worked with Edaprospo – Prosperidad for four years. Gladis Blanca, a member of the group, recently assumed the position of president. She is 37, married, and has two children. They are 12 and 18. Gladis has been selling clothes for three years. With the effort in her work, she was able to set up her business more and have a little savings. Her biggest goal is to have a large store in order to gain more customers and improve her quality of life. The recent loan will be used to buy seasonal merchandise to diversify her products. Our members are very grateful for the support they have received, and they promise to be punctual with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seasonal merchandise to diversify their products

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie P. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old. Rosie is married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community.  Rosie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Rosie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles T. es una dama muy trabajadora que se desempeña en la elaboración de alimentos como lo son los nacatamales, una de las comidas típicas en Nicaragua. Ella prepara dichos nacatamales todos los fines de semana y son varios los clientes que le compran el alimento ya que ella es muy excelente cocinera en el departamento de Chinandega.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de la carne de cerdo, leña, maíz, y demás ingredientes para los nacatamales. Espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera suplir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles T. is a hard-working woman who prepares food, like nacatamales (typical Nicaraguan tamales wrapped in banana leaves). She prepares the nacatamales every weekend and several customers buy from her because she's an excellent cook in Chinandega department. She is asking for funding to buy pork, firewood, corn and other nacatamal ingredients. She hopes the loan will be approved so that she can meet her household's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork, firewood, corn and other ingredients.

loans.name: Salamba

texts.fr: Madame Salamba S.  est une sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 4 prêts  antérieurs au sein de l’institution.  Elle habite à Yoff Ndeungagne. Elle est âgée de 40 ans et s’active depuis plus de 10ans dans la couture. Sa spécialité est la confection de pagnes tisses. Parallèlement  elle vend des tissus, des draps et des chaussures. C’est sa mère qui l’a  influence dans l’activité  de couture. Ce qui la passionne dans cette activité c’est le fait de confectionner de jolies créations. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs en vue d’acheter des tissus. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux assister sa famille dans l’amélioration de sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Salamba S. has been a member of the lending group U-IMCEC since November 2003.  She has already benefited from four previous loans with this micro-finance institution.  She lives in Yoff Ndeungagne. She is 40 years old and has been active for over ten years as a clothier.  Her specialty is making woven pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  Along with this, she sells fabrics, bed sheets, and shoes.  Her mother is the one who guided her work as a clothier.  What makes Salamba passionate about her work is being able to create pretty things.  Salamba is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs with the aim of buying some fabrics.  The growth in her profits will enable her to help her family further in improving living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth owns a shop where she sells drinks and groceries to her customers at retail prices. She has been in the business for 10 years and it is her means of supporting her family. She hopes to expand her business by stocking her shop with more drinks. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more drinks to sell to meet her customers’ demands and make more profit to assist her family and save for the future.

Elizabeth is 38 years old, married and blessed with two children. The family lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade is 35 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a building contractor and they live in Lagos state, Nigeria. With the proceeds from her store selling frozen food, Folashade has been able to be a good mother and wife in her home. She has had the business for seven years and hopes to expand. Folashade is requesting a loan of NGN 150, 000 to buy more frozen chicken, turkey and fish to sell and maximize her profit. She thanks all lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Jenifer's Group

texts.en:
Jenifer A., from the village of Brgy. Darubba, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya, is the 29-year-old leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jenifer, who is single, owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jenifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tres De Noviembre Cumbe(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El bankito 3 de Noviembre esta conformado por 13 señoras luchadoras que siempre estan en la busqueda de mejores oportunidades para sus familias viven el la parroquia Cumbe, esta parroquia se encuentra ubicada al sur del cantón Cuenca. Limita al norte con la parroquia Tarqui, al sur con las parroquias Jima del cantón Sígsig y la periferia cantonal de Girón, al este con las parroquias Quingeo y San José de Raranga del cantón Sígsig, y al oeste con la parroquia Victoria del Portete. Como principal actividad económica sobresale la agricultura con la producción de maíz, papas, fréjol y habas,  la ganadería es importante también  por una excelente producción lechera, y gran parte de la población joven se traslada  diariamente a Cuenca donde realizan otras actividades como obreros de fábricas, elaboración de  artesanías, empleados en actividades de comercio, servicios y principalmente como trabajadores de la construcción. 

La señora María  Auxiliadora  es una  mujer de  48 años vive con dos de sus hijos menores  de 15 y 12 años que estudian en un colegio de  la localidad, sus otros cuatro hijos casados y viven independientes. Su esposo es albañil y con el sacrificio de mucho tiempo ha logrado construir su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Cumbe.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal pues ya lleva quince años en él motivada por una compañera del barrio  donde formaron un grupo  que se desintegró,  luego formo este nuevo grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras. María Auxiliadora  es comerciante de animales compra y vende cuyes y gallinas en las ferias de Cumbe y en la feria libre de Cuenca, esta actividad le ha permitido irse superando económicamente  ya lleva en ella  20 años  trabajando  los días miércoles y sábados, y los de mas de días se dedica a cuidar de su ganado y la leche que obtiene la vende en los carros lecheros. Ahora con su crédito va a comprar más cuyes y gallinas  para revenderlos.

Su meta incrementar su negocio cada día y llegar  a comprarse un vehiculo.

La señora Luz Fernández vive en la comunidad 3 de noviembre que pertenece a la parroquia Cumbe, tiene 60 años de edad enviudó hace 18 años su difunto esposo  falleció  en un accidente de tránsito,  con él concibieron cuatro  hijos que ahora son adultos y   casados, vive en su casa propia con una de sus hijas que le hace compañía y comparte los gastos del hogar.

Luz se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, papas, hortalizas, etc., tiene ganado vacuno y vende su leche a los carros lecheros, también se dedica  a la cría de cuyes y pollos,  nos comenta que se encuentra en el bankito desde  sus inicios  es decir hace 15 años, los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio de compra y venta de animales, con su nuevo crédito comprará pollos, cuyes y alimento para su crianza, así como también semillas de maíz, fréjol, arveja entre otras.

Tiene como meta seguir trabajando mientras tenga salud.
texts.en:
The 3 de Noviembre Village Bank is made up of 13 hard-working women who are always looking for better opportunities for their families. They live in the Cumbe parish, which is located in the south of the canton of Cuenca. It is bordered in the north by Tarqui parish, in the south by Jima parish of Sígsig canton and the edge of Girón canton, to the east by the parishes of Quingeo and San José in Sígsig canton, and in the west by the parish of Victoria del Portete. The leading economic activity in the area is agriculture, and the most important products are corn, potatoes, beans and milk. A large proportion of the younger population travels daily to Cuenca to work as factory employees, handicraft artisans, store employees, service workers and above all, construction workers. María Auxiliadora is 48 years old and lives with her two younger children, aged 15 and 12, who attend a nearby school. Her other four children are married and independent. Her husband is a mason, and through many years of sacrifice, he was able to build the family's own home in the Cumbe community. María Auxiliadora was one of the founding members of the communal bank, and she has been with the bank for fifteen years. She was inspired by a neighbor who belonged to an earlier group in the neighborhood which broke up. Later, this new group of hard-working and enterprising women was formed. María Auxiliadora's business is buying and selling animals. She deals in guinea pigs and hens at the Cumbe markets and at Cuenca's public market. This activity has allowed her to advance economically. She has worked for 20 years in the markets on Wednesdays and Saturdays, and on the other days, she takes care of her animals. She also keeps cows, whose milk she sells to mobile distributors. With the current loan, she will buy more guinea pigs and hens to resell. Her goal is to expand her business day by day and reach the point where she can buy herself a vehicle. Luz Fernández lives in the "3 de Noviembre" community of the Cumbe parish. She is 60 years old and was widowed 18 years ago when her husband was killed in a traffic accident. The couple had four children, who are now grown and married. Luz lives in her own house with one of her daughters who keeps her company and shares the household expenses. Luz works in agriculture; she grows corn, potatoes and a variety of vegetables. She also keeps cattle, selling the milk to mobile distributors. In addition, she raises guinea pigs and chickens. She tells us that she has been a member of the communal bank since its beginnings, that is, for the past 15 years. The loans have been beneficial for her business of buying and selling animals. With the new loan, she will buy chickens, guinea pigs and feed for her animals, as well as seeds for corn, beans, peas and other crops. Her goal is to continue working as long as her health permits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying guinea pigs, chickens, animal feed, and seeds for corn, beans, peas, etc.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is a single mother of six children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Immaculate owns a bar in Nakulabye, one of the city suburbs, and sells all types of beer and local gin. She wants to use this loan of 600,000/= to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.  She doesn't incur any transport costs as she buys from her home. Immaculate has been in this business for 10 years. Besides this bar business, she doesn’t have any other side job. Immaculate works from her home and so doesn’t pay rent though she pays for an operating license. She sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale. Her major customers are mainly older men and women. Immaculate works seven days a week. Her business challenges include the rainy season and defaulters. She aspires to build a house to accommodate her bar.  She joined MCDT because she wanted timely loans.  Immaculate resides in and owns a four-room house.  The family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beer and local gin

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea T. (pictured with her young son), 45, and her husband, Mr. Vun Torn, 46, have been married since 1986. They have six children: one son and five daughters. One weaves silk at home, three attend school, one stays at home and the last is very young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River. 

Sophea has been a silk weaver since she was seventeen years old.  She learned the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a farmer that grows rice and vegetables. Besides the farming business, Sophea and her husband raise a horse and a cow.  She is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and build a shelter for the animals.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and build a shelter for her animals.

loans.name: Kossa

texts.fr:
Kossa G. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAKIDIOTO et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle vend des légumes et condiments au marché de Tanaff. Il lui arrive, avec son plateaux chargé de quelle marchandises de faire du porte-à-porte pour vendre. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de sept ans. Les recettes qu'elle en tire lui permettent de contribuer à l'éducation des enfants.		
		
Avec elle souhaite renforcer le capital de son commerce qu'elle gère depuis qu'elle est membre de CAURIE-MF. Elle souhaiterait réaliser plus de revenus afin de pouvoir de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kossa G. is a 47 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 8 children, for whom she is responsible. She is a member of the "Banc Villageois" of BAKIDIOTO and has been granted loans 15 times in a row. She sells vegetables and condiments on the Tanaff market. From time to time, she goes selling from door to door with a tray loaded with goods. She gets her supplies from weekly markets. She has been in this trade for over seven years and the revenue generated allows her to contribute to her children's education. With this loan, she intends to strengthen the capital of her business, which she has been running since she has become a member of CAURIE-MF. She hopes to make more profits in order to better meet her children's needs.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her level of self-financing

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio es casado tiene tres hijos vive en la casa de su padre en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Silvio trabaja como maestro albañil siendo esto su único ingreso ya que la esposa se dedica a cuidar a los hijos.
El crédito solicitado es para la operación de su padre ya que tuvo un accidente.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio is married, has three children, and lives in his parent’s house in the area of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. Mr. Silvio works as a bricklaying teacher. This is his family’s only income because his wife works by taking care of the children. The requested loan is for a medical operation for his father because he had an accident. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan, and the socio-economic analysis qualifies him favorably for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment for a medical operation for his father, who suffered an accident

loans.name: German

texts.en:
German A. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 26 years old, married, and has 2 infant-age children. To earn a living, German owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. His primary source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. German has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and he earns approximately 20,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, German joined ASKI to gain access to financial services so that he can be better able to engage in business activities and improve his standard of living. Notably, German already successfully repaid a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP ($200) from ASKI. This prior loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. German is now requesting another loan, also in the amount of 9,000 PHP, which would be used to purchase fertilizers (e.g., manure). He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Pedro Giancarlo

texts.es: Pedro tiene 23 años  de edad, es soltero vive  aun con sus padres en el Caserio de Garganto, en casa de material noble de un piso. El se dedica a prestar servcio de transporte en vehiculo en condicion de alquiler venta. Tambien se dedica como mecanico. El es un joven muy activo con muchas metas y objetivos. Con el dinero que solicita sera para terminar de cancelar el vehiculo que es un automovil tico.
texts.en:
Pedro, 23, is single and still lives with his parents in Garganto in a one-storey house built of substantial materials. He provides public transportation services and also is an auto mechanic. He is a very active young man who has many goals and objectives. He will use the requested funds to pay off his vehicle which is a TIco brand car.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish paying off his car.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
Christine K.  est une femme de 34 ans, née à Gasabo, province de la Ville de Kigali capital du Rwanda. Elle est mariée et a un seul enfant qui a  3 ans. Christine et  sa famille habite à Kinyinya- Gasabo- Kigali, son niveau d’éducation est secondaire dans l’option de Biochimie. Elle est salariée dans une Eglise de PENTECOTE(ADEPR), Paroisse de Gasave ou elle est secrétaire de Révérend Pasteur de cette Eglise.
Le crédit contracté avec ACB est  le onzième, les précédents lui ont aidé d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et le présent prêt c’est pour amener l’eau dans sa maison. Ses épargnes lui permettent  de payer le loyer ou elle habite avec sa famille jusqu'à avoir sa maison laquelle elle veut installer les tuyaux d’eau.
Dans l’avenir, elle compte abandonner le secteur des salariés pour embrasser le commerce, bien sur, elle va commencer par un nouveau prêt et les épargnes antérieurs pour stabiliser sa capacité financière
texts.en:
Christine K. is 34 years old and was born in Gasabo, in the Province of the Town of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. She is married and has one three-year-old child. Christine and her hamily live in Kinyinya- Gasabo- Kigali. She attended school to the secondary level, choosing a Biochemistry option. She is employed by a Pentecostal Church (ADEPR) in the Parish of Gasave, where she is secretary to the Reverend Pastor of the Church. The loan granted by ACB is the 11th. The preceding loans enabled her to improve her family’s living conditions, and the present loan will serve to bring water into her home. Her savings are sufficient to pay the rent where she lives with her family until she can move to the house where she wants to install water pipes. In the future, she plans to stop being an employee and embark on commercial activities. This will of course require another loan, which along with previous savings will stabilise her financial capabilities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of installing water pipes.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Felicitas; tiene 48 años de edad y es madre soltera, ella tiene 1 hijos  trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza por catalogo, La socia trabaja como auxiliar contable en un estudio de contadores, ella paralelamente alterna su trabajo con la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza en oferta venderlos en la siguiente campaña cuando no salga.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 48, is a single mother of a child. She works selling catalogue beauty products. She is also employed as an Accounting Assistant in an accounting office and alternates her beauty product sales with her job. She is a member of the “PADRE URRACA” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is asking for funds to stock up on beauty products that are currently on sale to sell during the next sales campaign when they won’t be available anymore. She avails herself of this forum to express her thanks for the loan as well as to pledge repayment in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products that are currently on sale to sell during the next sales campaign when they aren’t available anymore.

loans.name: Hayde Rose

texts.en:
Hayde Rose B. is a married woman who lives in  Brgy. Manghanoy, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: rice farming, food vending (bananaque) and livestock businesses. Her husband, Fidel, who is 45 years old, works as a farm laborer to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 15 and 17 years old. 

Hayde Rose joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Hayde Rose has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of  7,800 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 22nd cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to maintain her rice field and buy stock for her food vending business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and the expansion of her business. Hayde Rose B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To maintain her rice field and buy stock for her food vending business

loans.name: Delia Hermelinda

texts.es:
La Señora Delia es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle,  su población se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura que es  para su consumo y el sobrante lo vende, mucha de su población ha emigrado en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.
 
Nuestra socia  tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos,el primero de 4 años y su segundo hijo de apenas 7 meses de edad, su esposo trabaja conduciendo maquinaria pesada, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Doña Delia se dedica a trabajar en su pequeña tienda la cual la tiene hace 15 años, labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche de domingo a domingo, también  cría gallinas y tiene una vaca.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace 8 años y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, ahora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, galletas, etc.
 
Su mayor sueño es conservar su salud para poder trabajar como hasta ahora lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the community bank named "The Swan". She lives in the community of San Miguel in the region of Parroquia Del Valle. The population is made up of farmers and agriculturists whose products are used for both personal consumption and for sale. Much of the population has emigrated in search for better a better future for their families. 

Delia is 42 years old. She is married and she has 2 children. The eldest is 4 years old and the youngest is only 7 months old. Her husband is a heavy machinery operator and together they have built their own house.

Delia works in a small store that she has had for more than 15 years. She works from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening, 7 days a week. She also raises chickens and she has a cow. 

She has been a member of the community bank for the past 8 years and the loans she has received have greatly benefited her business. This loan will be invested in the purchase of grocery items to stock her store, such as: rice, sugar, cookies, etc.

Her greatest dream is to remain healthy enough to keep working, as she has to date.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil, eggs, cookies etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new cart and more fresh fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is currently in the business of selling cold drinks like juice, soda, and ice cream, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of soda to sell.  Mary is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has five children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a little restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more crates of soda to sell

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana es madre soltera con tres hijos ya mayores de edad. Ella vende almuerzos en las tarde por $ 1.50. Vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Comenzó vendiendo comidas con algunos ahorros y la experiencia que tenía en vender comidas decidió tener su propio negocio de almuerzos. Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene su pequeño comedor en la parte delantera de su casa donde trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00am hasta que se acaben los almuerzos. El almuerzo viene con jugo, sopa, segundo por solo $ 1.50. 

Ella quiere continuar con su negocio por eso ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, vegetales, legumbres para hacer los almuerzos. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother with three grown-up children.  She sells lunches in the afternoons for $1.50.  She lives in a peri-urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil called Duran which is known for its deteriorating ecosystem.

Ana began selling meals with some savings she had and her previous experience in the business.  She decided to set up her own lunch business.  Owing to this good decision, she now has her own small eatery in the front of her home where she works every day from 6.00am until her lunches have run out.  Her lunches come with juice, soup and main course for only $1.50.

Ana would like to continue with her business and will use her loan to buy rice, vegetables and pulses to make her lunches.  In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables and pulses

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel L. is 43 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a food vending business. She lives in Suba Panas, Brgy Marigondon, Lapu-lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. Ethel is now borrowing PHP 11,000 so that she could purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ethel hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase materials for business

loans.name: Alfiya's Group

texts.en:
Alfiya B., 41, is married to a private taxi-driver. The couple is raising four children, all of whom are pupils in school. 

Traditionally, almost all villagers breed livestock. Alfiya’s family follows this tradition and currently keeps five cows and 15 sheep. Ten years ago, they purchased three sheep and began to fatten them for resale. Currently, the family is being supported financially by Alfiya’s husband. Sometimes in order to get extra money, they have to sell one of their animals. 

The family is planning to purchase an allotment for building a house, thus they need to purchase building materials.

	 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Rady

texts.en:
Mrs. Rady S. (in the photo), 46 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Monh, 47 years old, live in a village along National Road Number Two about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1984 and have seven children - three sons and four daughters. One is married, another one is a garment factory worker and five attend school.

Rady is hired by manufacturers in her village to recycle. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to dig a well for family use, to fill up the land of her house's foundation and to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get to work.

loans.use: To dig a well for family use, to fill up the land of her house's foundation and to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get to work

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
46-year-old Elvira is an entrepreneur from the town of Banga. She is married and has 1 child. She is engaged in farming and particularly plants and harvests rice crops. While her husband does the primary farming duties, she spends time raising chickens. Elvira wishes to be a successful entrepreneur.

Elvira joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday N. is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 35 years old and married with three children — all of them in school. N. has a drug shop dealing in human drugs from Nyakabingo - Katonsi. He has a nurse who helps him attend to patients. His shop is located by the road side and he is able to make 500,000/= as monthly profits. He is grateful for the encouragement of friends and loans from Pearl which support his hard work and commitment. N. needs a loan to be able to purchase more stock to expand his business.

loans.use: Buying more medical supplies.

loans.name: Sergio Mario

texts.es:
El señor R. se dedica a la profesión de albañil con 20 años en esta profesión ,es el quinto crédito que trabaja con ceprodel este crédito lo solicita para cambiar el techo de su casa la cual es de teja y la cambiara por zinc 
Actualmente está casado con dos hijos su esposa es ama de casa 
Gracias a los créditos de ceprodel el señor R. ha logrado poco a poco ir cambiando su vivienda lo que ha permitido tener mayor seguridad para su familia
texts.en:
Mr. R. has worked as a bricklayer for 20 years.  This is his fifth loan through Ceprodel.  He plans to use the loan to change the tile roof he now has on his house for zinc roofing.

He is married, his wife being a homemaker, and they have two children.

Thanks to the loans through Ceprodel Mr. R. has been able to make home improvements which have allowed him to provide more safety for his family.

loans.use: To buy zinc roofing material

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia B. is from the village of Muñoz West. She is 50 years old. Nelia is married and has five children. To make a living, Nelia owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Nelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon K. is 55 years old and married to Sally Chepkosgei who is a house wife. They have 5 children, aged 21, 19, 14, 12 and 8 years old. Solomon owns a grocery in Ndurio trading centre and has been in business for a period of 6 years. His monthly income is KES 8,100.

Solomon has joined KADET LTD and taken a loan of KES 10,000, this being his first loan. He hopes to use the money to purchase onions, tomatoes and green vegetables for his business. The profits will be used to start a retail shop.

His dream is to educate his children to higher levels and also to prosper in the business.

loans.use: To add more retail inventory.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie M., 39 years old, is from the village of Bimonton, Mallig, Isabela. She is married and has an infant. Arcelie operates a specialized retail store, selling mobile electronic and card loads in the local community. Arcelie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Arcelie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arcelie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional mobile loads to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arcelie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional mobile loads to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 23 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Hace 5 años convive con Julio, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Harinson y Medaly; a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Antonio. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de papa y flor de gladiolo, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, ya que según menciona; los propios comercializadores de papa llegan a sus terrenos agrícolas para negociar su cosecha, mientras que la flor de gladiolo, lo vende en el mercado central de flores de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ayudar en los gastos familiares a su esposo; pues comparte el cuidado de sus 3 toros, con los que Julio hace el arado de la tierra, con el mantenimiento de sus terrenos agrícolas. Así ambos se organizan para poder tener ingresos extras y de esa manera poder ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos, a quienes desean brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe, pues le ayuda a invertir en el mejoramiento de sus cultivos. Angélica, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de 3 toros medianos los cuales criará y engordará para luego venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Angélica, 23, is a hard working woman.  She’s been living with Julio for five years.  They have two children: Harinson and Medaly, who she cares for in her own house located in the hamlet of San Antonio.  She’s been a farmer for three years.  Her main crops are potatoes and gladiolas which she cares for with much dedication because, as she mentions, the potato wholesalers come to her fields to negotiate for her crops; she sells the gladiolas at Tarma’s central flower market.


What she enjoys the most about her work is being able to help her husband with household expenses because she shares caring for their three bulls which Julio uses to till the soil and maintain his farmland.  This is how both of them organize themselves to earn extra income and save for their children’s future that they want to provide a better quality of life for.

She’s a member of the “Santa Rosa” communal bank and this is her third loan with MFP.  She’s grateful for the help she receives because it will help her invest in the improvement of her crops.  Angélica will use the requested loan to buy three medium size bulls that she’ll raise and fatten up to sell later at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy three bulls.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer who tills a plot of land in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He primarily grows rice crops to sell to the market. He plans to use his loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Michael is married and has children. He works hard to provide for his family. In the future, he hopes to see his children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Savith

texts.en:
Savith is a motor taxi driver. His wife sells corn and mango. They have five sons. One is a carpenter, three are in school, and the fifth one is still young. The family lives along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Savith hopes to change his business from motor taxi to tuk tuk (three-wheeled auto rickshaw), so he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a tuk tuk.

Photo: Savith and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras Santa Lucía se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Juana contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, se encuentran ya en el 7° ciclo.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
La presidenta, la sra. Juana se dedica a la venta de chipas por las calles de su ciudad, pues es un panificado típico de su país muy consumido en cualquier punto de Paraguay.
Ella aprendió a realizar este producto con ayuda de su madre y lo ha vuelto en su medio de ingresos.
