Es soltera y la única que genera ingresos para sus gastos, tanto personales como familiares ya que es independiente. Vive en la zona de Tacagua en alquiler.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, las ganas de superarse e incrementar sus ingresos de dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (tela, hilos, y logotipos).
texts.en:
Miriam is the administrator of a fitness club and she makes sporting goods for members of the club.

She is single and hers is the only source of income for her expenses, for herself and for her family. She lives in the region of Tacagua in Alquiler.

It is the first time she requests a loan. She has great energy to improve her circumstances and increase her income, all thanks to this loan.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of materials (fabric, threads, and logo decals).


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Nanou

texts.fr:
Mariée et âgée de 52 ans, Madame Nanou Koné(mère de 4 enfants) vit  dans une famille polygame avec sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Koulikoro de la préfecture de koutiala( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Depuis sa tendre enfance elle commence les activités génératrices de revenus de toutes sortes, mais décide finalement de se spécialiser dans l’achat vente du Sounbala (un condiment alimentaire naturel aux vertus multiples fabriquées avec les noix de néré) qu’elle apprena très tôt auprès de sa grand mère (comme la plupart des femmes de son ethnie : les Minianka). Elle exerce cette activité à son domicile il y a de cela 20 ans.
Pour obtenir des ressources financières complémentaires elle décida de faire recourt à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  tous ses  précédents( trois prêts solidaires  et deux prêts individuels) elle est à son troisième prêt individuel.
 Madame Nanou compte acheter avec ce prêt, 40 paniers de Soumbala semi transformé à Koutiala lors des foires hebdomadaires auprès des transformatrices  venant des villages. Après  elle à son tour les transforme definitivement à sa manière et de façon plus présentable avec plusieurs employées. Elle vend ses marchandises dans la ville de Bamako (capitale du Mali ) et koutiala à une clientèle  feminine,  au comptant ou à crédit.. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 140.000FCFA qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux charges des  enfants. Elle envisage  chercher une place au marché Dabanani de Bamako afin d’élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
Married and 52 years old, Mrs. Nanou Koné (mother of 4) lives in a polygamous family with her co-wife and their children in the Koulikoro neighborhood in the Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). From a tender age, she began all sorts of businesses, but finally decided to specialize in the buying and selling of Soumbala (a natural seasoning of multiple virtues made from the African locust nut) which she learned early on from her grandmother (as do most women of her ethnicity: the Minianka). She has been selling out of her home for 20 years. To secure complementary financial resources, she has turned to microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the last 4 years. After having properly repaid her previous loans (3 group loans and 2 individual loans), she is on her third individual loan. Mrs. Nanou plans to buy with this loan 40 baskets of semi-transformed Soumbala in Koutiala at the weekly fairs from women coming from the villages. Afterwards, she fully transforms it in her way to make it more presentable with several employees. She sells her goods in the city of Bamako (capital of Mali) and Koutiala to a female clientele for cash or credit. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 140,000 CFA francs, which she plans to use to repay the loan and take care of her children. She plans to look for a spot at the Dabanani market in Bamako in order to grow her business.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy goods (Soumbala)

loans.name: Uldash

texts.ru: Мамадаминов Юлдош житель города Яван. Проживает со своей семьей . Возраст 66 лет. Имеет шестерых детей. Дети уже довольно взрослые и помогают отцу. Занимаются все вместе земледелием. Имеют арендованный участок земли, который засеивают пшеницей. Планируемый кредит хотят использовать для покупки семян и удобрений. Полученный урожай  реализуют на рынке и смогут получить неплохой доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Uldash M. resides in the town of Yavan, where he lives with his family. He is 66 years old and has six grown children who help their father. Together, they farm a rented parcel of land, which they sow with wheat. They want to use the loan to purchase seed and fertilizer. The harvest will be sold in the market for a reasonable profit. Uldash will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sodikjon

texts.ru:
Дододжонов Содикджон Махмуджонович, 1983 года рождения. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность он  начала в 2004 году, с продажи хозтоваров. Он торгует на магазине «Детский мир», отдел парфюмерий города Вахдат. Содикджон хорошо разбирается в одеколонах, при покупке его товаров он рекомендует своим клиентам при выборе. У него много клиентов, особенно в предпраздничные дни как День Влюбленных-14 февраля,  день Национальной Армии-23 февраля, Международный Женский день-8 марта. В его ассортименте имеются  духи,  одеколоны, шампуни, косметички, лак для ногтей и волос, мусс и  т.д.
Свой товар Содикджон закупает у оптовиков. В момент праздничных сезонов ему необходимы дополнительные средства для покупки подарочного набора духов для женщин и мужчин. Для этого он хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Sodikjon D. was born in 1983. He has been in business of selling perfumes and cosmetics since 2004. Sodikjon is an expert vendor and often recommends specific products to his many customers. Sodikjon's sales peak on holidays such as Valentine's Day (February 14), National Army Day (February 23), and International Women's Day (March 8). Sodikjon needs this loan to purchase additional inventory of gift sets for the holidays.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfume gift sets

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia C. is 61-year-old married mother of five. Her husband and some of her sons drive a "tricycle," a small motorcycle with an attached sidecar that's used as a taxi to haul people and goods. Much of the family's household income comes from tricycle driving, but Cornelia also has a fish-vending business.

Cornelia plans to use most of the money from this loan to put a down payment on a motorbike and buy a sidecar for it, and will use the rest for her fish-selling venture.

Cornelia hopes to be able to provide for her children and their families. Her dream is to see all of her grandchildren attend college.

loans.use: To put a down payment on a motorcycle, buy a sidecar for the motorcycle, and to provide capital for fish vending

loans.name: Ilolo Group

texts.en:
Faines has sold maize and snacks in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Each day she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize and snacks to sell in her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Faines is 45 years old, married, and has 7 children, between the ages of 25 and 17. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Niku and Veronica Telesia. Each woman also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: Buy more maize and snacks to sell

loans.name: Lilieni

texts.en: Lilieni T., 22, is married with 2 children.  She has many years of experience in the baking business. She sells to the villagers and the general public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Lilieni’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase cement for the stove, pots, trays for baking, sack of flour, sack of sugar, supplies for baking.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Featured in this story is Mrs. Rosita Q. G., 59 years old and a resident of P5 Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married to Mr. Vicente G. and is blessed with six children, five of whom are grown with their own families.

As a young woman growing up in a poor family, she worked as a vendor of malagkit rice cake, locally known as “puto maya." At 21, in the mid-1960s, she got married and started a little sari-sari store business with a starting capital of P500.00. Today, her business is still progressing. With the help of her husband’s income from farming (tenanted Riceland, one-quarter hectare), she has been able to send their children to school and even to college.

Now she’s applying for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000.00, primarily for additional capital for her sari-sari store, with the remaining amount to be used for the purchase of feed for her pigs.

Her future dream is to run a big grocery store and to become a wholesaler of soft-drinks someday. She is also hoping that her daughter will finish her nursing course in the near future.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store.

location.town: Ozamis-P5 Gango, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
"I started tilling a small parcel of rice farm. I am also a tricycle driver. When I am not busy driving, I check the farm to ensure a good harvest for our family," says Mr. Robert M., 32-year-old father of two children.

He is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from CEVI. He plans to use the loan to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizers. The loan will really help increase his harvest and income as well.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase 2 sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: 16 De Mayo Group

texts.es: El grupo “16 D. Mayo” es un grupo nuevo que esta conformado por 15 integrantes representados por la señora Rosa, todos los integrantes residen en el mismo barrio por lo que se conocen entre si. La mayoría D. las socias destinaran el crédito a la ampliación sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. productos como comida, pan, dulces, cosméticos por catálogos, leche y para la compra D. materiales e insumos para mejorar sus trabajos D. construcción D. viviendas. El nivel competitivo en el mercado es alto pera los socias del grupo saben como salir adelante ya que el sustento D. sus familias dependen D. la venta diaria D. sus puestos D. trabajos. A pesar D. ser un grupo nuevo tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital con la cual se encuentran comprometidos a seguir adelante y cumplir con sus cuotas así mismo ayudar en su entorno familiar.
texts.en:
The “16 D. Mayo” group is a new group. There are 15 members in the group and Mrs. Rosa is their representative. All of the group’s members live in the same neighborhood, so they know each other. Most of the members plan to use the loan money to grow their small business, business that sell products like; food, bread, sweets, cosmetics by catalog, and milk. They will also use the money to buy supplies to help with their home improvement projects. The market is competitive, but the group’s members know how to get ahead since their family’s depend on daily sales from their jobs. In spite of being a new group, they are experienced in solidarity groups thanks to loans and institutions similar to Agrocapital Foundation. This is the foundation they are working with, so they can get ahead and make their payments -- helping their whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen M. D. C. is 48 years old and married to Mr. Ramon C., 55. They have three older children. Carmen owns a small grocery store that is located in the city Union. It is a well-stocked store, attracting a large clientele.  She has a substantial income from this business as well as excellent references, both professional and personal. 

She has a project to expand her store to a mini supermarket that is well-stocked, as she already has many clients.  She would also like to her expand her business space.

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Esther Kiden’S Group

texts.en: Esther is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 30 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 12 years. All of her children go to school. She resides in a rented a two-roomed house where she is staying with seven people. Esther takes care of four additional family members. There is electricity, but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Esther fries groundnuts and distributes them to different shops. At times, she gives the product to young boys who sell them by Kampa city roads. She uses public transport to and from shopping and goes for shopping daily from producers in the industrial area. She sells to an average of 20 people a day, all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Esther sells mainly on a retail basis and, at times, at her home in Mengo Kisenyi. Her major monthly expenses include school fees for her children, electricity and food. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Esther has been with MCDT for over 1 year and is servicing her second loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more groundnuts for resale. Esther is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and hopes to own a permanent business premise and her own home.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Salma Liaqat Group

texts.en:
I am Salma and I have been living in Borewala, Pakistan for 20 years. My husband, L., has a business selling chicken in the market. He has been in this profession for 5 years. I am applying for a loan to buy chicken for my husband’s business.

This loan group consists of two additional people. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
 
Salma baji is seated in the center of the bajis in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chickens for a chicken business

loans.name: Beknazar

texts.ru: Холназаров Бекназар проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 27 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. По специальности Бекназар более 5 лет работал "строителем". Вот более 2 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает и продает на рынке бахчевые растения. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота, т.е. для посева нового урожая.
texts.en:
Beknazar H. lives in the Rumy district. He is 27 years old, married and has 5 children. Beknazar spent over 5 years working in his profession as a construction worker. He has been involved in agriculture for over 2 years now. He grows melon plants and sells them at a market. He is requesting a loan to increase product turnover, i.e. to plant the new crop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting new crop

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad, es un cliente relativamente nueva,  trabajo mas de cuatro secuencias  con la institución y demostro responsabilidad y puntualidad, al momento de la visita demostro que tiene buena actitud y buen caracter el cliente, la Señora Felicidad se dedica a la venta de articulos de ferreteria, ella tiene su puesto fijo en la feria de la 16 de julio,  los dias jueves y domingo, tambien distribuye de forma ambulante en la diferentes ferias de El Alto, la señora compra los articulos de ferreteria por mayor y ella los vende al detalle de esa forma le sale un margen de ganancia. Su esposo Martin Mamani Matha se dedica a la albañileria,los trabajos que su esposos realiza son eventuales, la pareja actualmente tiene dos hijos sus dos hijos estan en colegio. La Sra. Felicidad invertira el préstamo en la compra articulos de ferreteria por mayor.
texts.en:
Felicidad is a relatively new member, having worked with the institution for four cycles; she has shown punctuality and responsibility and during the home visit was seen to have a positive attitude and a good client profile. Felicidad sells hardware supplies from a stall at the July 16th fair on Thursdays and Sundays. The rest of the time she travels to various other fairs in El Alto. She buys her supplies wholesale and resells them retail thereby increasing her profits. Her husband, Martin Mamani Matha, is a laborer who works occasionally. They currently have tho children who are in school. She will use these funds to purchase hardware supplies at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale hardware supplies.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Tanganyika borrower group in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 12, 8, 2 years old.

Sara has owned a Tailoring business for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Sara`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan,Sara hopes to save money, pay school fees  and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy morematerials for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C., 32, is one year older than her husband, Adrian C.. They have three children: Andrea Eliz, 10; Ariane, 8; and Aubrey, 1. These three little angels have been their inspiration to rise above poverty. As parents, they want to give their children a better future through education. That’s why she is helping her husband in earning income for their daily expenses. They have a fishing business. Her husband is the one who focuses on the business, while she helps him in his activities.

According to Elizabeth, her loan from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has helped them a lot in improving their business. Since she became a member, her income from her business has increased, and now they have more capital to buy daily necessities. She will use her 5th loan again to buy things needed in expanding their fish cage.

Elizabeth together with her husband hopes that their children will finish their studies; they believe in the saying "Education is the key to success." They hope that someday their children will take the initiative to make their house bigger and better.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la cuidad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 50 años, es madre D. ocho hijos, todos mayores D. edad. Victoria se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en general, tiene una tienda en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días D. la semana, también venD. salchipollo (comida rápida) por las noches, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se desempeña como profesor en una escuela primaria. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Loreto” desD. hace ocho años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas, refrescos y  yogurt.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles, para comprar artículos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos y otros productos mas para vender. La meta D. Victoria es ampliar su negocio y  vender también artículos D. ferretería.
texts.en:
Victoria is a very hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 50 and has eight grown children. Victoria sells general groceries. She has a store in her house. She works in the store every day of the week. She also sells “salchipollo” (a fast food dish with chicken) in the evenings. She has her husband’s support. He is a teacher in an elementary school. She has been part of the Loreto Communal Bank for eight years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to buy soft drinks and yogurt. She currently needs a loan for 1,000 to buy articles like rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, and other products to sell. Victoria’s goal is to expand her business and also sell hardware.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, and others

loans.name: Guapay Sur Group

texts.es: El grupo “Guapay Sur” esta representado por la señora Ana Barbara y conformada por 13 miembros D. amigas y socias muy unidas, activas, emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades para confraternizar y así unirse mas como grupo. La actividad principal D. todas las socias es la venta D. ropa, pero también venden comida, empanadas, zapatos, juegos, queso y cosméticos por catalogo en sus tiempos libres. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que constantemente  generan el movimiento económico necesario para la subsistencia D. sus familias, en caso D. que no les vaya bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugar o diversifican su actividad económica D. forma que puedan cumplir con las necesidades D. sus hijos. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. mercadería en desaguadero y la adquisición D. insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor producto y una mejor ganancia para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.  En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
The group "Guapay Sur" is represented by Mrs. Ana Barbara and maD. up of 13 members, who are very close friends and partners. They are very active and enterprising people that desire to perform activities in order to become closer friends and therefore more united as a group. The main activity of these partners is the sale of clothing, but they also sell food, empanadas, shoes, games, and cosmetics by catalogue in their free time. In regard to the competitive environment, we can mention that although competitors are present in their neighborhood, our partners have faithful clients that constantly generate the necessary economic activity for the subsistence of their families. In the case that things aren't going well in their neighborhood, they direct themselves to another place or they diversify their economic activity in a way that they can fulfill their childrens' needs. This credit will be used for the purchase of merchandise in the city of Desaguadero and the acquisition of materials and tools that will help them generate a better product and greater earnings to be able to proviD. their families a higher quality of life. As for experience with credit, our partners have received financing from similar institutions, but this is the first time they have worked with an institution that provides them confidence and economic support, for which they desire to continue growing together with us.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and merchandise

loans.name: Letty Yorlita

texts.es:
La señora Letty V. es socia del Banco Comunal de Jave Jireh en Portoviejo.  Las socias de éste banco son muy cristianas y dedicadas a sus trabajos.  Portoviejo es la capital provincial de Manabí en la costa de Ecuador.  La provincia es conocida por su  gastronomía (mariscos) y la Ruta del Sol con sus  hermosas playas.

Letty tiene 42 años y tiene 4 hijos de 7, 12, 18 y 23 años de edad.  Su esposo, Benito Ruiz  es un obrero en Portoviejo.  Ellos tienen su casa propia en la Ciudad  La Fátima.  Ella es costurera de ropa deportiva dese hace 15 años y su hijo les ayuda con la venta a sus amigos en el colegio. Debido a  la crisis financiera del mundo sus ventas han reducido un poco y para resolver ese desafío, ella ha empezado con la costura de ropa para fiestas como vestidos para  quinceañeras y otros compromisos.

 Con el crédito solicitado  ella va a comprar materiales como telas, encajes, hijos, cierres, etc.  para la confección de sus prendas  de vestir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Letty V. is a member of the communal bank Jave Jireh in Portoviejo. The members of this bank are all Christian and dedicated to their work. Portoviejo is the provincial capital of Manabi on the Ecuadorian coast. The province is known for its food (seafood), and la Ruta del Sol, with its beautiful beaches.

Letty is 42 years old, and has four children who are 7, 12, 18, and 23 years old. Her husband, Benito Ruiz, is a worker in Portoviejo. They have their own house in the city of La Fátima.

She has been sewing athletic clothes for 15 years, and her son helps her to sell to his friends at school. Due to the world-wide financial crisis, her sales have been down a little. To overcome this challenge, she has started to sew clothing for parties, like dresses for quinceañeras (coming of age celebrations) and other events.

With the loan she requested, she will buy materials like fabric, lace, thread, zippers, etc. to make her clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, lace, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Yudaya Matovu

texts.en:
Yudaya Matovu N. is forty-six years old. She is married and has six children, four of whom attend school. 

She has owned a grocery store for seven years. She is using her loan to purchase more groceries, such as rice, sugar, soap, and salt, and a refrigerator for cold drinks. Her dream is to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy groceries and a refrigerator for cold drinks

loans.name: Fray

texts.es:
Fray V. G. es señor de 43 años de edad, el cual vive   con su esposa y su hijo, en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Don Fray  se dedica a la producción de leche como una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contento porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante. Comenta que la producción de leche la vende a la planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce.

Don Fray desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢640.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar  medicamentos, utensilios y una vaca lechera más ya que así prodrá aumentar la producción de leche ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante esto es una de las cosas que lo motiva a esforzarse y trabajar con mucho esmero. 

Don Fray es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Fray V. G. is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and son in a community called El Sauce in Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Province of Cartago. This is a small rural community with around two thousand people. They are work producing milk and growing coffee. It has an irregular terrain and a lot of it is maintained as humid tropical forest. The community has traditional landscapes that mix with the tropical forest, with two nice lagoons, coffee plantations and milk factories. El Sauce is located about an hour and a half from Turrialba, the closest commercial center. However, several times a year, the road is closed due to the heavy rain in the area. This is without a doubt one of the main challenges of the community. When there was nothing to do in town, a lot of people decided to go to Turrialba for work or to banana farms in the Atlantic coast in Costa Rica. Right now, coffee and milk prices have improves, so the neighbors are looking for ways to invest their money in the area and avoid migrations. Fray is a milk producer. This way he obtains an income to support his family. He says he's very happy because due to this project he has been able to make a living. He sells his milk to the cheese manufacturing company that works for the El Sauce’s Milk Producer’s Association. Fray would like to get a ¢640.00 loan (six hundred and forty colones) to purchase a milking cow and increase the production of milk. He wants to be a successful entrepreneur to help his family. This motivates him to make sacrifices and work hard. Fray is a member of the El Sauce Farmers Association, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan. He hopes to continue growing at a personal level and financial level. He also believes it’s important to mention that thanks to these type of organizations she is able to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Jesus Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Jesus Alejandro C. vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos.
Como desea tener su propia casa vivienda está tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (crédito gubernamental) pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que el puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo.
El trabajo en una fábrica en el departamento de mantenimiento a la maquinaria, con una parte de su ingreso separa para pagar el crédito.
Portal motivo el solicita el préstamo para completar su crédito Gubernamental y así adquirir su casa. Desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus Alejandro C. lives in a borrowed house with his wife and two children. He wants to have his own house and is negotiating with INFONAVIT (government subsidized housing loan). However, the value of the house is higher than the loan he qualifies for because his salary is low; he works in a factory in the machine service department. He sets aside part of his income to pay the loan. For this reason, he is asking for funding to make up the difference between the government loan and the down payment required so that he can afford the house. He hopes to establish secure equity for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the difference in down payment cost of a house through INFONAVIT.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla O. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Priscilla is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Priscilla owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Priscilla has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Priscilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscilla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Priscilla from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Naisha

texts.es:
Naisha es una joven muy alegre de 18 años, es madre de un pequeño de un año y vive con su madre Teófila de 53 años. Su casa es alquilada y está ubicada en la selva central del Perú.
Su deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su hijo, es lo que le motiva a diario a salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades que se le presentan. A su corta edad es consiente de que ser padre y madre es muy difícil y sacrificado, pero no quiere pasar sus días lamentándose por eso. Desde hace 6 meses, gracias a la ayuda de su madre, instaló un negocio de comestibles en el domicilio donde vive. Lo que más le gusta es atender y sugerir algunos productos a su clientela, pero lo que le disgusta despertarse temprano y dormir muy tarde. 
“Nada es imposible, por eso en el transcurso del año he pensado en ampliar mi bodega con productos novedosos y requeridos en el mercado” comenta; a la vez que afirma que la mejor decisión que tomó en su vida es emprender su propio negocio, ya que percibe ingresos económicos diarios y bastante rentables, pues logra vivir cómodamente, sin pasar necesidades.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sus compañeros de grupo le explicaron en qué consiste el trabajo en su banco comunal, por lo que ella asegura que le agrada y será puntual en sus pagos como ellos. Con los setecientos soles que solicita piensa comprar varios sacos de menestras (garbanzo, lentejas, pallar y arbeja verde) para vender por kilos en su tienda.
texts.en:
Naisha is a happy 18 year old woman. She is the mother of a one year old baby and lives with her 53 year old mother Teófila. They live in a rented home which is located in Peru’s central jungle. Her desire to provide the best for her son is what motivates her to come out ahead daily, despite the difficulties she faces. Being so young, she knows how difficult it can be to be both a mother and a father, and that it involves great sacrifice, but she refuses to spend her days feeling sorry for herself. Six months ago she started a small grocery store in her home, thanks to her mother’s help. She enjoys helping her customers and suggesting products to them, but she doesn’t like having to get up early and go to bed late. “Nothing is impossible, so I plan to expand my shop this year and include new products for which there is a demand,” she says as she reiterates that starting her business was the best decision she has ever made in her life, now that she brings in a steady income daily, which allows her to live comfortably without missing any necessities. This is her first loan through MFP. Her friends in the group explained to her how a communal bank works, for which she is grateful and promises to make her payments on time, like the rest of the members. She will use the money from this loan of 700 PEN ($250) to buy sacs of dried beans (chick peas, lentils, grass peas) to sell by the kilogram in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Armando Ciriaco

texts.es: Armando Ciriaco de 36 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Lourdes Lopez, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor que le ayuda con el cuido dela finca y el ganado y los 2 menores estudiando la primaria.  Esta solicitando su 5to credito a esta institucion para el cultivo de 10 mnz de platanos para posteriormente comercializarlos a un buen precio que le permita obtener ganancias que le permitan brindarle a su familia mejores concidiciones de vida.  Adicionalmente se dedica a la ganaderia obteniendo otros ingresos que le permiten el sustento familiar.  En su comonidad don Armando es conocido como un hombre honrado, honesto, y trabajador.
texts.en:
Armando Ciriaco is 36 years old. He is married to Lourdes Lopez and they have 3 children. The oldest helps Armando with the care of the farm and livestock and the 2 youngest study at primary school. Armando is seeking his 5th loan with this institution to cultivate 10 mnz of plantains to later sell them at a good price, which permits him to obtain earnings that allow him to bestow better living conditions on his family. Additionally he also breeds livestock, earning more income which allows him to sustain his family. Don Armando is known in his community as an honorable, honest and hard-working man.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cultivate plantains

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran is 49-year old woman, married with four children. She lives in a city named Pakpattan, in Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrines.

Naziran is also a very hardworking lady. She runs a sewing clothes business. She does this work to improve the standard of living. She saves her income in a committee and has a plan to marry off her elder son with the amount.

Her husband name is M. S. and has a food stand in the market. He has been doing this work for over 15 years. He learned cooking from his mother and then took it as a profession. He feels good when the customers praise about his food. 

Naziran is applying for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 15,000 which she will be used to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and rice etc) to increase her husband’s food selling business.

She has four other women in her loan group. Maqsooda yasmeen wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Firdous baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Faizan baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.use: To buy material for food selling buisness

loans.name: Guillermo José

texts.es:
El Señor Guillermo José G. H., tiene 65 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles norte, es soltero y tiene dos hijos pero no dependen económicamente de él, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y uno está en el exterior del país, él es jubilado pero su profesión es técnico de  cocina.

Dentro de sus principales necesidades actualmente esta la reconstruccion de su porche, el credito lo ocuparia para la comprad e materiales de construccion con el objeto de realizar las edificaciones, espera se le brinde un apoyo economico para habitar sus dias en un lugar mas comodo y seguro.
texts.en:
Mr. Guillermo José G. H. is 65 years old. He lives in the Barrio Laureles north. He is single and has two children but they do not depend on him financially. His children are adults and one is abroad. He is retired but his profession is that of a kitchen technician. Among his main needs at present is the reconstruction of his porch. He would use the loan to purchase construction materiales with the purpose of undertaking the construction. He hopes you offer him financial support in order to spend his days in a more comfortable and safer place.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reconstruction of his home's porch

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.pt:
Deolinda M. B., nasceu no distrito de zavala, província de inhambane sul de Moçambique. Tem 48 anos de idade vive maritalmente e mãe de 10 filhos com idades compreendidas os entre os 12 a 35 anos, somente os 5 mais novos e que vão a escola. Faz a 4 classe e teve que interromper quando seu pai perde a vida. Vive na casa própria com sua família e não responsabiliza se por ninguém.

Sai de inhambane para namaacha quando seu esposo e transferido em emisao de serviço onde veio fixar sua casa onde vivem ate então. Tem um negocio próprio a mais de 20 anos, não tem empregados conta somente com ajuda do seu marido, Vende mais farinha de milho, tomate e cebola onde consegue um rendimento de 5.000.00mt e aplica na sua obra. Não consegue poupar nenhum valor e conta com ajuda do seu marido que e pensionista.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições, conhece a hluvuku através da amiga que e nossa cliente, este e o segundo empréstimo na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade aumentando assim o volume do seu stock.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais outros. Sonha ter uma mercearia própria. Vai solicitar mais empréstimos para habitação da sua casa.
texts.en:
Deolinda M. B. was born in the district of Zavala, Inhambane Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 48 years old and married, with 10 children between the ages of 12 and 25. Only the five youngest go to school. She finished fourth grade but had to stop when her father passed away. She lives in her own house with her family, and is not financially responsible for anyone else. She moved from Inhambane to Namaacha when her husband was transferred, and they set up a new home where they still live today. She's had her own business for more than 20 years. She doesn't have employees, and relies on her husband for assistance. She sells cornmeal, tomatoes, and onions, and brings in about 5000 meticals, which she reinvests in her business. She is not able to save anything and depends on her husband's pension. She's never had loans with other institutions. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client. This is her second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. She is requesting 15,000 meticals to buy essentials and increase the amount of stock she can carry. She's committed to paying this loan off on time so that she'll be eligible for others in the future. Her dream is to have her own shop, and will request additional loans to prepare a space in her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cornmeal, tomatoes, onions, and other products

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos  en el caserío Lagunas del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población situada en áreas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura y la crianza de animales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella atiende las necesidades de sus clientes los cuales siempre acuden a su establecimiento para adquirir productos de consumo diario que no pueden obtener facilmente dado que se encuentran alejados del pueblo de Mórrope. Este negocio le provee de ingresos con los que ayuda a su esposo a sostener la economía de su familia, ya que los ingresos que este percibe como agricultor no son permanentes.

La vivienda en la que reside se ha visto afectada por las lluvias que se presentaron durante los pasados meses, ella desea reparar estas fallas para vivir de un modo mas seguro y también desea invertir parte del dinero en la compra de productos con los cuales pueda ampliar su negocio, para lograr este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Virginia es una mujer entregada a su familia y que siempre trabaja para ayudarlos a salir adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Virginia, 35, lives with her husband and children in the Lagunas settlement in Mórrope district, a district known for having most of its residents in rural areas that are quite separated from each other. Its principal commercial activities are farming and cattle-raising. It is part of Lambayeque province and it is located an hour and fifteen minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For over three years she has sold basic needs items and groceries in a store set up in her home. She tends to the needs of her customers who always visit her establishment looking for items of daily consumption that they can’t get conveniently because they are so far from the town of Mórrope. The store provides income that helps her husband support the family because his earnings as a farmer aren’t reliable. Their home has been adversely affected by the rains that occurred these past few months. She wants to repair the damages so that they can live more securely. She also wants to invest part of the funds purchasing some stock items for the store. To reach these goals she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa to request a 2000 new sol loan. Virginia is dedicated to her family and always strives to help them get ahead in life. She has collaborated with our institution in the past and has shown herself to be responsible and punctual with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair rain damage to her house.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité Renacer nace hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de Barcequillo, en este periodo de dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
Una de las trabajadoras es la señora Idalina quien se dedica a la venta de alimentos.
Los alimentos que elaborados por ella los vende a personas que circulan por su casa, entre los preparados se puede mencionar la empanada, milanesas, caldos de pescados, locros, bori-bori y otros.
La preparación de todos los alimentos requiere de mucha inversión en cuanto al gas que la señora usa, por este motivo ella desea compra una cocina eléctrica con planchas de  dos hornallas  ya que este no consumiría  mucha energía.
texts.en:
The “Renacer” (To be Reborn) committee was born over two years ago thanks to the initiative and support from another committee active in that place at that time. This committee is in Barcequillo and during these two years of intense work they have grown both socially and economically; they are known there for being very hard-working women. One of the workers is Idalina who sells prepared food to people who pass by her house. Among the items she prepares are: turnovers, breaded steaks, fish stews, locros (a stew composed chiefly of winter squash, potatoes, tender corn, meat or fish), bori-bori (a chicken soup with corn dumplings), etc. Preparation of all these dishes requires a heavy investment due to gas consumption. Because of this, she wants to buy an electric stove with two-burner slates because they will not use as much energy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an electric stove.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita A. is 62 years old, married, and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and four children. To provide additional profits for her family, Cristita is opening a local sari-sari (variety) store in her neighborhood.

Cristita would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory including 10 sacks of rice, sugar, five sacks of charcoal, and inventory of other foodstuff for her store. Cristita believes in offering a relevant variety and inventory of goods in her store for customers looking for convenient purchases, and to attract more customers in local community. As a good member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Cristita is thankful for the access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.

Her long term goals are to develop her retail business, finance the college education of her four children, and support her family morally and financially.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to win more business with her new entrepreneurial effort.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her variety store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es enfermera y estudio en la prestigiosa Universidad San Antonio Abad del Cusco. Actualmente, la socia trabaja en el colegio San José de la Sallé. Ya son 6 años que trabaja atendiendo a los alumnos, Margarita trabaja en dos turnos, el primer turno empieza a las 9 de mañana hasta las 12 del medio día y el segundo turno empieza a las 3 de la tarde hasta las 4 de la tarde, ella trabaja todos los días. 

Margarita nos cuenta que en el colegio dictaron clases de manualidades y la socia participo en las clases y entonces le enseñaron a confeccionar peluches.

Margarita es socia nueva en el banco comunal y requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar peluches como por ejemplo tela peluche, hilos, agujas y moldes. El sueño de la socia es abrir una tienda de peluches.
texts.en:
Margarita is 31, married, and has two children. She is a nurse and studied at the prestigious University of San Antonio Abad of Cusco. Currently the member works at the San José de la Sallé school. She has been there for 6 years taking care of the students. Margarita works on two shifts: the first shift begins at 9 in the morning and finishes at 12 noon, and the second shift begins at 3 in the afternoon and finishes at 4 pm. She works every day. Margarita tells us that in the school classes are taught in different skills and this member took the classes and learned how to make stuffed animals. Margarita is a new member in the communal bank and needs the loan to buy materials to make the stuffed animals such as the fabric, thread, needles and patterns. This member's dream is to open a stuffed animal store.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make stuffed animals such as the fabric, thread, needles and patterns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire laborers for her farm and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: removed per borrower request

loans.name: Fuapine

texts.en: Fuapine F. is 48 and single with six children aged 2 to 6. She owns a business venture, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Fuapine needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or approximately US$130 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Fuapine joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda H. is a widow who lives in Prk. Bukang Liwayway, Brgy. Tanglaw, Puerto Princesa, Palawan. She earns her living by operating four business ventures: building rental, pension houses, tricycle operator and a general store. Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 23,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,800, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to pay for building maintenance that will be very helpful in her business and to continue to save up for future house renovation. Erlinda H. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Building maintenance

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucila   es viuda,  tiene un copetín y venta D. bebidas en el km 7_ Don Bosco, el trabajo D. la  misma es gratificante, ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad D. cliente, y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.

Con la ayuda D. su hija   están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
Hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresaria exitosa y en constante progreso.
Es muy cumplidora con sus compromisos por lo que merece el debido apoyo para seguir creciendo.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra D. bebidas.
texts.en:
Lucila is widowed and has a liquor store and drink sales business at the 7th kilometer of Don Bosco. She finds her work fulfilling, now that she has plenty of customers and a satisfying income. With the help of her daughter, a strong will, dedication, and hard work, they are getting ahead. She is established as a successful small company, and is constantly moving forward. [Lucila] always fulfills her commitments and is deserving of the support she needs to continue to grow. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drink inventory

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos quienes son su motivo de adoración. El trabajo al que se dedica Nelly, es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, en su bodega que tiene instalada en un espacio dentro de su casa. Cuando empezó con el comercio, se inició vendiendo medicamentos genéricos, pero lamentablemente no le fue nada bien, ya que aparecieron la grandes cadenas farmacéuticas. Desde entonces se vio en la necesidad de cambiar de rubro, es ahí cuando vende productos de primera necesidad, que hoy en día continua con la venta y le va muy bien, ya han transcurrido 20 años en esta labor y mantiene el mismo carisma y ganas de atender a su clientela, procurando además que su bodega esté más surtida. Para en el futuro, planea diversificar su negocio, con la instalación de un bazar – Librería. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y sabe que de tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, porque las integrantes son muy responsables y honestas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará arroz, azúcar, productos lácteos y sobre todo cerveza, ya que en la cerveza capta mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 40, is a hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and her three children who she adores. Nelly sells basic necessities from a store that is established in a designated space in her house. When she first started her business, Nelly sold generic medicines but did not do very well because she had to compete with the large pharmacy chains. Seeing the need to switch to another field, she began selling basic necessities and continues to do so today. Nelly has been in business now for 20 years and has done very well. She continues to possess a charismatic personality and the desire to serve her customers. In addition, she is always mindful of keeping her store well-stocked. Later on, Nelly wants to diversify her business by adding a bazaar and a bookstore.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP. Nelly knows that she must submit her payments on time and is willing to do so. She is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because the members are responsible and honest. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, dairy products, and beer so that she can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, dairy products, and beer

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en:
Mateo D. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 67 years old. Mateo is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Mateo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Mateo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mateo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mateo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mateo is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mateo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Zakaria Muteti

texts.en:
Zakaria has been repairing bicycles and motorbikes in Naivasha town for the last 10 years. He is 48 years old, married to Ruth Nduku and they have 2 children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more spare parts for his shop.

In the future, Zakaria hopes to open a bigger motorcycle repair shop and also be a supplier of spare parts to other repair shops within Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma D. C., age 40, provides manicure and pedicure services in her local community in the village of Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Wilma and her husband have six school-aged children. 
 
In 2007, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide services. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase necessary materials. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Wilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide manicure and pedicure services

loans.name: Roselfina

texts.es: Roselfina tiene 29 años de edad, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años trabaja en las tareas del campo, ella es una emergente agricultora y ganadera, posee vacas y una granja de cuyes, a lo que cuida todas las mañanas, alimentándolos y limpiando su granja. Para ella es muy importante que estos animales tengan el peso exacto, de eso depende para que los pueda vender rápidamente. Por otro lado, la leche que extrae de su vaca, es vendida,  de esa manera obtiene ingresos adicionales. Asimismo cuida de sus cultivos de alfalfa, ya que este producto sirve de forraje para sus animales. Por ahora su prioridad es ampliar la granja de cuyes. Es su crédito número 9 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa y maíz,  así como también en la compra de un toro.
texts.en:
Roselfina is 29 years of age and lives with her husband and three children in her own home. She has been working in rural activities for five years and is an emerging crop and livestock farmer. She owns cattle and a guinea pig farm which she tends to every morning, feeding the animals and cleaning their farm. She considers it very important that these animals have the exact weight so that she will be able to sell them quickly. In addition, the milk she derives from her cattle is sold and in this way she earns an additional income. Likewise she also looks after her alfalfa crops since this product is used as forage for her animals. 

Right now her priority is to expand the guinea pig farm. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she also appreciates being part of her communal bank since all the members are responsible and mutually supportive persons. She also thanks all the people who will be originators of the loan she seeks as it will be very useful to her in the development of her business. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of bags of fertilizer for planting alfalfa and corn as well as for the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer for her corn and alfalfa crops. She would also like to buy a bull.
